Description:Attempt to free released memory

50/*
51 * Structure that stores information about a highlight group.
52 * The ID of a highlight group is also called group ID. It is the index in
53 * the highlight_ga array PLUS ONE.
54 */
55struct hl_group {
56 char_u *sg_name; /* highlight group name */
57 char_u *sg_name_u; /* uppercase of sg_name */
58 /* for normal terminals */
59 int sg_term; /* "term=" highlighting attributes */
60 char_u *sg_start; /* terminal string for start highl */
61 char_u *sg_stop; /* terminal string for stop highl */
62 int sg_term_attr; /* Screen attr for term mode */
63 /* for color terminals */
64 int sg_cterm; /* "cterm=" highlighting attr */
65 int sg_cterm_bold; /* bold attr was set for light color */
66 int sg_cterm_fg; /* terminal fg color number + 1 */
67 int sg_cterm_bg; /* terminal bg color number + 1 */
68 int sg_cterm_attr; /* Screen attr for color term mode */
69 /* Store the sp color name for the GUI or synIDattr() */
70 int sg_gui; /* "gui=" highlighting attributes */
71 char_u *sg_gui_fg_name; /* GUI foreground color name */
72 char_u *sg_gui_bg_name; /* GUI background color name */
73 char_u *sg_gui_sp_name; /* GUI special color name */
74 int sg_link; /* link to this highlight group ID */
75 int sg_set; /* combination of SG_* flags */
76 scid_T sg_scriptID; /* script in which the group was last set */
77};
78
79#define SG_TERM1 1 /* term has been set */
80#define SG_CTERM2 2 /* cterm has been set */
81#define SG_GUI4 4 /* gui has been set */
82#define SG_LINK8 8 /* link has been set */
83
84// highlight groups for 'highlight' option
85static garray_T highlight_ga = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE{ 0, 0, 0, 1, ((void*)0) };
86
87#define HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data))) ((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))
88
89#define MAX_HL_ID20000 20000 /* maximum value for a highlight ID. */
90
91/* different types of offsets that are possible */
92#define SPO_MS_OFF0 0 /* match start offset */
93#define SPO_ME_OFF1 1 /* match end offset */
94#define SPO_HS_OFF2 2 /* highl. start offset */
95#define SPO_HE_OFF3 3 /* highl. end offset */
96#define SPO_RS_OFF4 4 /* region start offset */
97#define SPO_RE_OFF5 5 /* region end offset */
98#define SPO_LC_OFF6 6 /* leading context offset */
99#define SPO_COUNT7 7
100
101/* Flags to indicate an additional string for highlight name completion. */
102static int include_none = 0; /* when 1 include "nvim/None" */
103static int include_default = 0; /* when 1 include "nvim/default" */
104static int include_link = 0; /* when 2 include "nvim/link" and "clear" */
105
106/*
107 * The "term", "cterm" and "gui" arguments can be any combination of the
108 * following names, separated by commas (but no spaces!).
109 */
110static char *(hl_name_table[]) =
111{"bold", "standout", "underline", "undercurl",
112 "italic", "reverse", "inverse", "NONE"};
113static int hl_attr_table[] =
114{HL_BOLD0x02, HL_STANDOUT0x20, HL_UNDERLINE0x08, HL_UNDERCURL0x10, HL_ITALIC0x04, HL_INVERSE0x01,
115 HL_INVERSE0x01, 0};
116
117/*
118 * The patterns that are being searched for are stored in a syn_pattern.
119 * A match item consists of one pattern.
120 * A start/end item consists of n start patterns and m end patterns.
121 * A start/skip/end item consists of n start patterns, one skip pattern and m
122 * end patterns.
123 * For the latter two, the patterns are always consecutive: start-skip-end.
124 *
125 * A character offset can be given for the matched text (_m_start and _m_end)
126 * and for the actually highlighted text (_h_start and _h_end).
127 */
128typedef struct syn_pattern {
129 char sp_type; /* see SPTYPE_ defines below */
130 char sp_syncing; /* this item used for syncing */
131 int sp_flags; /* see HL_ defines below */
132 int sp_cchar; /* conceal substitute character */
133 struct sp_syn sp_syn; /* struct passed to in_id_list() */
134 short sp_syn_match_id; /* highlight group ID of pattern */
135 char_u *sp_pattern; /* regexp to match, pattern */
136 regprog_T *sp_prog; /* regexp to match, program */
137 syn_time_T sp_time;
138 int sp_ic; /* ignore-case flag for sp_prog */
139 short sp_off_flags; /* see below */
140 int sp_offsets[SPO_COUNT7]; /* offsets */
141 short *sp_cont_list; /* cont. group IDs, if non-zero */
142 short *sp_next_list; /* next group IDs, if non-zero */
143 int sp_sync_idx; /* sync item index (syncing only) */
144 int sp_line_id; /* ID of last line where tried */
145 int sp_startcol; /* next match in sp_line_id line */
146} synpat_T;
147
148
149typedef struct syn_cluster_S {
150 char_u *scl_name; /* syntax cluster name */
151 char_u *scl_name_u; /* uppercase of scl_name */
152 short *scl_list; /* IDs in this syntax cluster */
153} syn_cluster_T;
154
155/*
156 * For the current state we need to remember more than just the idx.
157 * When si_m_endpos.lnum is 0, the items other than si_idx are unknown.
158 * (The end positions have the column number of the next char)
159 */
160typedef struct state_item {
161 int si_idx; /* index of syntax pattern or
162 KEYWORD_IDX */
163 int si_id; /* highlight group ID for keywords */
164 int si_trans_id; /* idem, transparency removed */
165 int si_m_lnum; /* lnum of the match */
166 int si_m_startcol; /* starting column of the match */
167 lpos_T si_m_endpos; /* just after end posn of the match */
168 lpos_T si_h_startpos; /* start position of the highlighting */
169 lpos_T si_h_endpos; /* end position of the highlighting */
170 lpos_T si_eoe_pos; /* end position of end pattern */
171 int si_end_idx; /* group ID for end pattern or zero */
172 int si_ends; /* if match ends before si_m_endpos */
173 int si_attr; /* attributes in this state */
174 long si_flags; /* HL_HAS_EOL flag in this state, and
175 * HL_SKIP* for si_next_list */
176 int si_seqnr; /* sequence number */
177 int si_cchar; /* substitution character for conceal */
178 short *si_cont_list; /* list of contained groups */
179 short *si_next_list; /* nextgroup IDs after this item ends */
180 reg_extmatch_T *si_extmatch; /* \z(...\) matches from start
181 * pattern */
182} stateitem_T;
183
184/*
185 * Struct to reduce the number of arguments to get_syn_options(), it's used
186 * very often.
187 */
188typedef struct {
189 int flags; /* flags for contained and transparent */
190 int keyword; /* TRUE for ":syn keyword" */
191 int *sync_idx; /* syntax item for "grouphere" argument, NULL
192 if not allowed */
193 char has_cont_list; /* TRUE if "cont_list" can be used */
194 short *cont_list; /* group IDs for "contains" argument */
195 short *cont_in_list; /* group IDs for "containedin" argument */
196 short *next_list; /* group IDs for "nextgroup" argument */
197} syn_opt_arg_T;
198
199typedef struct {
200 proftime_T total;
201 int count;
202 int match;
203 proftime_T slowest;
204 proftime_T average;
205 int id;
206 char_u *pattern;
207} time_entry_T;
208
209struct name_list {
210 int flag;
211 char *name;
212};
213
214#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
215# include "syntax.c.generated.h"
216#endif

218/*
219 * An attribute number is the index in attr_table plus ATTR_OFF.
220 */
221#define ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1) (HL_ALL0x3f + 1)
222
223
224#define SYN_NAMELEN50 50 /* maximum length of a syntax name */
225
226static char *(spo_name_tab[SPO_COUNT7]) =
227{"ms=", "me=", "hs=", "he=", "rs=", "re=", "lc="};
228
229/* The sp_off_flags are computed like this:
230 * offset from the start of the matched text: (1 << SPO_XX_OFF)
231 * offset from the end of the matched text: (1 << (SPO_XX_OFF + SPO_COUNT))
232 * When both are present, only one is used.
233 */
234
235#define SPTYPE_MATCH1 1 /* match keyword with this group ID */
236#define SPTYPE_START2 2 /* match a regexp, start of item */
237#define SPTYPE_END3 3 /* match a regexp, end of item */
238#define SPTYPE_SKIP4 4 /* match a regexp, skip within item */
239
240
241#define SYN_ITEMS(buf)((synpat_T *)((buf)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data)) ((synpat_T *)((buf)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))
242
243#define NONE_IDX-2 -2 /* value of sp_sync_idx for "NONE" */
244
245/*
246 * Flags for b_syn_sync_flags:
247 */
248#define SF_CCOMMENT0x01 0x01 /* sync on a C-style comment */
249#define SF_MATCH0x02 0x02 /* sync by matching a pattern */
250
251#define SYN_STATE_P(ssp)((bufstate_T *)((ssp)->ga_data)) ((bufstate_T *)((ssp)->ga_data))
252
253#define MAXKEYWLEN80 80 /* maximum length of a keyword */
254
255/*
256 * The attributes of the syntax item that has been recognized.
257 */
258static int current_attr = 0; /* attr of current syntax word */
259static int current_id = 0; /* ID of current char for syn_get_id() */
260static int current_trans_id = 0; /* idem, transparency removed */
261static int current_flags = 0;
262static int current_seqnr = 0;
263static int current_sub_char = 0;
264
265/*
266 * Methods of combining two clusters
267 */
268#define CLUSTER_REPLACE1 1 /* replace first list with second */
269#define CLUSTER_ADD2 2 /* add second list to first */
270#define CLUSTER_SUBTRACT3 3 /* subtract second list from first */
271
272#define SYN_CLSTR(buf)((syn_cluster_T *)((buf)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data)) ((syn_cluster_T *)((buf)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))
273
274/*
275 * Syntax group IDs have different types:
276 * 0 - 19999 normal syntax groups
277 * 20000 - 20999 ALLBUT indicator (current_syn_inc_tag added)
278 * 21000 - 21999 TOP indicator (current_syn_inc_tag added)
279 * 22000 - 22999 CONTAINED indicator (current_syn_inc_tag added)
280 * 23000 - 32767 cluster IDs (subtract SYNID_CLUSTER for the cluster ID)
281 */
282#define SYNID_ALLBUT20000 MAX_HL_ID20000 /* syntax group ID for contains=ALLBUT */
283#define SYNID_TOP21000 21000 /* syntax group ID for contains=TOP */
284#define SYNID_CONTAINED22000 22000 /* syntax group ID for contains=CONTAINED */
285#define SYNID_CLUSTER23000 23000 /* first syntax group ID for clusters */
286
287#define MAX_SYN_INC_TAG999 999 /* maximum before the above overflow */
288#define MAX_CLUSTER_ID(32767 - 23000) (32767 - SYNID_CLUSTER23000)
289
290/*
291 * Annoying Hack(TM): ":syn include" needs this pointer to pass to
292 * expand_filename(). Most of the other syntax commands don't need it, so
293 * instead of passing it to them, we stow it here.
294 */
295static char_u **syn_cmdlinep;
296
297/*
298 * Another Annoying Hack(TM): To prevent rules from other ":syn include"'d
299 * files from leaking into ALLBUT lists, we assign a unique ID to the
300 * rules in each ":syn include"'d file.
301 */
302static int current_syn_inc_tag = 0;
303static int running_syn_inc_tag = 0;
304
305/*
306 * In a hashtable item "hi_key" points to "keyword" in a keyentry.
307 * This avoids adding a pointer to the hashtable item.
308 * KE2HIKEY() converts a var pointer to a hashitem key pointer.
309 * HIKEY2KE() converts a hashitem key pointer to a var pointer.
310 * HI2KE() converts a hashitem pointer to a var pointer.
311 */
312static keyentry_T dumkey;
313#define KE2HIKEY(kp)((kp)->keyword) ((kp)->keyword)
314#define HIKEY2KE(p)((keyentry_T *)((p) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u *)&dumkey
))) ((keyentry_T *)((p) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u *)&dumkey)))
315#define HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))) HIKEY2KE((hi)->hi_key)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey)))
316
317/*
318 * To reduce the time spent in keepend(), remember at which level in the state
319 * stack the first item with "keepend" is present. When "-1", there is no
320 * "keepend" on the stack.
321 */
322static int keepend_level = -1;
323
324static char msg_no_items[] = N_("No Syntax items defined for this buffer")"No Syntax items defined for this buffer";
325
326#define KEYWORD_IDX-1 -1 /* value of si_idx for keywords */
327#define ID_LIST_ALL(short *)-1 (short *)-1 /* valid of si_cont_list for containing all
328 but contained groups */
329
330static int next_seqnr = 0; /* value to use for si_seqnr */
331
332/*
333 * The next possible match in the current line for any pattern is remembered,
334 * to avoid having to try for a match in each column.
335 * If next_match_idx == -1, not tried (in this line) yet.
336 * If next_match_col == MAXCOL, no match found in this line.
337 * (All end positions have the column of the char after the end)
338 */
339static int next_match_col; /* column for start of next match */
340static lpos_T next_match_m_endpos; /* position for end of next match */
341static lpos_T next_match_h_startpos; /* pos. for highl. start of next match */
342static lpos_T next_match_h_endpos; /* pos. for highl. end of next match */
343static int next_match_idx; /* index of matched item */
344static long next_match_flags; /* flags for next match */
345static lpos_T next_match_eos_pos; /* end of start pattn (start region) */
346static lpos_T next_match_eoe_pos; /* pos. for end of end pattern */
347static int next_match_end_idx; /* ID of group for end pattn or zero */
348static reg_extmatch_T *next_match_extmatch = NULL((void*)0);
349
350/*
351 * A state stack is an array of integers or stateitem_T, stored in a
352 * garray_T. A state stack is invalid if it's itemsize entry is zero.
353 */
354#define INVALID_STATE(ssp)((ssp)->ga_itemsize == 0) ((ssp)->ga_itemsize == 0)
355#define VALID_STATE(ssp)((ssp)->ga_itemsize != 0) ((ssp)->ga_itemsize != 0)
356
357/*
358 * The current state (within the line) of the recognition engine.
359 * When current_state.ga_itemsize is 0 the current state is invalid.
360 */
361static win_T *syn_win; /* current window for highlighting */
362static buf_T *syn_buf; /* current buffer for highlighting */
363static synblock_T *syn_block; /* current buffer for highlighting */
364static linenr_T current_lnum = 0; /* lnum of current state */
365static colnr_T current_col = 0; /* column of current state */
366static int current_state_stored = 0; /* TRUE if stored current state
367 * after setting current_finished */
368static int current_finished = 0; /* current line has been finished */
369static garray_T current_state /* current stack of state_items */
370 = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE{ 0, 0, 0, 1, ((void*)0) };
371static short *current_next_list = NULL((void*)0); /* when non-zero, nextgroup list */
372static int current_next_flags = 0; /* flags for current_next_list */
373static int current_line_id = 0; /* unique number for current line */
374
375#define CUR_STATE(idx)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx] ((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx]
376
377static int syn_time_on = FALSE0;
378# define IF_SYN_TIME(p)(p) (p)
379
380
381
382/*
383 * Start the syntax recognition for a line. This function is normally called
384 * from the screen updating, once for each displayed line.
385 * The buffer is remembered in syn_buf, because get_syntax_attr() doesn't get
386 * it. Careful: curbuf and curwin are likely to point to another buffer and
387 * window.
388 */
389void syntax_start(win_T *wp, linenr_T lnum)
390{
391 synstate_T *p;
392 synstate_T *last_valid = NULL((void*)0);
393 synstate_T *last_min_valid = NULL((void*)0);
394 synstate_T *sp, *prev = NULL((void*)0);
395 linenr_T parsed_lnum;
396 linenr_T first_stored;
397 int dist;
398 static int changedtick = 0; /* remember the last change ID */
399
400 current_sub_char = NUL'\000';
401
402 /*
403 * After switching buffers, invalidate current_state.
404 * Also do this when a change was made, the current state may be invalid
405 * then.
406 */
407 if (syn_block != wp->w_s || changedtick != syn_buf->b_changedtick) {
408 invalidate_current_state();
409 syn_buf = wp->w_buffer;
410 syn_block = wp->w_s;
411 }
412 changedtick = syn_buf->b_changedtick;
413 syn_win = wp;
414
415 /*
416 * Allocate syntax stack when needed.
417 */
418 syn_stack_alloc();
419 if (syn_block->b_sst_array == NULL((void*)0))
420 return; /* out of memory */
421 syn_block->b_sst_lasttick = display_tick;
422
423 /*
424 * If the state of the end of the previous line is useful, store it.
425 */
426 if (VALID_STATE(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_itemsize != 0)
427 && current_lnum < lnum
428 && current_lnum < syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
429 (void)syn_finish_line(FALSE0);
430 if (!current_state_stored) {
431 ++current_lnum;
432 (void)store_current_state();
433 }
434
435 /*
436 * If the current_lnum is now the same as "lnum", keep the current
437 * state (this happens very often!). Otherwise invalidate
438 * current_state and figure it out below.
439 */
440 if (current_lnum != lnum)
441 invalidate_current_state();
442 } else
443 invalidate_current_state();
444
445 /*
446 * Try to synchronize from a saved state in b_sst_array[].
447 * Only do this if lnum is not before and not to far beyond a saved state.
448 */
449 if (INVALID_STATE(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_itemsize == 0) && syn_block->b_sst_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
450 /* Find last valid saved state before start_lnum. */
451 for (p = syn_block->b_sst_first; p != NULL((void*)0); p = p->sst_next) {
452 if (p->sst_lnum > lnum)
453 break;
454 if (p->sst_lnum <= lnum && p->sst_change_lnum == 0) {
455 last_valid = p;
456 if (p->sst_lnum >= lnum - syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines)
457 last_min_valid = p;
458 }
459 }
460 if (last_min_valid != NULL((void*)0))
461 load_current_state(last_min_valid);
462 }
463
464 /*
465 * If "lnum" is before or far beyond a line with a saved state, need to
466 * re-synchronize.
467 */
468 if (INVALID_STATE(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_itemsize == 0)) {
469 syn_sync(wp, lnum, last_valid);
470 if (current_lnum == 1)
471 /* First line is always valid, no matter "minlines". */
472 first_stored = 1;
473 else
474 /* Need to parse "minlines" lines before state can be considered
475 * valid to store. */
476 first_stored = current_lnum + syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines;
477 } else
478 first_stored = current_lnum;
479
480 /*
481 * Advance from the sync point or saved state until the current line.
482 * Save some entries for syncing with later on.
483 */
484 if (syn_block->b_sst_len <= Rows)
485 dist = 999999;
486 else
487 dist = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count / (syn_block->b_sst_len - Rows) + 1;
488 while (current_lnum < lnum) {
489 syn_start_line();
490 (void)syn_finish_line(FALSE0);
491 ++current_lnum;
492
493 /* If we parsed at least "minlines" lines or started at a valid
494 * state, the current state is considered valid. */
495 if (current_lnum >= first_stored) {
496 /* Check if the saved state entry is for the current line and is
497 * equal to the current state. If so, then validate all saved
498 * states that depended on a change before the parsed line. */
499 if (prev == NULL((void*)0))
500 prev = syn_stack_find_entry(current_lnum - 1);
501 if (prev == NULL((void*)0))
502 sp = syn_block->b_sst_first;
503 else
504 sp = prev;
505 while (sp != NULL((void*)0) && sp->sst_lnum < current_lnum)
506 sp = sp->sst_next;
507 if (sp != NULL((void*)0)
508 && sp->sst_lnum == current_lnum
509 && syn_stack_equal(sp)) {
510 parsed_lnum = current_lnum;
511 prev = sp;
512 while (sp != NULL((void*)0) && sp->sst_change_lnum <= parsed_lnum) {
513 if (sp->sst_lnum <= lnum)
514 /* valid state before desired line, use this one */
515 prev = sp;
516 else if (sp->sst_change_lnum == 0)
517 /* past saved states depending on change, break here. */
518 break;
519 sp->sst_change_lnum = 0;
520 sp = sp->sst_next;
521 }
522 load_current_state(prev);
523 }
524 /* Store the state at this line when it's the first one, the line
525 * where we start parsing, or some distance from the previously
526 * saved state. But only when parsed at least 'minlines'. */
527 else if (prev == NULL((void*)0)
528 || current_lnum == lnum
529 || current_lnum >= prev->sst_lnum + dist)
530 prev = store_current_state();
531 }
532
533 /* This can take a long time: break when CTRL-C pressed. The current
534 * state will be wrong then. */
535 line_breakcheck();
536 if (got_int) {
537 current_lnum = lnum;
538 break;
539 }
540 }
541
542 syn_start_line();
543}
544
545/*
546 * We cannot simply discard growarrays full of state_items or buf_states; we
547 * have to manually release their extmatch pointers first.
548 */
549static void clear_syn_state(synstate_T *p)
550{
551 garray_T *gap;
552
553 if (p->sst_stacksize > SST_FIX_STATES7) {
554 gap = &(p->sst_union.sst_ga);
555 for (int i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; i++) {
556 unref_extmatch(SYN_STATE_P(gap)((bufstate_T *)((gap)->ga_data))[i].bs_extmatch);
557 }
558 ga_clear(gap);
559 } else {
560 for (int i = 0; i < p->sst_stacksize; i++) {
561 unref_extmatch(p->sst_union.sst_stack[i].bs_extmatch);
562 }
563 }
564}
565
566/*
567 * Cleanup the current_state stack.
568 */
569static void clear_current_state(void)
570{
571 stateitem_T *sip = (stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data);
572 for (int i = 0; i < current_state.ga_len; i++) {
573 unref_extmatch(sip[i].si_extmatch);
574 }
575 ga_clear(&current_state);
576}
577
578/*
579 * Try to find a synchronisation point for line "lnum".
580 *
581 * This sets current_lnum and the current state. One of three methods is
582 * used:
583 * 1. Search backwards for the end of a C-comment.
584 * 2. Search backwards for given sync patterns.
585 * 3. Simply start on a given number of lines above "lnum".
586 */
587static void syn_sync(win_T *wp, linenr_T start_lnum, synstate_T *last_valid)
588{
589 buf_T *curbuf_save;
590 win_T *curwin_save;
591 pos_T cursor_save;
592 int idx;
593 linenr_T lnum;
594 linenr_T end_lnum;
595 linenr_T break_lnum;
596 int had_sync_point;
597 stateitem_T *cur_si;
598 synpat_T *spp;
599 char_u *line;
600 int found_flags = 0;
601 int found_match_idx = 0;
602 linenr_T found_current_lnum = 0;
603 int found_current_col= 0;
604 lpos_T found_m_endpos;
605 colnr_T prev_current_col;
606
607 /*
608 * Clear any current state that might be hanging around.
609 */
610 invalidate_current_state();
611
612 /*
613 * Start at least "minlines" back. Default starting point for parsing is
614 * there.
615 * Start further back, to avoid that scrolling backwards will result in
616 * resyncing for every line. Now it resyncs only one out of N lines,
617 * where N is minlines * 1.5, or minlines * 2 if minlines is small.
618 * Watch out for overflow when minlines is MAXLNUM.
619 */
620 if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines > start_lnum)
621 start_lnum = 1;
622 else {
623 if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines == 1)
624 lnum = 1;
625 else if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines < 10)
626 lnum = syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines * 2;
627 else
628 lnum = syn_block->b_syn_sync_minlines * 3 / 2;
629 if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines != 0
630 && lnum > syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines)
631 lnum = syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines;
632 if (lnum >= start_lnum)
633 start_lnum = 1;
634 else
635 start_lnum -= lnum;
636 }
637 current_lnum = start_lnum;
638
639 /*
640 * 1. Search backwards for the end of a C-style comment.
641 */
642 if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_CCOMMENT0x01) {
643 /* Need to make syn_buf the current buffer for a moment, to be able to
644 * use find_start_comment(). */
645 curwin_save = curwin;
646 curwin = wp;
647 curbuf_save = curbuf;
648 curbuf = syn_buf;
649
650 /*
651 * Skip lines that end in a backslash.
652 */
653 for (; start_lnum > 1; --start_lnum) {
654 line = ml_get(start_lnum - 1);
655 if (*line == NUL'\000' || *(line + STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) - 1) != '\\')
656 break;
657 }
658 current_lnum = start_lnum;
659
660 /* set cursor to start of search */
661 cursor_save = wp->w_cursor;
662 wp->w_cursor.lnum = start_lnum;
663 wp->w_cursor.col = 0;
664
665 /*
666 * If the line is inside a comment, need to find the syntax item that
667 * defines the comment.
668 * Restrict the search for the end of a comment to b_syn_sync_maxlines.
669 */
670 if (find_start_comment((int)syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines) != NULL((void*)0)) {
671 for (idx = syn_block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --idx >= 0; )
672 if (SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.id
673 == syn_block->b_syn_sync_id
674 && SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_START2) {
675 validate_current_state();
676 push_current_state(idx);
677 update_si_attr(current_state.ga_len - 1);
678 break;
679 }
680 }
681
682 /* restore cursor and buffer */
683 wp->w_cursor = cursor_save;
684 curwin = curwin_save;
685 curbuf = curbuf_save;
686 }
687 /*
688 * 2. Search backwards for given sync patterns.
689 */
690 else if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_MATCH0x02) {
691 if (syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines != 0
692 && start_lnum > syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines)
693 break_lnum = start_lnum - syn_block->b_syn_sync_maxlines;
694 else
695 break_lnum = 0;
696
697 found_m_endpos.lnum = 0;
698 found_m_endpos.col = 0;
699 end_lnum = start_lnum;
700 lnum = start_lnum;
701 while (--lnum > break_lnum) {
702 /* This can take a long time: break when CTRL-C pressed. */
703 line_breakcheck();
704 if (got_int) {
705 invalidate_current_state();
706 current_lnum = start_lnum;
707 break;
708 }
709
710 /* Check if we have run into a valid saved state stack now. */
711 if (last_valid != NULL((void*)0) && lnum == last_valid->sst_lnum) {
712 load_current_state(last_valid);
713 break;
714 }
715
716 /*
717 * Check if the previous line has the line-continuation pattern.
718 */
719 if (lnum > 1 && syn_match_linecont(lnum - 1))
720 continue;
721
722 /*
723 * Start with nothing on the state stack
724 */
725 validate_current_state();
726
727 for (current_lnum = lnum; current_lnum < end_lnum; ++current_lnum) {
728 syn_start_line();
729 for (;; ) {
730 had_sync_point = syn_finish_line(TRUE1);
731 /*
732 * When a sync point has been found, remember where, and
733 * continue to look for another one, further on in the line.
734 */
735 if (had_sync_point && current_state.ga_len) {
736 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
737 if (cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum > start_lnum) {
738 /* ignore match that goes to after where started */
739 current_lnum = end_lnum;
740 break;
741 }
742 if (cur_si->si_idx < 0) {
743 /* Cannot happen? */
744 found_flags = 0;
745 found_match_idx = KEYWORD_IDX-1;
746 } else {
747 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx]);
748 found_flags = spp->sp_flags;
749 found_match_idx = spp->sp_sync_idx;
750 }
751 found_current_lnum = current_lnum;
752 found_current_col = current_col;
753 found_m_endpos = cur_si->si_m_endpos;
754 /*
755 * Continue after the match (be aware of a zero-length
756 * match).
757 */
758 if (found_m_endpos.lnum > current_lnum) {
759 current_lnum = found_m_endpos.lnum;
760 current_col = found_m_endpos.col;
761 if (current_lnum >= end_lnum)
762 break;
763 } else if (found_m_endpos.col > current_col)
764 current_col = found_m_endpos.col;
765 else
766 ++current_col;
767
768 /* syn_current_attr() will have skipped the check for
769 * an item that ends here, need to do that now. Be
770 * careful not to go past the NUL. */
771 prev_current_col = current_col;
772 if (syn_getcurline()[current_col] != NUL'\000')
773 ++current_col;
774 check_state_ends();
775 current_col = prev_current_col;
776 } else
777 break;
778 }
779 }
780
781 /*
782 * If a sync point was encountered, break here.
783 */
784 if (found_flags) {
785 /*
786 * Put the item that was specified by the sync point on the
787 * state stack. If there was no item specified, make the
788 * state stack empty.
789 */
790 clear_current_state();
791 if (found_match_idx >= 0) {
792 push_current_state(found_match_idx);
793 update_si_attr(current_state.ga_len - 1);
794 }
795
796 /*
797 * When using "grouphere", continue from the sync point
798 * match, until the end of the line. Parsing starts at
799 * the next line.
800 * For "groupthere" the parsing starts at start_lnum.
801 */
802 if (found_flags & HL_SYNC_HERE0x10) {
803 if (!GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0)) {
804 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
805 cur_si->si_h_startpos.lnum = found_current_lnum;
806 cur_si->si_h_startpos.col = found_current_col;
807 update_si_end(cur_si, (int)current_col, TRUE1);
808 check_keepend();
809 }
810 current_col = found_m_endpos.col;
811 current_lnum = found_m_endpos.lnum;
812 (void)syn_finish_line(FALSE0);
813 ++current_lnum;
814 } else
815 current_lnum = start_lnum;
816
817 break;
818 }
819
820 end_lnum = lnum;
821 invalidate_current_state();
822 }
823
824 /* Ran into start of the file or exceeded maximum number of lines */
825 if (lnum <= break_lnum) {
826 invalidate_current_state();
827 current_lnum = break_lnum + 1;
828 }
829 }
830
831 validate_current_state();
832}
833
834/*
835 * Return TRUE if the line-continuation pattern matches in line "lnum".
836 */
837static int syn_match_linecont(linenr_T lnum)
838{
839 regmmatch_T regmatch;
840
841 if (syn_block->b_syn_linecont_prog != NULL((void*)0)) {
842 regmatch.rmm_ic = syn_block->b_syn_linecont_ic;
843 regmatch.regprog = syn_block->b_syn_linecont_prog;
844 return syn_regexec(&regmatch, lnum, (colnr_T)0,
845 IF_SYN_TIME(&syn_block->b_syn_linecont_time)(&syn_block->b_syn_linecont_time));
846 }
847 return FALSE0;
848}
849
850/*
851 * Prepare the current state for the start of a line.
852 */
853static void syn_start_line(void)
854{
855 current_finished = FALSE0;
856 current_col = 0;
857
858 /*
859 * Need to update the end of a start/skip/end that continues from the
860 * previous line and regions that have "keepend".
861 */
862 if (!GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0)) {
863 syn_update_ends(TRUE1);
864 check_state_ends();
865 }
866
867 next_match_idx = -1;
868 ++current_line_id;
869}
870
871/*
872 * Check for items in the stack that need their end updated.
873 * When "startofline" is TRUE the last item is always updated.
874 * When "startofline" is FALSE the item with "keepend" is forcefully updated.
875 */
876static void syn_update_ends(int startofline)
877{
878 stateitem_T *cur_si;
879 int seen_keepend;
880
881 if (startofline) {
882 /* Check for a match carried over from a previous line with a
883 * contained region. The match ends as soon as the region ends. */
884 for (int i = 0; i < current_state.ga_len; ++i) {
885 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i];
886 if (cur_si->si_idx >= 0
887 && (SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx]).sp_type
888 == SPTYPE_MATCH1
889 && cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum < current_lnum) {
890 cur_si->si_flags |= HL_MATCHCONT0x8000;
891 cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum = 0;
892 cur_si->si_m_endpos.col = 0;
893 cur_si->si_h_endpos = cur_si->si_m_endpos;
894 cur_si->si_ends = TRUE1;
895 }
896 }
897 }
898
899 /*
900 * Need to update the end of a start/skip/end that continues from the
901 * previous line. And regions that have "keepend", because they may
902 * influence contained items. If we've just removed "extend"
903 * (startofline == 0) then we should update ends of normal regions
904 * contained inside "keepend" because "extend" could have extended
905 * these "keepend" regions as well as contained normal regions.
906 * Then check for items ending in column 0.
907 */
908 int i = current_state.ga_len - 1;
909 if (keepend_level >= 0)
910 for (; i > keepend_level; --i)
911 if (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags & HL_EXTEND0x4000)
912 break;
913
914 seen_keepend = FALSE0;
915 for (; i < current_state.ga_len; ++i) {
916 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i];
917 if ((cur_si->si_flags & HL_KEEPEND0x400)
918 || (seen_keepend && !startofline)
919 || (i == current_state.ga_len - 1 && startofline)) {
920 cur_si->si_h_startpos.col = 0; /* start highl. in col 0 */
921 cur_si->si_h_startpos.lnum = current_lnum;
922
923 if (!(cur_si->si_flags & HL_MATCHCONT0x8000))
924 update_si_end(cur_si, (int)current_col, !startofline);
925
926 if (!startofline && (cur_si->si_flags & HL_KEEPEND0x400))
927 seen_keepend = TRUE1;
928 }
929 }
930 check_keepend();
931}
932
933/****************************************
934 * Handling of the state stack cache.
935 */
936
937/*
938 * EXPLANATION OF THE SYNTAX STATE STACK CACHE
939 *
940 * To speed up syntax highlighting, the state stack for the start of some
941 * lines is cached. These entries can be used to start parsing at that point.
942 *
943 * The stack is kept in b_sst_array[] for each buffer. There is a list of
944 * valid entries. b_sst_first points to the first one, then follow sst_next.
945 * The entries are sorted on line number. The first entry is often for line 2
946 * (line 1 always starts with an empty stack).
947 * There is also a list for free entries. This construction is used to avoid
948 * having to allocate and free memory blocks too often.
949 *
950 * When making changes to the buffer, this is logged in b_mod_*. When calling
951 * update_screen() to update the display, it will call
952 * syn_stack_apply_changes() for each displayed buffer to adjust the cached
953 * entries. The entries which are inside the changed area are removed,
954 * because they must be recomputed. Entries below the changed have their line
955 * number adjusted for deleted/inserted lines, and have their sst_change_lnum
956 * set to indicate that a check must be made if the changed lines would change
957 * the cached entry.
958 *
959 * When later displaying lines, an entry is stored for each line. Displayed
960 * lines are likely to be displayed again, in which case the state at the
961 * start of the line is needed.
962 * For not displayed lines, an entry is stored for every so many lines. These
963 * entries will be used e.g., when scrolling backwards. The distance between
964 * entries depends on the number of lines in the buffer. For small buffers
965 * the distance is fixed at SST_DIST, for large buffers there is a fixed
966 * number of entries SST_MAX_ENTRIES, and the distance is computed.
967 */
968
969static void syn_stack_free_block(synblock_T *block)
970{
971 synstate_T *p;
972
973 if (block->b_sst_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
974 for (p = block->b_sst_first; p != NULL((void*)0); p = p->sst_next)
975 clear_syn_state(p);
976 free(block->b_sst_array);
977 block->b_sst_array = NULL((void*)0);
978 block->b_sst_len = 0;
979 }
980}
981/*
982 * Free b_sst_array[] for buffer "buf".
983 * Used when syntax items changed to force resyncing everywhere.
984 */
985void syn_stack_free_all(synblock_T *block)
986{
987 syn_stack_free_block(block);
988
989 /* When using "syntax" fold method, must update all folds. */
990 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
991 if (wp->w_s == block && foldmethodIsSyntax(wp)) {
992 foldUpdateAll(wp);
993 }
994 }
995}
996
997/*
998 * Allocate the syntax state stack for syn_buf when needed.
999 * If the number of entries in b_sst_array[] is much too big or a bit too
1000 * small, reallocate it.
1001 * Also used to allocate b_sst_array[] for the first time.
1002 */
1003static void syn_stack_alloc(void)
1004{
1005 long len;
1006 synstate_T *to, *from;
1007 synstate_T *sstp;
1008
1009 len = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count / SST_DIST16 + Rows * 2;
1010 if (len < SST_MIN_ENTRIES150)
1011 len = SST_MIN_ENTRIES150;
1012 else if (len > SST_MAX_ENTRIES1000)
1013 len = SST_MAX_ENTRIES1000;
1014 if (syn_block->b_sst_len > len * 2 || syn_block->b_sst_len < len) {
1015 /* Allocate 50% too much, to avoid reallocating too often. */
1016 len = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
1017 len = (len + len / 2) / SST_DIST16 + Rows * 2;
1018 if (len < SST_MIN_ENTRIES150)
1019 len = SST_MIN_ENTRIES150;
1020 else if (len > SST_MAX_ENTRIES1000)
1021 len = SST_MAX_ENTRIES1000;
1022
1023 if (syn_block->b_sst_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
1024 /* When shrinking the array, cleanup the existing stack.
1025 * Make sure that all valid entries fit in the new array. */
1026 while (syn_block->b_sst_len - syn_block->b_sst_freecount + 2 > len
1027 && syn_stack_cleanup())
1028 ;
1029 if (len < syn_block->b_sst_len - syn_block->b_sst_freecount + 2)
1030 len = syn_block->b_sst_len - syn_block->b_sst_freecount + 2;
1031 }
1032
1033 assert(len >= 0)((len >= 0) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail ("len >= 0", "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/syntax.c"
, 1033, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1034 sstp = xcalloc(len, sizeof(synstate_T));
1035
1036 to = sstp - 1;
1037 if (syn_block->b_sst_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
1038 /* Move the states from the old array to the new one. */
1039 for (from = syn_block->b_sst_first; from != NULL((void*)0);
1040 from = from->sst_next) {
1041 ++to;
1042 *to = *from;
1043 to->sst_next = to + 1;
1044 }
1045 }
1046 if (to != sstp - 1) {
1047 to->sst_next = NULL((void*)0);
1048 syn_block->b_sst_first = sstp;
1049 syn_block->b_sst_freecount = len - (int)(to - sstp) - 1;
1050 } else {
1051 syn_block->b_sst_first = NULL((void*)0);
1052 syn_block->b_sst_freecount = len;
1053 }
1054
1055 /* Create the list of free entries. */
1056 syn_block->b_sst_firstfree = to + 1;
1057 while (++to < sstp + len)
1058 to->sst_next = to + 1;
1059 (sstp + len - 1)->sst_next = NULL((void*)0);
1060
1061 free(syn_block->b_sst_array);
1062 syn_block->b_sst_array = sstp;
1063 syn_block->b_sst_len = len;
1064 }
1065}
1066
1067/*
1068 * Check for changes in a buffer to affect stored syntax states. Uses the
1069 * b_mod_* fields.
1070 * Called from update_screen(), before screen is being updated, once for each
1071 * displayed buffer.
1072 */
1073void syn_stack_apply_changes(buf_T *buf)
1074{
1075 syn_stack_apply_changes_block(&buf->b_s, buf);
1076
1077 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
1078 if ((wp->w_buffer == buf) && (wp->w_s != &buf->b_s)) {
1079 syn_stack_apply_changes_block(wp->w_s, buf);
1080 }
1081 }
1082}
1083
1084static void syn_stack_apply_changes_block(synblock_T *block, buf_T *buf)
1085{
1086 synstate_T *p, *prev, *np;
1087 linenr_T n;
1088
1089 if (block->b_sst_array == NULL((void*)0)) /* nothing to do */
1090 return;
1091
1092 prev = NULL((void*)0);
1093 for (p = block->b_sst_first; p != NULL((void*)0); ) {
1094 if (p->sst_lnum + block->b_syn_sync_linebreaks > buf->b_mod_top) {
1095 n = p->sst_lnum + buf->b_mod_xlines;
1096 if (n <= buf->b_mod_bot) {
1097 /* this state is inside the changed area, remove it */
1098 np = p->sst_next;
1099 if (prev == NULL((void*)0))
1100 block->b_sst_first = np;
1101 else
1102 prev->sst_next = np;
1103 syn_stack_free_entry(block, p);
1104 p = np;
1105 continue;
1106 }
1107 /* This state is below the changed area. Remember the line
1108 * that needs to be parsed before this entry can be made valid
1109 * again. */
1110 if (p->sst_change_lnum != 0 && p->sst_change_lnum > buf->b_mod_top) {
1111 if (p->sst_change_lnum + buf->b_mod_xlines > buf->b_mod_top)
1112 p->sst_change_lnum += buf->b_mod_xlines;
1113 else
1114 p->sst_change_lnum = buf->b_mod_top;
1115 }
1116 if (p->sst_change_lnum == 0
1117 || p->sst_change_lnum < buf->b_mod_bot)
1118 p->sst_change_lnum = buf->b_mod_bot;
1119
1120 p->sst_lnum = n;
1121 }
1122 prev = p;
1123 p = p->sst_next;
1124 }
1125}
1126
1127/*
1128 * Reduce the number of entries in the state stack for syn_buf.
1129 * Returns TRUE if at least one entry was freed.
1130 */
1131static int syn_stack_cleanup(void)
1132{
1133 synstate_T *p, *prev;
1134 disptick_T tick;
1135 int above;
1136 int dist;
1137 int retval = FALSE0;
1138
1139 if (syn_block->b_sst_array == NULL((void*)0) || syn_block->b_sst_first == NULL((void*)0))
1140 return retval;
1141
1142 /* Compute normal distance between non-displayed entries. */
1143 if (syn_block->b_sst_len <= Rows)
1144 dist = 999999;
1145 else
1146 dist = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count / (syn_block->b_sst_len - Rows) + 1;
1147
1148 /*
1149 * Go through the list to find the "tick" for the oldest entry that can
1150 * be removed. Set "above" when the "tick" for the oldest entry is above
1151 * "b_sst_lasttick" (the display tick wraps around).
1152 */
1153 tick = syn_block->b_sst_lasttick;
1154 above = FALSE0;
1155 prev = syn_block->b_sst_first;
1156 for (p = prev->sst_next; p != NULL((void*)0); prev = p, p = p->sst_next) {
1157 if (prev->sst_lnum + dist > p->sst_lnum) {
1158 if (p->sst_tick > syn_block->b_sst_lasttick) {
1159 if (!above || p->sst_tick < tick)
1160 tick = p->sst_tick;
1161 above = TRUE1;
1162 } else if (!above && p->sst_tick < tick)
1163 tick = p->sst_tick;
1164 }
1165 }
1166
1167 /*
1168 * Go through the list to make the entries for the oldest tick at an
1169 * interval of several lines.
1170 */
1171 prev = syn_block->b_sst_first;
1172 for (p = prev->sst_next; p != NULL((void*)0); prev = p, p = p->sst_next) {
1173 if (p->sst_tick == tick && prev->sst_lnum + dist > p->sst_lnum) {
1174 /* Move this entry from used list to free list */
1175 prev->sst_next = p->sst_next;
1176 syn_stack_free_entry(syn_block, p);
1177 p = prev;
1178 retval = TRUE1;
1179 }
1180 }
1181 return retval;
1182}
1183
1184/*
1185 * Free the allocated memory for a syn_state item.
1186 * Move the entry into the free list.
1187 */
1188static void syn_stack_free_entry(synblock_T *block, synstate_T *p)
1189{
1190 clear_syn_state(p);
1191 p->sst_next = block->b_sst_firstfree;
1192 block->b_sst_firstfree = p;
1193 ++block->b_sst_freecount;
1194}
1195
1196/*
1197 * Find an entry in the list of state stacks at or before "lnum".
1198 * Returns NULL when there is no entry or the first entry is after "lnum".
1199 */
1200static synstate_T *syn_stack_find_entry(linenr_T lnum)
1201{
1202 synstate_T *p, *prev;
1203
1204 prev = NULL((void*)0);
1205 for (p = syn_block->b_sst_first; p != NULL((void*)0); prev = p, p = p->sst_next) {
1206 if (p->sst_lnum == lnum)
1207 return p;
1208 if (p->sst_lnum > lnum)
1209 break;
1210 }
1211 return prev;
1212}
1213
1214/*
1215 * Try saving the current state in b_sst_array[].
1216 * The current state must be valid for the start of the current_lnum line!
1217 */
1218static synstate_T *store_current_state(void)
1219{
1220 int i;
1221 synstate_T *p;
1222 bufstate_T *bp;
1223 stateitem_T *cur_si;
1224 synstate_T *sp = syn_stack_find_entry(current_lnum);
1225
1226 /*
1227 * If the current state contains a start or end pattern that continues
1228 * from the previous line, we can't use it. Don't store it then.
1229 */
1230 for (i = current_state.ga_len - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
1231 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i];
1232 if (cur_si->si_h_startpos.lnum >= current_lnum
1233 || cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum >= current_lnum
1234 || cur_si->si_h_endpos.lnum >= current_lnum
1235 || (cur_si->si_end_idx
1236 && cur_si->si_eoe_pos.lnum >= current_lnum))
1237 break;
1238 }
1239 if (i >= 0) {
1240 if (sp != NULL((void*)0)) {
1241 /* find "sp" in the list and remove it */
1242 if (syn_block->b_sst_first == sp)
1243 /* it's the first entry */
1244 syn_block->b_sst_first = sp->sst_next;
1245 else {
1246 /* find the entry just before this one to adjust sst_next */
1247 for (p = syn_block->b_sst_first; p != NULL((void*)0); p = p->sst_next)
1248 if (p->sst_next == sp)
1249 break;
1250 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) /* just in case */
1251 p->sst_next = sp->sst_next;
1252 }
1253 syn_stack_free_entry(syn_block, sp);
1254 sp = NULL((void*)0);
1255 }
1256 } else if (sp == NULL((void*)0) || sp->sst_lnum != current_lnum) {
1257 /*
1258 * Add a new entry
1259 */
1260 /* If no free items, cleanup the array first. */
1261 if (syn_block->b_sst_freecount == 0) {
1262 (void)syn_stack_cleanup();
1263 /* "sp" may have been moved to the freelist now */
1264 sp = syn_stack_find_entry(current_lnum);
1265 }
1266 /* Still no free items? Must be a strange problem... */
1267 if (syn_block->b_sst_freecount == 0)
1268 sp = NULL((void*)0);
1269 else {
1270 /* Take the first item from the free list and put it in the used
1271 * list, after *sp */
1272 p = syn_block->b_sst_firstfree;
1273 syn_block->b_sst_firstfree = p->sst_next;
1274 --syn_block->b_sst_freecount;
1275 if (sp == NULL((void*)0)) {
1276 /* Insert in front of the list */
1277 p->sst_next = syn_block->b_sst_first;
1278 syn_block->b_sst_first = p;
1279 } else {
1280 /* insert in list after *sp */
1281 p->sst_next = sp->sst_next;
1282 sp->sst_next = p;
1283 }
1284 sp = p;
1285 sp->sst_stacksize = 0;
1286 sp->sst_lnum = current_lnum;
1287 }
1288 }
1289 if (sp != NULL((void*)0)) {
1290 /* When overwriting an existing state stack, clear it first */
1291 clear_syn_state(sp);
1292 sp->sst_stacksize = current_state.ga_len;
1293 if (current_state.ga_len > SST_FIX_STATES7) {
1294 /* Need to clear it, might be something remaining from when the
1295 * length was less than SST_FIX_STATES. */
1296 ga_init(&sp->sst_union.sst_ga, (int)sizeof(bufstate_T), 1);
1297 ga_grow(&sp->sst_union.sst_ga, current_state.ga_len);
1298 sp->sst_union.sst_ga.ga_len = current_state.ga_len;
1299 bp = SYN_STATE_P(&(sp->sst_union.sst_ga))((bufstate_T *)((&(sp->sst_union.sst_ga))->ga_data)
);
1300 } else
1301 bp = sp->sst_union.sst_stack;
1302 for (i = 0; i < sp->sst_stacksize; ++i) {
1303 bp[i].bs_idx = CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx;
1304 bp[i].bs_flags = CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags;
1305 bp[i].bs_seqnr = CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_seqnr;
1306 bp[i].bs_cchar = CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_cchar;
1307 bp[i].bs_extmatch = ref_extmatch(CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_extmatch);
1308 }
1309 sp->sst_next_flags = current_next_flags;
1310 sp->sst_next_list = current_next_list;
1311 sp->sst_tick = display_tick;
1312 sp->sst_change_lnum = 0;
1313 }
1314 current_state_stored = TRUE1;
1315 return sp;
1316}
1317
1318/*
1319 * Copy a state stack from "from" in b_sst_array[] to current_state;
1320 */
1321static void load_current_state(synstate_T *from)
1322{
1323 int i;
1324 bufstate_T *bp;
1325
1326 clear_current_state();
1327 validate_current_state();
1328 keepend_level = -1;
1329 if (from->sst_stacksize) {
1330 ga_grow(&current_state, from->sst_stacksize);
1331 if (from->sst_stacksize > SST_FIX_STATES7)
1332 bp = SYN_STATE_P(&(from->sst_union.sst_ga))((bufstate_T *)((&(from->sst_union.sst_ga))->ga_data
));
1333 else
1334 bp = from->sst_union.sst_stack;
1335 for (i = 0; i < from->sst_stacksize; ++i) {
1336 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx = bp[i].bs_idx;
1337 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags = bp[i].bs_flags;
1338 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_seqnr = bp[i].bs_seqnr;
1339 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_cchar = bp[i].bs_cchar;
1340 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_extmatch = ref_extmatch(bp[i].bs_extmatch);
1341 if (keepend_level < 0 && (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags & HL_KEEPEND0x400))
1342 keepend_level = i;
1343 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_ends = FALSE0;
1344 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_m_lnum = 0;
1345 if (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx >= 0)
1346 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_next_list =
1347 (SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx]).sp_next_list;
1348 else
1349 CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
1350 update_si_attr(i);
1351 }
1352 current_state.ga_len = from->sst_stacksize;
1353 }
1354 current_next_list = from->sst_next_list;
1355 current_next_flags = from->sst_next_flags;
1356 current_lnum = from->sst_lnum;
1357}
1358
1359/*
1360 * Compare saved state stack "*sp" with the current state.
1361 * Return TRUE when they are equal.
1362 */
1363static int syn_stack_equal(synstate_T *sp)
1364{
1365 bufstate_T *bp;
1366 reg_extmatch_T *six, *bsx;
1367
1368 /* First a quick check if the stacks have the same size end nextlist. */
1369 if (sp->sst_stacksize == current_state.ga_len
1370 && sp->sst_next_list == current_next_list) {
1371 /* Need to compare all states on both stacks. */
1372 if (sp->sst_stacksize > SST_FIX_STATES7)
1373 bp = SYN_STATE_P(&(sp->sst_union.sst_ga))((bufstate_T *)((&(sp->sst_union.sst_ga))->ga_data)
);
1374 else
1375 bp = sp->sst_union.sst_stack;
1376
1377 int i;
1378 for (i = current_state.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
1379 /* If the item has another index the state is different. */
1380 if (bp[i].bs_idx != CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx)
1381 break;
1382 if (bp[i].bs_extmatch != CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_extmatch) {
1383 /* When the extmatch pointers are different, the strings in
1384 * them can still be the same. Check if the extmatch
1385 * references are equal. */
1386 bsx = bp[i].bs_extmatch;
1387 six = CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_extmatch;
1388 /* If one of the extmatch pointers is NULL the states are
1389 * different. */
1390 if (bsx == NULL((void*)0) || six == NULL((void*)0))
1391 break;
1392 int j;
1393 for (j = 0; j < NSUBEXP10; ++j) {
1394 /* Check each referenced match string. They must all be
1395 * equal. */
1396 if (bsx->matches[j] != six->matches[j]) {
1397 /* If the pointer is different it can still be the
1398 * same text. Compare the strings, ignore case when
1399 * the start item has the sp_ic flag set. */
1400 if (bsx->matches[j] == NULL((void*)0)
1401 || six->matches[j] == NULL((void*)0))
1402 break;
1403 if ((SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx]).sp_ic
1404 ? MB_STRICMP(bsx->matches[j],mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(bsx->matches[j]), (char_u *)(six->
matches[j]), (int)(0x7fffffffL))
1405 six->matches[j])mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(bsx->matches[j]), (char_u *)(six->
matches[j]), (int)(0x7fffffffL)) != 0
1406 : STRCMP(bsx->matches[j], six->matches[j])strcmp((char *)(bsx->matches[j]), (char *)(six->matches
[j])) != 0)
1407 break;
1408 }
1409 }
1410 if (j != NSUBEXP10)
1411 break;
1412 }
1413 }
1414 if (i < 0)
1415 return TRUE1;
1416 }
1417 return FALSE0;
1418}
1419
1420/*
1421 * We stop parsing syntax above line "lnum". If the stored state at or below
1422 * this line depended on a change before it, it now depends on the line below
1423 * the last parsed line.
1424 * The window looks like this:
1425 * line which changed
1426 * displayed line
1427 * displayed line
1428 * lnum -> line below window
1429 */
1430void syntax_end_parsing(linenr_T lnum)
1431{
1432 synstate_T *sp;
1433
1434 sp = syn_stack_find_entry(lnum);
1435 if (sp != NULL((void*)0) && sp->sst_lnum < lnum)
1436 sp = sp->sst_next;
1437
1438 if (sp != NULL((void*)0) && sp->sst_change_lnum != 0)
1439 sp->sst_change_lnum = lnum;
1440}
1441
1442/*
1443 * End of handling of the state stack.
1444 ****************************************/
1445
1446static void invalidate_current_state(void)
1447{
1448 clear_current_state();
1449 current_state.ga_itemsize = 0; /* mark current_state invalid */
1450 current_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
1451 keepend_level = -1;
1452}
1453
1454static void validate_current_state(void)
1455{
1456 current_state.ga_itemsize = sizeof(stateitem_T);
1457 ga_set_growsize(&current_state, 3);
1458}
1459
1460/*
1461 * Return TRUE if the syntax at start of lnum changed since last time.
1462 * This will only be called just after get_syntax_attr() for the previous
1463 * line, to check if the next line needs to be redrawn too.
1464 */
1465int syntax_check_changed(linenr_T lnum)
1466{
1467 int retval = TRUE1;
1468 synstate_T *sp;
1469
1470 /*
1471 * Check the state stack when:
1472 * - lnum is just below the previously syntaxed line.
1473 * - lnum is not before the lines with saved states.
1474 * - lnum is not past the lines with saved states.
1475 * - lnum is at or before the last changed line.
1476 */
1477 if (VALID_STATE(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_itemsize != 0) && lnum == current_lnum + 1) {
1478 sp = syn_stack_find_entry(lnum);
1479 if (sp != NULL((void*)0) && sp->sst_lnum == lnum) {
1480 /*
1481 * finish the previous line (needed when not all of the line was
1482 * drawn)
1483 */
1484 (void)syn_finish_line(FALSE0);
1485
1486 /*
1487 * Compare the current state with the previously saved state of
1488 * the line.
1489 */
1490 if (syn_stack_equal(sp))
1491 retval = FALSE0;
1492
1493 /*
1494 * Store the current state in b_sst_array[] for later use.
1495 */
1496 ++current_lnum;
1497 (void)store_current_state();
1498 }
1499 }
1500
1501 return retval;
1502}
1503
1504/*
1505 * Finish the current line.
1506 * This doesn't return any attributes, it only gets the state at the end of
1507 * the line. It can start anywhere in the line, as long as the current state
1508 * is valid.
1509 */
1510static int
1511syn_finish_line (
1512 int syncing /* called for syncing */
1513)
1514{
1515 stateitem_T *cur_si;
1516 colnr_T prev_current_col;
1517
1518 if (!current_finished) {
1519 while (!current_finished) {
1520 (void)syn_current_attr(syncing, FALSE0, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
1521 /*
1522 * When syncing, and found some item, need to check the item.
1523 */
1524 if (syncing && current_state.ga_len) {
1525 /*
1526 * Check for match with sync item.
1527 */
1528 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
1529 if (cur_si->si_idx >= 0
1530 && (SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx].sp_flags
1531 & (HL_SYNC_HERE0x10|HL_SYNC_THERE0x20)))
1532 return TRUE1;
1533
1534 /* syn_current_attr() will have skipped the check for an item
1535 * that ends here, need to do that now. Be careful not to go
1536 * past the NUL. */
1537 prev_current_col = current_col;
1538 if (syn_getcurline()[current_col] != NUL'\000')
1539 ++current_col;
1540 check_state_ends();
1541 current_col = prev_current_col;
1542 }
1543 ++current_col;
1544 }
1545 }
1546 return FALSE0;
1547}
1548
1549/*
1550 * Return highlight attributes for next character.
1551 * Must first call syntax_start() once for the line.
1552 * "col" is normally 0 for the first use in a line, and increments by one each
1553 * time. It's allowed to skip characters and to stop before the end of the
1554 * line. But only a "col" after a previously used column is allowed.
1555 * When "can_spell" is not NULL set it to TRUE when spell-checking should be
1556 * done.
1557 */
1558int
1559get_syntax_attr (
1560 colnr_T col,
1561 bool_Bool *can_spell,
1562 int keep_state /* keep state of char at "col" */
1563)
1564{
1565 int attr = 0;
1566
1567 if (can_spell != NULL((void*)0))
1568 /* Default: Only do spelling when there is no @Spell cluster or when
1569 * ":syn spell toplevel" was used. */
1570 *can_spell = syn_block->b_syn_spell == SYNSPL_DEFAULT0
1571 ? (syn_block->b_spell_cluster_id == 0)
1572 : (syn_block->b_syn_spell == SYNSPL_TOP1);
1573
1574 /* check for out of memory situation */
1575 if (syn_block->b_sst_array == NULL((void*)0))
1576 return 0;
1577
1578 /* After 'synmaxcol' the attribute is always zero. */
1579 if (syn_buf->b_p_smc > 0 && col >= (colnr_T)syn_buf->b_p_smc) {
1580 clear_current_state();
1581 current_id = 0;
1582 current_trans_id = 0;
1583 current_flags = 0;
1584 return 0;
1585 }
1586
1587 /* Make sure current_state is valid */
1588 if (INVALID_STATE(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_itemsize == 0))
1589 validate_current_state();
1590
1591 /*
1592 * Skip from the current column to "col", get the attributes for "col".
1593 */
1594 while (current_col <= col) {
1595 attr = syn_current_attr(FALSE0, TRUE1, can_spell,
1596 current_col == col ? keep_state : FALSE0);
1597 ++current_col;
1598 }
1599
1600 return attr;
1601}
1602
1603/*
1604 * Get syntax attributes for current_lnum, current_col.
1605 */
1606static int
1607syn_current_attr (
1608 int syncing, /* When 1: called for syncing */
1609 int displaying, /* result will be displayed */
1610 bool_Bool *can_spell, /* return: do spell checking */
1611 int keep_state /* keep syntax stack afterwards */
1612)
1613{
1614 int syn_id;
1615 lpos_T endpos; /* was: char_u *endp; */
1616 lpos_T hl_startpos; /* was: int hl_startcol; */
1617 lpos_T hl_endpos;
1618 lpos_T eos_pos; /* end-of-start match (start region) */
1619 lpos_T eoe_pos; /* end-of-end pattern */
1620 int end_idx; /* group ID for end pattern */
1621 synpat_T *spp;
1622 stateitem_T *cur_si, *sip = NULL((void*)0);
1623 int startcol;
1624 int endcol;
1625 long flags;
1626 int cchar;
1627 short *next_list;
1628 int found_match; /* found usable match */
1629 static int try_next_column = FALSE0; /* must try in next col */
1630 int do_keywords;
1631 regmmatch_T regmatch;
1632 lpos_T pos;
1633 int lc_col;
1634 reg_extmatch_T *cur_extmatch = NULL((void*)0);
1635 char_u *line; /* current line. NOTE: becomes invalid after
1636 looking for a pattern match! */
1637
1638 /* variables for zero-width matches that have a "nextgroup" argument */
1639 int keep_next_list;
1640 int zero_width_next_list = FALSE0;
1641 garray_T zero_width_next_ga;
1642
1643 /*
1644 * No character, no attributes! Past end of line?
1645 * Do try matching with an empty line (could be the start of a region).
1646 */
1647 line = syn_getcurline();
1648 if (line[current_col] == NUL'\000' && current_col != 0) {
1649 /*
1650 * If we found a match after the last column, use it.
1651 */
1652 if (next_match_idx >= 0 && next_match_col >= (int)current_col
1653 && next_match_col != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL))
1654 (void)push_next_match(NULL((void*)0));
1655
1656 current_finished = TRUE1;
1657 current_state_stored = FALSE0;
1658 return 0;
1659 }
1660
1661 /* if the current or next character is NUL, we will finish the line now */
1662 if (line[current_col] == NUL'\000' || line[current_col + 1] == NUL'\000') {
1663 current_finished = TRUE1;
1664 current_state_stored = FALSE0;
1665 }
1666
1667 /*
1668 * When in the previous column there was a match but it could not be used
1669 * (empty match or already matched in this column) need to try again in
1670 * the next column.
1671 */
1672 if (try_next_column) {
1673 next_match_idx = -1;
1674 try_next_column = FALSE0;
1675 }
1676
1677 /* Only check for keywords when not syncing and there are some. */
1678 do_keywords = !syncing
1679 && (syn_block->b_keywtab.ht_used > 0
1680 || syn_block->b_keywtab_ic.ht_used > 0);
1681
1682 /* Init the list of zero-width matches with a nextlist. This is used to
1683 * avoid matching the same item in the same position twice. */
1684 ga_init(&zero_width_next_ga, (int)sizeof(int), 10);
1685
1686 /*
1687 * Repeat matching keywords and patterns, to find contained items at the
1688 * same column. This stops when there are no extra matches at the current
1689 * column.
1690 */
1691 do {
1692 found_match = FALSE0;
1693 keep_next_list = FALSE0;
1694 syn_id = 0;
1695
1696 /*
1697 * 1. Check for a current state.
1698 * Only when there is no current state, or if the current state may
1699 * contain other things, we need to check for keywords and patterns.
1700 * Always need to check for contained items if some item has the
1701 * "containedin" argument (takes extra time!).
1702 */
1703 if (current_state.ga_len)
1704 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
1705 else
1706 cur_si = NULL((void*)0);
1707
1708 if (syn_block->b_syn_containedin || cur_si == NULL((void*)0)
1709 || cur_si->si_cont_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
1710 /*
1711 * 2. Check for keywords, if on a keyword char after a non-keyword
1712 * char. Don't do this when syncing.
1713 */
1714 if (do_keywords) {
1715 line = syn_getcurline();
1716 if (vim_iswordp_buf(line + current_col, syn_buf)
1717 && (current_col == 0
1718 || !vim_iswordp_buf(line + current_col - 1
1719 - (has_mbyte
1720 ? (*mb_head_off)(line, line + current_col - 1)
1721 : 0)
1722 , syn_buf))) {
1723 syn_id = check_keyword_id(line, (int)current_col,
1724 &endcol, &flags, &next_list, cur_si,
1725 &cchar);
1726 if (syn_id != 0) {
1727 push_current_state(KEYWORD_IDX-1);
1728 {
1729 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
1730 cur_si->si_m_startcol = current_col;
1731 cur_si->si_h_startpos.lnum = current_lnum;
1732 cur_si->si_h_startpos.col = 0; /* starts right away */
1733 cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum = current_lnum;
1734 cur_si->si_m_endpos.col = endcol;
1735 cur_si->si_h_endpos.lnum = current_lnum;
1736 cur_si->si_h_endpos.col = endcol;
1737 cur_si->si_ends = TRUE1;
1738 cur_si->si_end_idx = 0;
1739 cur_si->si_flags = flags;
1740 cur_si->si_seqnr = next_seqnr++;
1741 cur_si->si_cchar = cchar;
1742 if (current_state.ga_len > 1)
1743 cur_si->si_flags |=
1744 CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 2)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2].si_flags
1745 & HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
1746 cur_si->si_id = syn_id;
1747 cur_si->si_trans_id = syn_id;
1748 if (flags & HL_TRANSP0x02) {
1749 if (current_state.ga_len < 2) {
1750 cur_si->si_attr = 0;
1751 cur_si->si_trans_id = 0;
1752 } else {
1753 cur_si->si_attr = CUR_STATE(((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2]
1754 current_state.ga_len - 2)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2].si_attr;
1755 cur_si->si_trans_id = CUR_STATE(((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2]
1756 current_state.ga_len - 2)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2].si_trans_id;
1757 }
1758 } else
1759 cur_si->si_attr = syn_id2attr(syn_id);
1760 cur_si->si_cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
1761 cur_si->si_next_list = next_list;
1762 check_keepend();
1763 }
1764 }
1765 }
1766 }
1767
1768 /*
1769 * 3. Check for patterns (only if no keyword found).
1770 */
1771 if (syn_id == 0 && syn_block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len) {
1772 /*
1773 * If we didn't check for a match yet, or we are past it, check
1774 * for any match with a pattern.
1775 */
1776 if (next_match_idx < 0 || next_match_col < (int)current_col) {
1777 /*
1778 * Check all relevant patterns for a match at this
1779 * position. This is complicated, because matching with a
1780 * pattern takes quite a bit of time, thus we want to
1781 * avoid doing it when it's not needed.
1782 */
1783 next_match_idx = 0; /* no match in this line yet */
1784 next_match_col = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1785 for (int idx = syn_block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --idx >= 0; ) {
1786 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
1787 if ( spp->sp_syncing == syncing
1788 && (displaying || !(spp->sp_flags & HL_DISPLAY0x1000))
1789 && (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_MATCH1
1790 || spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2)
1791 && (current_next_list != NULL((void*)0)
1792 ? in_id_list(NULL((void*)0), current_next_list,
1793 &spp->sp_syn, 0)
1794 : (cur_si == NULL((void*)0)
1795 ? !(spp->sp_flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)
1796 : in_id_list(cur_si,
1797 cur_si->si_cont_list, &spp->sp_syn,
1798 spp->sp_flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)))) {
1799 /* If we already tried matching in this line, and
1800 * there isn't a match before next_match_col, skip
1801 * this item. */
1802 if (spp->sp_line_id == current_line_id
1803 && spp->sp_startcol >= next_match_col)
1804 continue;
1805 spp->sp_line_id = current_line_id;
1806
1807 lc_col = current_col - spp->sp_offsets[SPO_LC_OFF6];
1808 if (lc_col < 0)
1809 lc_col = 0;
1810
1811 regmatch.rmm_ic = spp->sp_ic;
1812 regmatch.regprog = spp->sp_prog;
1813 if (!syn_regexec(&regmatch,
1814 current_lnum,
1815 (colnr_T)lc_col,
1816 IF_SYN_TIME(&spp->sp_time)(&spp->sp_time))) {
1817 /* no match in this line, try another one */
1818 spp->sp_startcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1819 continue;
1820 }
1821
1822 /*
1823 * Compute the first column of the match.
1824 */
1825 syn_add_start_off(&pos, &regmatch,
1826 spp, SPO_MS_OFF0, -1);
1827 if (pos.lnum > current_lnum) {
1828 /* must have used end of match in a next line,
1829 * we can't handle that */
1830 spp->sp_startcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1831 continue;
1832 }
1833 startcol = pos.col;
1834
1835 /* remember the next column where this pattern
1836 * matches in the current line */
1837 spp->sp_startcol = startcol;
1838
1839 /*
1840 * If a previously found match starts at a lower
1841 * column number, don't use this one.
1842 */
1843 if (startcol >= next_match_col)
1844 continue;
1845
1846 /*
1847 * If we matched this pattern at this position
1848 * before, skip it. Must retry in the next
1849 * column, because it may match from there.
1850 */
1851 if (did_match_already(idx, &zero_width_next_ga)) {
1852 try_next_column = TRUE1;
1853 continue;
1854 }
1855
1856 endpos.lnum = regmatch.endpos[0].lnum;
1857 endpos.col = regmatch.endpos[0].col;
1858
1859 /* Compute the highlight start. */
1860 syn_add_start_off(&hl_startpos, &regmatch,
1861 spp, SPO_HS_OFF2, -1);
1862
1863 /* Compute the region start. */
1864 /* Default is to use the end of the match. */
1865 syn_add_end_off(&eos_pos, &regmatch,
1866 spp, SPO_RS_OFF4, 0);
1867
1868 /*
1869 * Grab the external submatches before they get
1870 * overwritten. Reference count doesn't change.
1871 */
1872 unref_extmatch(cur_extmatch);
1873 cur_extmatch = re_extmatch_out;
1874 re_extmatch_out = NULL((void*)0);
1875
1876 flags = 0;
1877 eoe_pos.lnum = 0; /* avoid warning */
1878 eoe_pos.col = 0;
1879 end_idx = 0;
1880 hl_endpos.lnum = 0;
1881
1882 /*
1883 * For a "oneline" the end must be found in the
1884 * same line too. Search for it after the end of
1885 * the match with the start pattern. Set the
1886 * resulting end positions at the same time.
1887 */
1888 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2
1889 && (spp->sp_flags & HL_ONELINE0x04)) {
1890 lpos_T startpos;
1891
1892 startpos = endpos;
1893 find_endpos(idx, &startpos, &endpos, &hl_endpos,
1894 &flags, &eoe_pos, &end_idx, cur_extmatch);
1895 if (endpos.lnum == 0)
1896 continue; /* not found */
1897 }
1898 /*
1899 * For a "match" the size must be > 0 after the
1900 * end offset needs has been added. Except when
1901 * syncing.
1902 */
1903 else if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_MATCH1) {
1904 syn_add_end_off(&hl_endpos, &regmatch, spp,
1905 SPO_HE_OFF3, 0);
1906 syn_add_end_off(&endpos, &regmatch, spp,
1907 SPO_ME_OFF1, 0);
1908 if (endpos.lnum == current_lnum
1909 && (int)endpos.col + syncing < startcol) {
1910 /*
1911 * If an empty string is matched, may need
1912 * to try matching again at next column.
1913 */
1914 if (regmatch.startpos[0].col
1915 == regmatch.endpos[0].col)
1916 try_next_column = TRUE1;
1917 continue;
1918 }
1919 }
1920
1921 /*
1922 * keep the best match so far in next_match_*
1923 */
1924 /* Highlighting must start after startpos and end
1925 * before endpos. */
1926 if (hl_startpos.lnum == current_lnum
1927 && (int)hl_startpos.col < startcol)
1928 hl_startpos.col = startcol;
1929 limit_pos_zero(&hl_endpos, &endpos);
1930
1931 next_match_idx = idx;
1932 next_match_col = startcol;
1933 next_match_m_endpos = endpos;
1934 next_match_h_endpos = hl_endpos;
1935 next_match_h_startpos = hl_startpos;
1936 next_match_flags = flags;
1937 next_match_eos_pos = eos_pos;
1938 next_match_eoe_pos = eoe_pos;
1939 next_match_end_idx = end_idx;
1940 unref_extmatch(next_match_extmatch);
1941 next_match_extmatch = cur_extmatch;
1942 cur_extmatch = NULL((void*)0);
1943 }
1944 }
1945 }
1946
1947 /*
1948 * If we found a match at the current column, use it.
1949 */
1950 if (next_match_idx >= 0 && next_match_col == (int)current_col) {
1951 synpat_T *lspp;
1952
1953 /* When a zero-width item matched which has a nextgroup,
1954 * don't push the item but set nextgroup. */
1955 lspp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[next_match_idx]);
1956 if (next_match_m_endpos.lnum == current_lnum
1957 && next_match_m_endpos.col == current_col
1958 && lspp->sp_next_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
1959 current_next_list = lspp->sp_next_list;
1960 current_next_flags = lspp->sp_flags;
1961 keep_next_list = TRUE1;
1962 zero_width_next_list = TRUE1;
1963
1964 /* Add the index to a list, so that we can check
1965 * later that we don't match it again (and cause an
1966 * endless loop). */
1967 GA_APPEND(int, &zero_width_next_ga, next_match_idx)do { ga_grow(&zero_width_next_ga, 1); ((int *)(&zero_width_next_ga
)->ga_data)[(&zero_width_next_ga)->ga_len++] = (next_match_idx
); } while (0);
1968 next_match_idx = -1;
1969 } else
1970 cur_si = push_next_match(cur_si);
1971 found_match = TRUE1;
1972 }
1973 }
1974 }
1975
1976 /*
1977 * Handle searching for nextgroup match.
1978 */
1979 if (current_next_list != NULL((void*)0) && !keep_next_list) {
1980 /*
1981 * If a nextgroup was not found, continue looking for one if:
1982 * - this is an empty line and the "skipempty" option was given
1983 * - we are on white space and the "skipwhite" option was given
1984 */
1985 if (!found_match) {
1986 line = syn_getcurline();
1987 if (((current_next_flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100)
1988 && vim_iswhite(line[current_col])((line[current_col]) == ' ' || (line[current_col]) == '\t'))
1989 || ((current_next_flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200)
1990 && *line == NUL'\000'))
1991 break;
1992 }
1993
1994 /*
1995 * If a nextgroup was found: Use it, and continue looking for
1996 * contained matches.
1997 * If a nextgroup was not found: Continue looking for a normal
1998 * match.
1999 * When did set current_next_list for a zero-width item and no
2000 * match was found don't loop (would get stuck).
2001 */
2002 current_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
2003 next_match_idx = -1;
2004 if (!zero_width_next_list)
2005 found_match = TRUE1;
2006 }
2007
2008 } while (found_match);
2009
2010 /*
2011 * Use attributes from the current state, if within its highlighting.
2012 * If not, use attributes from the current-but-one state, etc.
2013 */
2014 current_attr = 0;
2015 current_id = 0;
2016 current_trans_id = 0;
2017 current_flags = 0;
2018 if (cur_si != NULL((void*)0)) {
2019 for (int idx = current_state.ga_len - 1; idx >= 0; --idx) {
2020 sip = &CUR_STATE(idx)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx];
2021 if ((current_lnum > sip->si_h_startpos.lnum
2022 || (current_lnum == sip->si_h_startpos.lnum
2023 && current_col >= sip->si_h_startpos.col))
2024 && (sip->si_h_endpos.lnum == 0
2025 || current_lnum < sip->si_h_endpos.lnum
2026 || (current_lnum == sip->si_h_endpos.lnum
2027 && current_col < sip->si_h_endpos.col))) {
2028 current_attr = sip->si_attr;
2029 current_id = sip->si_id;
2030 current_trans_id = sip->si_trans_id;
2031 current_flags = sip->si_flags;
2032 current_seqnr = sip->si_seqnr;
2033 current_sub_char = sip->si_cchar;
2034 break;
2035 }
2036 }
2037
2038 if (can_spell != NULL((void*)0)) {
2039 struct sp_syn sps;
2040
2041 /*
2042 * set "can_spell" to TRUE if spell checking is supposed to be
2043 * done in the current item.
2044 */
2045 if (syn_block->b_spell_cluster_id == 0) {
2046 /* There is no @Spell cluster: Do spelling for items without
2047 * @NoSpell cluster. */
2048 if (syn_block->b_nospell_cluster_id == 0
2049 || current_trans_id == 0)
2050 *can_spell = (syn_block->b_syn_spell != SYNSPL_NOTOP2);
2051 else {
2052 sps.inc_tag = 0;
2053 sps.id = syn_block->b_nospell_cluster_id;
2054 sps.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
2055 *can_spell = !in_id_list(sip, sip->si_cont_list, &sps, 0);
2056 }
2057 } else {
2058 /* The @Spell cluster is defined: Do spelling in items with
2059 * the @Spell cluster. But not when @NoSpell is also there.
2060 * At the toplevel only spell check when ":syn spell toplevel"
2061 * was used. */
2062 if (current_trans_id == 0)
2063 *can_spell = (syn_block->b_syn_spell == SYNSPL_TOP1);
2064 else {
2065 sps.inc_tag = 0;
2066 sps.id = syn_block->b_spell_cluster_id;
2067 sps.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
2068 *can_spell = in_id_list(sip, sip->si_cont_list, &sps, 0);
2069
2070 if (syn_block->b_nospell_cluster_id != 0) {
2071 sps.id = syn_block->b_nospell_cluster_id;
2072 if (in_id_list(sip, sip->si_cont_list, &sps, 0))
2073 *can_spell = false0;
2074 }
2075 }
2076 }
2077 }
2078
2079
2080 /*
2081 * Check for end of current state (and the states before it) at the
2082 * next column. Don't do this for syncing, because we would miss a
2083 * single character match.
2084 * First check if the current state ends at the current column. It
2085 * may be for an empty match and a containing item might end in the
2086 * current column.
2087 */
2088 if (!syncing && !keep_state) {
2089 check_state_ends();
2090 if (!GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0)
2091 && syn_getcurline()[current_col] != NUL'\000') {
2092 ++current_col;
2093 check_state_ends();
2094 --current_col;
2095 }
2096 }
2097 } else if (can_spell != NULL((void*)0))
2098 /* Default: Only do spelling when there is no @Spell cluster or when
2099 * ":syn spell toplevel" was used. */
2100 *can_spell = syn_block->b_syn_spell == SYNSPL_DEFAULT0
2101 ? (syn_block->b_spell_cluster_id == 0)
2102 : (syn_block->b_syn_spell == SYNSPL_TOP1);
2103
2104 /* nextgroup ends at end of line, unless "skipnl" or "skipempty" present */
2105 if (current_next_list != NULL((void*)0)
2106 && syn_getcurline()[current_col + 1] == NUL'\000'
2107 && !(current_next_flags & (HL_SKIPNL0x80 | HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200)))
2108 current_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
2109
2110 if (!GA_EMPTY(&zero_width_next_ga)((&zero_width_next_ga)->ga_len <= 0))
2111 ga_clear(&zero_width_next_ga);
2112
2113 /* No longer need external matches. But keep next_match_extmatch. */
2114 unref_extmatch(re_extmatch_out);
2115 re_extmatch_out = NULL((void*)0);
2116 unref_extmatch(cur_extmatch);
2117
2118 return current_attr;
2119}
2120
2121
2122/*
2123 * Check if we already matched pattern "idx" at the current column.
2124 */
2125static int did_match_already(int idx, garray_T *gap)
2126{
2127 for (int i = current_state.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
2128 if (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_m_startcol == (int)current_col
2129 && CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_m_lnum == (int)current_lnum
2130 && CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_idx == idx) {
2131 return TRUE1;
2132 }
2133 }
2134
2135 /* Zero-width matches with a nextgroup argument are not put on the syntax
2136 * stack, and can only be matched once anyway. */
2137 for (int i = gap->ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
2138 if (((int *)(gap->ga_data))[i] == idx) {
2139 return TRUE1;
2140 }
2141 }
2142
2143 return FALSE0;
2144}
2145
2146/*
2147 * Push the next match onto the stack.
2148 */
2149static stateitem_T *push_next_match(stateitem_T *cur_si)
2150{
2151 synpat_T *spp;
2152 int save_flags;
2153
2154 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[next_match_idx]);
2155
2156 /*
2157 * Push the item in current_state stack;
2158 */
2159 push_current_state(next_match_idx);
2160 {
2161 /*
2162 * If it's a start-skip-end type that crosses lines, figure out how
2163 * much it continues in this line. Otherwise just fill in the length.
2164 */
2165 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
2166 cur_si->si_h_startpos = next_match_h_startpos;
2167 cur_si->si_m_startcol = current_col;
2168 cur_si->si_m_lnum = current_lnum;
2169 cur_si->si_flags = spp->sp_flags;
2170 cur_si->si_seqnr = next_seqnr++;
2171 cur_si->si_cchar = spp->sp_cchar;
2172 if (current_state.ga_len > 1)
2173 cur_si->si_flags |=
2174 CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 2)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 2].si_flags & HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
2175 cur_si->si_next_list = spp->sp_next_list;
2176 cur_si->si_extmatch = ref_extmatch(next_match_extmatch);
2177 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2 && !(spp->sp_flags & HL_ONELINE0x04)) {
2178 /* Try to find the end pattern in the current line */
2179 update_si_end(cur_si, (int)(next_match_m_endpos.col), TRUE1);
2180 check_keepend();
2181 } else {
2182 cur_si->si_m_endpos = next_match_m_endpos;
2183 cur_si->si_h_endpos = next_match_h_endpos;
2184 cur_si->si_ends = TRUE1;
2185 cur_si->si_flags |= next_match_flags;
2186 cur_si->si_eoe_pos = next_match_eoe_pos;
2187 cur_si->si_end_idx = next_match_end_idx;
2188 }
2189 if (keepend_level < 0 && (cur_si->si_flags & HL_KEEPEND0x400))
2190 keepend_level = current_state.ga_len - 1;
2191 check_keepend();
2192 update_si_attr(current_state.ga_len - 1);
2193
2194 save_flags = cur_si->si_flags & (HL_CONCEAL0x20000 | HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000);
2195 /*
2196 * If the start pattern has another highlight group, push another item
2197 * on the stack for the start pattern.
2198 */
2199 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2 && spp->sp_syn_match_id != 0) {
2200 push_current_state(next_match_idx);
2201 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
2202 cur_si->si_h_startpos = next_match_h_startpos;
2203 cur_si->si_m_startcol = current_col;
2204 cur_si->si_m_lnum = current_lnum;
2205 cur_si->si_m_endpos = next_match_eos_pos;
2206 cur_si->si_h_endpos = next_match_eos_pos;
2207 cur_si->si_ends = TRUE1;
2208 cur_si->si_end_idx = 0;
2209 cur_si->si_flags = HL_MATCH0x40;
2210 cur_si->si_seqnr = next_seqnr++;
2211 cur_si->si_flags |= save_flags;
2212 if (cur_si->si_flags & HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000)
2213 cur_si->si_flags |= HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
2214 cur_si->si_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
2215 check_keepend();
2216 update_si_attr(current_state.ga_len - 1);
2217 }
2218 }
2219
2220 next_match_idx = -1; /* try other match next time */
2221
2222 return cur_si;
2223}
2224
2225/*
2226 * Check for end of current state (and the states before it).
2227 */
2228static void check_state_ends(void)
2229{
2230 stateitem_T *cur_si;
2231 int had_extend;
2232
2233 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
2234 for (;; ) {
2235 if (cur_si->si_ends
2236 && (cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum < current_lnum
2237 || (cur_si->si_m_endpos.lnum == current_lnum
2238 && cur_si->si_m_endpos.col <= current_col))) {
2239 /*
2240 * If there is an end pattern group ID, highlight the end pattern
2241 * now. No need to pop the current item from the stack.
2242 * Only do this if the end pattern continues beyond the current
2243 * position.
2244 */
2245 if (cur_si->si_end_idx
2246 && (cur_si->si_eoe_pos.lnum > current_lnum
2247 || (cur_si->si_eoe_pos.lnum == current_lnum
2248 && cur_si->si_eoe_pos.col > current_col))) {
2249 cur_si->si_idx = cur_si->si_end_idx;
2250 cur_si->si_end_idx = 0;
2251 cur_si->si_m_endpos = cur_si->si_eoe_pos;
2252 cur_si->si_h_endpos = cur_si->si_eoe_pos;
2253 cur_si->si_flags |= HL_MATCH0x40;
2254 cur_si->si_seqnr = next_seqnr++;
2255 if (cur_si->si_flags & HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000)
2256 cur_si->si_flags |= HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
2257 update_si_attr(current_state.ga_len - 1);
2258
2259 /* nextgroup= should not match in the end pattern */
2260 current_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
2261
2262 /* what matches next may be different now, clear it */
2263 next_match_idx = 0;
2264 next_match_col = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2265 break;
2266 } else {
2267 /* handle next_list, unless at end of line and no "skipnl" or
2268 * "skipempty" */
2269 current_next_list = cur_si->si_next_list;
2270 current_next_flags = cur_si->si_flags;
2271 if (!(current_next_flags & (HL_SKIPNL0x80 | HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200))
2272 && syn_getcurline()[current_col] == NUL'\000')
2273 current_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
2274
2275 /* When the ended item has "extend", another item with
2276 * "keepend" now needs to check for its end. */
2277 had_extend = (cur_si->si_flags & HL_EXTEND0x4000);
2278
2279 pop_current_state();
2280
2281 if (GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0))
2282 break;
2283
2284 if (had_extend && keepend_level >= 0) {
2285 syn_update_ends(FALSE0);
2286 if (GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0))
2287 break;
2288 }
2289
2290 cur_si = &CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1];
2291
2292 /*
2293 * Only for a region the search for the end continues after
