2294 * the end of the contained item. If the contained match
2295 * included the end-of-line, break here, the region continues.
2296 * Don't do this when:
2297 * - "keepend" is used for the contained item
2298 * - not at the end of the line (could be end="x$"me=e-1).
2299 * - "excludenl" is used (HL_HAS_EOL won't be set)
2300 */
2301 if (cur_si->si_idx >= 0
2302 && SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx].sp_type
2303 == SPTYPE_START2
2304 && !(cur_si->si_flags & (HL_MATCH0x40 | HL_KEEPEND0x400))) {
2305 update_si_end(cur_si, (int)current_col, TRUE1);
2306 check_keepend();
2307 if ((current_next_flags & HL_HAS_EOL0x08)
2308 && keepend_level < 0
2309 && syn_getcurline()[current_col] == NUL'\000')
2310 break;
2311 }
2312 }
2313 } else
2314 break;
2315 }
2316}
2317
2318/*
2319 * Update an entry in the current_state stack for a match or region. This
2320 * fills in si_attr, si_next_list and si_cont_list.
2321 */
2322static void update_si_attr(int idx)
2323{
2324 stateitem_T *sip = &CUR_STATE(idx)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx];
2325 synpat_T *spp;
2326
2327 /* This should not happen... */
2328 if (sip->si_idx < 0)
2329 return;
2330
2331 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[sip->si_idx]);
2332 if (sip->si_flags & HL_MATCH0x40)
2333 sip->si_id = spp->sp_syn_match_id;
2334 else
2335 sip->si_id = spp->sp_syn.id;
2336 sip->si_attr = syn_id2attr(sip->si_id);
2337 sip->si_trans_id = sip->si_id;
2338 if (sip->si_flags & HL_MATCH0x40)
2339 sip->si_cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
2340 else
2341 sip->si_cont_list = spp->sp_cont_list;
2342
2343 /*
2344 * For transparent items, take attr from outer item.
2345 * Also take cont_list, if there is none.
2346 * Don't do this for the matchgroup of a start or end pattern.
2347 */
2348 if ((spp->sp_flags & HL_TRANSP0x02) && !(sip->si_flags & HL_MATCH0x40)) {
2349 if (idx == 0) {
2350 sip->si_attr = 0;
2351 sip->si_trans_id = 0;
2352 if (sip->si_cont_list == NULL((void*)0))
2353 sip->si_cont_list = ID_LIST_ALL(short *)-1;
2354 } else {
2355 sip->si_attr = CUR_STATE(idx - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx - 1].si_attr;
2356 sip->si_trans_id = CUR_STATE(idx - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx - 1].si_trans_id;
2357 sip->si_h_startpos = CUR_STATE(idx - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx - 1].si_h_startpos;
2358 sip->si_h_endpos = CUR_STATE(idx - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx - 1].si_h_endpos;
2359 if (sip->si_cont_list == NULL((void*)0)) {
2360 sip->si_flags |= HL_TRANS_CONT0x10000;
2361 sip->si_cont_list = CUR_STATE(idx - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[idx - 1].si_cont_list;
2362 }
2363 }
2364 }
2365}
2366
2367/*
2368 * Check the current stack for patterns with "keepend" flag.
2369 * Propagate the match-end to contained items, until a "skipend" item is found.
2370 */
2371static void check_keepend(void)
2372{
2373 int i;
2374 lpos_T maxpos;
2375 lpos_T maxpos_h;
2376 stateitem_T *sip;
2377
2378 /*
2379 * This check can consume a lot of time; only do it from the level where
2380 * there really is a keepend.
2381 */
2382 if (keepend_level < 0)
2383 return;
2384
2385 /*
2386 * Find the last index of an "extend" item. "keepend" items before that
2387 * won't do anything. If there is no "extend" item "i" will be
2388 * "keepend_level" and all "keepend" items will work normally.
2389 */
2390 for (i = current_state.ga_len - 1; i > keepend_level; --i)
2391 if (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags & HL_EXTEND0x4000)
2392 break;
2393
2394 maxpos.lnum = 0;
2395 maxpos.col = 0;
2396 maxpos_h.lnum = 0;
2397 maxpos_h.col = 0;
2398 for (; i < current_state.ga_len; ++i) {
2399 sip = &CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i];
2400 if (maxpos.lnum != 0) {
2401 limit_pos_zero(&sip->si_m_endpos, &maxpos);
2402 limit_pos_zero(&sip->si_h_endpos, &maxpos_h);
2403 limit_pos_zero(&sip->si_eoe_pos, &maxpos);
2404 sip->si_ends = TRUE1;
2405 }
2406 if (sip->si_ends && (sip->si_flags & HL_KEEPEND0x400)) {
2407 if (maxpos.lnum == 0
2408 || maxpos.lnum > sip->si_m_endpos.lnum
2409 || (maxpos.lnum == sip->si_m_endpos.lnum
2410 && maxpos.col > sip->si_m_endpos.col))
2411 maxpos = sip->si_m_endpos;
2412 if (maxpos_h.lnum == 0
2413 || maxpos_h.lnum > sip->si_h_endpos.lnum
2414 || (maxpos_h.lnum == sip->si_h_endpos.lnum
2415 && maxpos_h.col > sip->si_h_endpos.col))
2416 maxpos_h = sip->si_h_endpos;
2417 }
2418 }
2419}
2420
2421/*
2422 * Update an entry in the current_state stack for a start-skip-end pattern.
2423 * This finds the end of the current item, if it's in the current line.
2424 *
2425 * Return the flags for the matched END.
2426 */
2427static void
2428update_si_end (
2429 stateitem_T *sip,
2430 int startcol, /* where to start searching for the end */
2431 int force /* when TRUE overrule a previous end */
2432)
2433{
2434 lpos_T startpos;
2435 lpos_T endpos;
2436 lpos_T hl_endpos;
2437 lpos_T end_endpos;
2438 int end_idx;
2439
2440 /* return quickly for a keyword */
2441 if (sip->si_idx < 0)
2442 return;
2443
2444 /* Don't update when it's already done. Can be a match of an end pattern
2445 * that started in a previous line. Watch out: can also be a "keepend"
2446 * from a containing item. */
2447 if (!force && sip->si_m_endpos.lnum >= current_lnum)
2448 return;
2449
2450 /*
2451 * We need to find the end of the region. It may continue in the next
2452 * line.
2453 */
2454 end_idx = 0;
2455 startpos.lnum = current_lnum;
2456 startpos.col = startcol;
2457 find_endpos(sip->si_idx, &startpos, &endpos, &hl_endpos,
2458 &(sip->si_flags), &end_endpos, &end_idx, sip->si_extmatch);
2459
2460 if (endpos.lnum == 0) {
2461 /* No end pattern matched. */
2462 if (SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[sip->si_idx].sp_flags & HL_ONELINE0x04) {
2463 /* a "oneline" never continues in the next line */
2464 sip->si_ends = TRUE1;
2465 sip->si_m_endpos.lnum = current_lnum;
2466 sip->si_m_endpos.col = (colnr_T)STRLEN(syn_getcurline())strlen((char *)(syn_getcurline()));
2467 } else {
2468 /* continues in the next line */
2469 sip->si_ends = FALSE0;
2470 sip->si_m_endpos.lnum = 0;
2471 }
2472 sip->si_h_endpos = sip->si_m_endpos;
2473 } else {
2474 /* match within this line */
2475 sip->si_m_endpos = endpos;
2476 sip->si_h_endpos = hl_endpos;
2477 sip->si_eoe_pos = end_endpos;
2478 sip->si_ends = TRUE1;
2479 sip->si_end_idx = end_idx;
2480 }
2481}
2482
2483/*
2484 * Add a new state to the current state stack.
2485 * It is cleared and the index set to "idx".
2486 */
2487static void push_current_state(int idx)
2488{
2489 stateitem_T *p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(stateitem_T, &current_state)ga_append_via_ptr(&current_state, sizeof(stateitem_T));
2490 memset(p, 0, sizeof(*p));
2491 p->si_idx = idx;
2492}
2493
2494/*
2495 * Remove a state from the current_state stack.
2496 */
2497static void pop_current_state(void)
2498{
2499 if (!GA_EMPTY(&current_state)((&current_state)->ga_len <= 0)) {
2500 unref_extmatch(CUR_STATE(current_state.ga_len - 1)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[current_state.ga_len
- 1].si_extmatch);
2501 --current_state.ga_len;
2502 }
2503 /* after the end of a pattern, try matching a keyword or pattern */
2504 next_match_idx = -1;
2505
2506 /* if first state with "keepend" is popped, reset keepend_level */
2507 if (keepend_level >= current_state.ga_len)
2508 keepend_level = -1;
2509}
2510
2511/*
2512 * Find the end of a start/skip/end syntax region after "startpos".
2513 * Only checks one line.
2514 * Also handles a match item that continued from a previous line.
2515 * If not found, the syntax item continues in the next line. m_endpos->lnum
2516 * will be 0.
2517 * If found, the end of the region and the end of the highlighting is
2518 * computed.
2519 */
2520static void
2521find_endpos (
2522 int idx, /* index of the pattern */
2523 lpos_T *startpos, /* where to start looking for an END match */
2524 lpos_T *m_endpos, /* return: end of match */
2525 lpos_T *hl_endpos, /* return: end of highlighting */
2526 long *flagsp, /* return: flags of matching END */
2527 lpos_T *end_endpos, /* return: end of end pattern match */
2528 int *end_idx, /* return: group ID for end pat. match, or 0 */
2529 reg_extmatch_T *start_ext /* submatches from the start pattern */
2530)
2531{
2532 colnr_T matchcol;
2533 synpat_T *spp, *spp_skip;
2534 int start_idx;
2535 int best_idx;
2536 regmmatch_T regmatch;
2537 regmmatch_T best_regmatch; /* startpos/endpos of best match */
2538 lpos_T pos;
2539 char_u *line;
2540 int had_match = FALSE0;
2541
2542 /* just in case we are invoked for a keyword */
2543 if (idx < 0)
2544 return;
2545
2546 /*
2547 * Check for being called with a START pattern.
2548 * Can happen with a match that continues to the next line, because it
2549 * contained a region.
2550 */
2551 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
2552 if (spp->sp_type != SPTYPE_START2) {
2553 *hl_endpos = *startpos;
2554 return;
2555 }
2556
2557 /*
2558 * Find the SKIP or first END pattern after the last START pattern.
2559 */
2560 for (;; ) {
2561 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
2562 if (spp->sp_type != SPTYPE_START2)
2563 break;
2564 ++idx;
2565 }
2566
2567 /*
2568 * Lookup the SKIP pattern (if present)
2569 */
2570 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_SKIP4) {
2571 spp_skip = spp;
2572 ++idx;
2573 } else
2574 spp_skip = NULL((void*)0);
2575
2576 /* Setup external matches for syn_regexec(). */
2577 unref_extmatch(re_extmatch_in);
2578 re_extmatch_in = ref_extmatch(start_ext);
2579
2580 matchcol = startpos->col; /* start looking for a match at sstart */
2581 start_idx = idx; /* remember the first END pattern. */
2582 best_regmatch.startpos[0].col = 0; /* avoid compiler warning */
2583 for (;; ) {
2584 /*
2585 * Find end pattern that matches first after "matchcol".
2586 */
2587 best_idx = -1;
2588 for (idx = start_idx; idx < syn_block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; ++idx) {
2589 int lc_col = matchcol;
2590
2591 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
2592 if (spp->sp_type != SPTYPE_END3) /* past last END pattern */
2593 break;
2594 lc_col -= spp->sp_offsets[SPO_LC_OFF6];
2595 if (lc_col < 0)
2596 lc_col = 0;
2597
2598 regmatch.rmm_ic = spp->sp_ic;
2599 regmatch.regprog = spp->sp_prog;
2600 if (syn_regexec(&regmatch, startpos->lnum, lc_col,
2601 IF_SYN_TIME(&spp->sp_time)(&spp->sp_time))) {
2602 if (best_idx == -1 || regmatch.startpos[0].col
2603 < best_regmatch.startpos[0].col) {
2604 best_idx = idx;
2605 best_regmatch.startpos[0] = regmatch.startpos[0];
2606 best_regmatch.endpos[0] = regmatch.endpos[0];
2607 }
2608 }
2609 }
2610
2611 /*
2612 * If all end patterns have been tried, and there is no match, the
2613 * item continues until end-of-line.
2614 */
2615 if (best_idx == -1)
2616 break;
2617
2618 /*
2619 * If the skip pattern matches before the end pattern,
2620 * continue searching after the skip pattern.
2621 */
2622 if (spp_skip != NULL((void*)0)) {
2623 int lc_col = matchcol - spp_skip->sp_offsets[SPO_LC_OFF6];
2624
2625 if (lc_col < 0)
2626 lc_col = 0;
2627 regmatch.rmm_ic = spp_skip->sp_ic;
2628 regmatch.regprog = spp_skip->sp_prog;
2629 if (syn_regexec(&regmatch, startpos->lnum, lc_col,
2630 IF_SYN_TIME(&spp_skip->sp_time)(&spp_skip->sp_time))
2631 && regmatch.startpos[0].col
2632 <= best_regmatch.startpos[0].col) {
2633 /* Add offset to skip pattern match */
2634 syn_add_end_off(&pos, &regmatch, spp_skip, SPO_ME_OFF1, 1);
2635
2636 /* If the skip pattern goes on to the next line, there is no
2637 * match with an end pattern in this line. */
2638 if (pos.lnum > startpos->lnum)
2639 break;
2640
2641 line = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, startpos->lnum, FALSE0);
2642
2643 /* take care of an empty match or negative offset */
2644 if (pos.col <= matchcol)
2645 ++matchcol;
2646 else if (pos.col <= regmatch.endpos[0].col)
2647 matchcol = pos.col;
2648 else
2649 /* Be careful not to jump over the NUL at the end-of-line */
2650 for (matchcol = regmatch.endpos[0].col;
2651 line[matchcol] != NUL'\000' && matchcol < pos.col;
2652 ++matchcol)
2653 ;
2654
2655 /* if the skip pattern includes end-of-line, break here */
2656 if (line[matchcol] == NUL'\000')
2657 break;
2658
2659 continue; /* start with first end pattern again */
2660 }
2661 }
2662
2663 /*
2664 * Match from start pattern to end pattern.
2665 * Correct for match and highlight offset of end pattern.
2666 */
2667 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[best_idx]);
2668 syn_add_end_off(m_endpos, &best_regmatch, spp, SPO_ME_OFF1, 1);
2669 /* can't end before the start */
2670 if (m_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum && m_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2671 m_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2672
2673 syn_add_end_off(end_endpos, &best_regmatch, spp, SPO_HE_OFF3, 1);
2674 /* can't end before the start */
2675 if (end_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum
2676 && end_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2677 end_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2678 /* can't end after the match */
2679 limit_pos(end_endpos, m_endpos);
2680
2681 /*
2682 * If the end group is highlighted differently, adjust the pointers.
2683 */
2684 if (spp->sp_syn_match_id != spp->sp_syn.id && spp->sp_syn_match_id != 0) {
2685 *end_idx = best_idx;
2686 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << (SPO_RE_OFF5 + SPO_COUNT7))) {
2687 hl_endpos->lnum = best_regmatch.endpos[0].lnum;
2688 hl_endpos->col = best_regmatch.endpos[0].col;
2689 } else {
2690 hl_endpos->lnum = best_regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
2691 hl_endpos->col = best_regmatch.startpos[0].col;
2692 }
2693 hl_endpos->col += spp->sp_offsets[SPO_RE_OFF5];
2694
2695 /* can't end before the start */
2696 if (hl_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum
2697 && hl_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2698 hl_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2699 limit_pos(hl_endpos, m_endpos);
2700
2701 /* now the match ends where the highlighting ends, it is turned
2702 * into the matchgroup for the end */
2703 *m_endpos = *hl_endpos;
2704 } else {
2705 *end_idx = 0;
2706 *hl_endpos = *end_endpos;
2707 }
2708
2709 *flagsp = spp->sp_flags;
2710
2711 had_match = TRUE1;
2712 break;
2713 }
2714
2715 /* no match for an END pattern in this line */
2716 if (!had_match)
2717 m_endpos->lnum = 0;
2718
2719 /* Remove external matches. */
2720 unref_extmatch(re_extmatch_in);
2721 re_extmatch_in = NULL((void*)0);
2722}
2723
2724/*
2725 * Limit "pos" not to be after "limit".
2726 */
2727static void limit_pos(lpos_T *pos, lpos_T *limit)
2728{
2729 if (pos->lnum > limit->lnum)
2730 *pos = *limit;
2731 else if (pos->lnum == limit->lnum && pos->col > limit->col)
2732 pos->col = limit->col;
2733}
2734
2735/*
2736 * Limit "pos" not to be after "limit", unless pos->lnum is zero.
2737 */
2738static void limit_pos_zero(lpos_T *pos, lpos_T *limit)
2739{
2740 if (pos->lnum == 0)
2741 *pos = *limit;
2742 else
2743 limit_pos(pos, limit);
2744}
2745
2746/*
2747 * Add offset to matched text for end of match or highlight.
2748 */
2749static void
2750syn_add_end_off (
2751 lpos_T *result, /* returned position */
2752 regmmatch_T *regmatch, /* start/end of match */
2753 synpat_T *spp, /* matched pattern */
2754 int idx, /* index of offset */
2755 int extra /* extra chars for offset to start */
2756)
2757{
2758 int col;
2759 int off;
2760 char_u *base;
2761 char_u *p;
2762
2763 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << idx)) {
2764 result->lnum = regmatch->startpos[0].lnum;
2765 col = regmatch->startpos[0].col;
2766 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx] + extra;
2767 } else {
2768 result->lnum = regmatch->endpos[0].lnum;
2769 col = regmatch->endpos[0].col;
2770 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx];
2771 }
2772 /* Don't go past the end of the line. Matters for "rs=e+2" when there
2773 * is a matchgroup. Watch out for match with last NL in the buffer. */
2774 if (result->lnum > syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
2775 col = 0;
2776 else if (off != 0) {
2777 base = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE0);
2778 p = base + col;
2779 if (off > 0) {
2780 while (off-- > 0 && *p != NUL'\000')
2781 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
2782 } else if (off < 0) {
2783 while (off++ < 0 && base < p)
2784 mb_ptr_back(base, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(base, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
2785 }
2786 col = (int)(p - base);
2787 }
2788 result->col = col;
2789}
2790
2791/*
2792 * Add offset to matched text for start of match or highlight.
2793 * Avoid resulting column to become negative.
2794 */
2795static void
2796syn_add_start_off (
2797 lpos_T *result, /* returned position */
2798 regmmatch_T *regmatch, /* start/end of match */
2799 synpat_T *spp,
2800 int idx,
2801 int extra /* extra chars for offset to end */
2802)
2803{
2804 int col;
2805 int off;
2806 char_u *base;
2807 char_u *p;
2808
2809 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << (idx + SPO_COUNT7))) {
2810 result->lnum = regmatch->endpos[0].lnum;
2811 col = regmatch->endpos[0].col;
2812 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx] + extra;
2813 } else {
2814 result->lnum = regmatch->startpos[0].lnum;
2815 col = regmatch->startpos[0].col;
2816 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx];
2817 }
2818 if (result->lnum > syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
2819 /* a "\n" at the end of the pattern may take us below the last line */
2820 result->lnum = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
2821 col = (int)STRLEN(ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE))strlen((char *)(ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, 0)));
2822 }
2823 if (off != 0) {
2824 base = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE0);
2825 p = base + col;
2826 if (off > 0) {
2827 while (off-- && *p != NUL'\000')
2828 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
2829 } else if (off < 0) {
2830 while (off++ && base < p)
2831 mb_ptr_back(base, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(base, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
2832 }
2833 col = (int)(p - base);
2834 }
2835 result->col = col;
2836}
2837
2838/*
2839 * Get current line in syntax buffer.
2840 */
2841static char_u *syn_getcurline(void)
2842{
2843 return ml_get_buf(syn_buf, current_lnum, FALSE0);
2844}
2845
2846/*
2847 * Call vim_regexec() to find a match with "rmp" in "syn_buf".
2848 * Returns TRUE when there is a match.
2849 */
2850static int syn_regexec(regmmatch_T *rmp, linenr_T lnum, colnr_T col, syn_time_T *st)
2851{
2852 int r;
2853 proftime_T pt;
2854
2855 if (syn_time_on) {
2856 pt = profile_start();
2857 }
2858
2859 rmp->rmm_maxcol = syn_buf->b_p_smc;
2860 r = vim_regexec_multi(rmp, syn_win, syn_buf, lnum, col, NULL((void*)0));
2861
2862 if (syn_time_on) {
2863 pt = profile_end(pt);
2864 st->total = profile_add(st->total, pt);
2865 if (profile_cmp(pt, st->slowest) < 0) {
2866 st->slowest = pt;
2867 }
2868 ++st->count;
2869 if (r > 0)
2870 ++st->match;
2871 }
2872
2873 if (r > 0) {
2874 rmp->startpos[0].lnum += lnum;
2875 rmp->endpos[0].lnum += lnum;
2876 return TRUE1;
2877 }
2878 return FALSE0;
2879}
2880
2881/*
2882 * Check one position in a line for a matching keyword.
2883 * The caller must check if a keyword can start at startcol.
2884 * Return it's ID if found, 0 otherwise.
2885 */
2886static int
2887check_keyword_id (
2888 char_u *line,
2889 int startcol, /* position in line to check for keyword */
2890 int *endcolp, /* return: character after found keyword */
2891 long *flagsp, /* return: flags of matching keyword */
2892 short **next_listp, /* return: next_list of matching keyword */
2893 stateitem_T *cur_si, /* item at the top of the stack */
2894 int *ccharp /* conceal substitution char */
2895)
2896{
2897 char_u *kwp;
2898 int kwlen;
2899 char_u keyword[MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1]; /* assume max. keyword len is 80 */
2900
2901 /* Find first character after the keyword. First character was already
2902 * checked. */
2903 kwp = line + startcol;
2904 kwlen = 0;
2905 do {
2906 if (has_mbyte)
2907 kwlen += (*mb_ptr2len)(kwp + kwlen);
2908 else
2909 ++kwlen;
2910 } while (vim_iswordp_buf(kwp + kwlen, syn_buf));
2911
2912 if (kwlen > MAXKEYWLEN80)
2913 return 0;
2914
2915 /*
2916 * Must make a copy of the keyword, so we can add a NUL and make it
2917 * lowercase.
2918 */
2919 STRLCPY(keyword, kwp, kwlen + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(keyword), (char *)(kwp), (size_t)(kwlen + 1
));
2920
2921 keyentry_T *kp = NULL((void*)0);
2922
2923 // matching case
2924 if (syn_block->b_keywtab.ht_used != 0) {
2925 kp = match_keyword(keyword, &syn_block->b_keywtab, cur_si);
2926 }
2927
2928 // ignoring case
2929 if (kp == NULL((void*)0) && syn_block->b_keywtab_ic.ht_used != 0) {
2930 str_foldcase(kwp, kwlen, keyword, MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1);
2931 kp = match_keyword(keyword, &syn_block->b_keywtab_ic, cur_si);
2932 }
2933
2934 if (kp != NULL((void*)0)) {
2935 *endcolp = startcol + kwlen;
2936 *flagsp = kp->flags;
2937 *next_listp = kp->next_list;
2938 *ccharp = kp->k_char;
2939 return kp->k_syn.id;
2940 }
2941
2942 return 0;
2943}
2944
2945/// Find keywords that match. There can be several with different
2946/// attributes.
2947/// When current_next_list is non-zero accept only that group, otherwise:
2948/// Accept a not-contained keyword at toplevel.
2949/// Accept a keyword at other levels only if it is in the contains list.
2950static keyentry_T *match_keyword(char_u *keyword, hashtab_T *ht,
2951 stateitem_T *cur_si)
2952{
2953 hashitem_T *hi = hash_find(ht, keyword);
2954 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
2955 for (keyentry_T *kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); kp = kp->ke_next) {
2956 if (current_next_list != 0
2957 ? in_id_list(NULL((void*)0), current_next_list, &kp->k_syn, 0)
2958 : (cur_si == NULL((void*)0)
2959 ? !(kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)
2960 : in_id_list(cur_si, cur_si->si_cont_list,
2961 &kp->k_syn, kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01))) {
2962 return kp;
2963 }
2964 }
2965 return NULL((void*)0);
2966}
2967
2968/*
2969 * Handle ":syntax conceal" command.
2970 */
2971static void syn_cmd_conceal(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
2972{
2973 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2974 char_u *next;
2975
2976 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
2977 if (eap->skip)
2978 return;
2979
2980 next = skiptowhite(arg);
2981 if (STRNICMP(arg, "on", 2)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("on"), (size_t)(2)) == 0 && next - arg == 2)
2982 curwin->w_s->b_syn_conceal = TRUE1;
2983 else if (STRNICMP(arg, "off", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("off"), (size_t)(3)) == 0 && next - arg == 3)
2984 curwin->w_s->b_syn_conceal = FALSE0;
2985 else
2986 EMSG2(_("E390: Illegal argument: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E390: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
2987}
2988
2989/*
2990 * Handle ":syntax case" command.
2991 */
2992static void syn_cmd_case(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
2993{
2994 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2995 char_u *next;
2996
2997 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
2998 if (eap->skip)
2999 return;
3000
3001 next = skiptowhite(arg);
3002 if (STRNICMP(arg, "match", 5)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("match"), (size_t)(5)) == 0 && next - arg == 5)
3003 curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic = FALSE0;
3004 else if (STRNICMP(arg, "ignore", 6)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("ignore"), (size_t)(6)) == 0 && next - arg == 6)
3005 curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic = TRUE1;
3006 else
3007 EMSG2(_("E390: Illegal argument: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E390: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
3008}
3009
3010/*
3011 * Handle ":syntax spell" command.
3012 */
3013static void syn_cmd_spell(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3014{
3015 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3016 char_u *next;
3017
3018 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
3019 if (eap->skip)
3020 return;
3021
3022 next = skiptowhite(arg);
3023 if (STRNICMP(arg, "toplevel", 8)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("toplevel"), (size_t)(8)) == 0 && next - arg == 8)
3024 curwin->w_s->b_syn_spell = SYNSPL_TOP1;
3025 else if (STRNICMP(arg, "notoplevel", 10)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("notoplevel"), (size_t)(10
)) == 0 && next - arg == 10)
3026 curwin->w_s->b_syn_spell = SYNSPL_NOTOP2;
3027 else if (STRNICMP(arg, "default", 7)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("default"), (size_t)(7)) == 0 && next - arg == 7)
3028 curwin->w_s->b_syn_spell = SYNSPL_DEFAULT0;
3029 else
3030 EMSG2(_("E390: Illegal argument: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E390: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
3031}
3032
3033/*
3034 * Clear all syntax info for one buffer.
3035 */
3036void syntax_clear(synblock_T *block)
3037{
3038 block->b_syn_error = FALSE0; /* clear previous error */
3039 block->b_syn_ic = FALSE0; /* Use case, by default */
3040 block->b_syn_spell = SYNSPL_DEFAULT0; /* default spell checking */
3041 block->b_syn_containedin = FALSE0;
3042
3043 /* free the keywords */
3044 clear_keywtab(&block->b_keywtab);
3045 clear_keywtab(&block->b_keywtab_ic);
3046
3047 /* free the syntax patterns */
3048 for (int i = block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
3049 syn_clear_pattern(block, i);
3050 }
3051 ga_clear(&block->b_syn_patterns);
3052
3053 /* free the syntax clusters */
3054 for (int i = block->b_syn_clusters.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
3055 syn_clear_cluster(block, i);
3056 }
3057 ga_clear(&block->b_syn_clusters);
3058 block->b_spell_cluster_id = 0;
3059 block->b_nospell_cluster_id = 0;
3060
3061 block->b_syn_sync_flags = 0;
3062 block->b_syn_sync_minlines = 0;
3063 block->b_syn_sync_maxlines = 0;
3064 block->b_syn_sync_linebreaks = 0;
3065
3066 vim_regfree(block->b_syn_linecont_prog);
3067 block->b_syn_linecont_prog = NULL((void*)0);
3068 free(block->b_syn_linecont_pat);
3069 block->b_syn_linecont_pat = NULL((void*)0);
3070 block->b_syn_folditems = 0;
3071
3072 /* free the stored states */
3073 syn_stack_free_all(block);
3074 invalidate_current_state();
3075
3076 /* Reset the counter for ":syn include" */
3077 running_syn_inc_tag = 0;
3078}
3079
3080/*
3081 * Get rid of ownsyntax for window "wp".
3082 */
3083void reset_synblock(win_T *wp)
3084{
3085 if (wp->w_s != &wp->w_buffer->b_s) {
3086 syntax_clear(wp->w_s);
3087 free(wp->w_s);
3088 wp->w_s = &wp->w_buffer->b_s;
3089 }
3090}
3091
3092/*
3093 * Clear syncing info for one buffer.
3094 */
3095static void syntax_sync_clear(void)
3096{
3097 /* free the syntax patterns */
3098 for (int i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
3099 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syncing) {
3100 syn_remove_pattern(curwin->w_s, i);
3101 }
3102 }
3103
3104 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags = 0;
3105 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines = 0;
3106 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines = 0;
3107 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks = 0;
3108
3109 vim_regfree(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog);
3110 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog = NULL((void*)0);
3111 free(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat);
3112 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat = NULL((void*)0);
3113
3114 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
3115}
3116
3117/*
3118 * Remove one pattern from the buffer's pattern list.
3119 */
3120static void syn_remove_pattern(synblock_T *block, int idx)
3121{
3122 synpat_T *spp;
3123
3124 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
3125 if (spp->sp_flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
3126 --block->b_syn_folditems;
3127 syn_clear_pattern(block, idx);
3128 memmove(spp, spp + 1,
3129 sizeof(synpat_T) * (block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len - idx - 1));
3130 --block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
3131}
3132
3133/*
3134 * Clear and free one syntax pattern. When clearing all, must be called from
3135 * last to first!
3136 */
3137static void syn_clear_pattern(synblock_T *block, int i)
3138{
3139 free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_pattern);
3140 vim_regfree(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_prog);
3141 /* Only free sp_cont_list and sp_next_list of first start pattern */
3142 if (i == 0 || SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i - 1].sp_type != SPTYPE_START2) {
3143 free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_cont_list);
3144 free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_next_list);
3145 free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syn.cont_in_list);
3146 }
3147}
3148
3149/*
3150 * Clear and free one syntax cluster.
3151 */
3152static void syn_clear_cluster(synblock_T *block, int i)
3153{
3154 free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name);
3155 free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name_u);
3156 free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_list);
3157}
3158
3159/*
3160 * Handle ":syntax clear" command.
3161 */
3162static void syn_cmd_clear(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3163{
3164 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3165 char_u *arg_end;
3166 int id;
3167
3168 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
3169 if (eap->skip)
3170 return;
3171
3172 /*
3173 * We have to disable this within ":syn include @group filename",
3174 * because otherwise @group would get deleted.
3175 * Only required for Vim 5.x syntax files, 6.0 ones don't contain ":syn
3176 * clear".
3177 */
3178 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp != 0)
3179 return;
3180
3181 if (ends_excmd(*arg)) {
3182 /*
3183 * No argument: Clear all syntax items.
3184 */
3185 if (syncing)
3186 syntax_sync_clear();
3187 else {
3188 syntax_clear(curwin->w_s);
3189 if (curwin->w_s == &curwin->w_buffer->b_s)
3190 do_unlet((char_u *)"b:current_syntax", TRUE1);
3191 do_unlet((char_u *)"w:current_syntax", TRUE1);
3192 }
3193 } else {
3194 /*
3195 * Clear the group IDs that are in the argument.
3196 */
3197 while (!ends_excmd(*arg)) {
3198 arg_end = skiptowhite(arg);
3199 if (*arg == '@') {
3200 id = syn_scl_namen2id(arg + 1, (int)(arg_end - arg - 1));
3201 if (id == 0) {
3202 EMSG2(_("E391: No such syntax cluster: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E391: No such syntax cluster: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
3203 break;
3204 } else {
3205 /*
3206 * We can't physically delete a cluster without changing
3207 * the IDs of other clusters, so we do the next best thing
3208 * and make it empty.
3209 */
3210 short scl_id = id - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
3211
3212 free(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_list);
3213 SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_list = NULL((void*)0);
3214 }
3215 } else {
3216 id = syn_namen2id(arg, (int)(arg_end - arg));
3217 if (id == 0) {
3218 EMSG2(_(e_nogroup), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_nogroup))), (char_u *)(arg
));
3219 break;
3220 } else
3221 syn_clear_one(id, syncing);
3222 }
3223 arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
3224 }
3225 }
3226 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
3227 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
3228}
3229
3230/*
3231 * Clear one syntax group for the current buffer.
3232 */
3233static void syn_clear_one(int id, int syncing)
3234{
3235 synpat_T *spp;
3236
3237 /* Clear keywords only when not ":syn sync clear group-name" */
3238 if (!syncing) {
3239 (void)syn_clear_keyword(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab);
3240 (void)syn_clear_keyword(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic);
3241 }
3242
3243 /* clear the patterns for "id" */
3244 for (int idx = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --idx >= 0; ) {
3245 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
3246 if (spp->sp_syn.id != id || spp->sp_syncing != syncing)
3247 continue;
3248 syn_remove_pattern(curwin->w_s, idx);
3249 }
3250}
3251
3252/*
3253 * Handle ":syntax on" command.
3254 */
3255static void syn_cmd_on(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3256{
3257 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "syntax");
3258}
3259
3260/*
3261 * Handle ":syntax enable" command.
3262 */
3263static void syn_cmd_enable(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3264{
3265 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"syntax_cmd", (char_u *)"enable");
3266 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "syntax");
3267 do_unlet((char_u *)"g:syntax_cmd", TRUE1);
3268}
3269
3270/*
3271 * Handle ":syntax reset" command.
3272 */
3273static void syn_cmd_reset(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3274{
3275 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
3276 if (!eap->skip) {
3277 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"syntax_cmd", (char_u *)"reset");
3278 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"runtime! syntax/syncolor.vim");
3279 do_unlet((char_u *)"g:syntax_cmd", TRUE1);
3280 }
3281}
3282
3283/*
3284 * Handle ":syntax manual" command.
3285 */
3286static void syn_cmd_manual(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3287{
3288 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "manual");
3289}
3290
3291/*
3292 * Handle ":syntax off" command.
3293 */
3294static void syn_cmd_off(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3295{
3296 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "nosyntax");
3297}
3298
3299static void syn_cmd_onoff(exarg_T *eap, char *name)
3300{
3301 char_u buf[100];
3302
3303 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
3304 if (!eap->skip) {
3305 STRCPY(buf, "so ")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("so "));
3306 vim_snprintf((char *)buf + 3, sizeof(buf) - 3, SYNTAX_FNAME"$VIMRUNTIME/syntax/%s.vim", name);
3307 do_cmdline_cmd(buf);
3308 }
3309}
3310
3311/*
3312 * Handle ":syntax [list]" command: list current syntax words.
3313 */
3314static void
3315syn_cmd_list (
3316 exarg_T *eap,
3317 int syncing /* when TRUE: list syncing items */
3318)
3319{
3320 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3321 char_u *arg_end;
3322
3323 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
3324 if (eap->skip)
3325 return;
3326
3327 if (!syntax_present(curwin)) {
3328 MSG(_(msg_no_items))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(msg_no_items))));
3329 return;
3330 }
3331
3332 if (syncing) {
3333 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_CCOMMENT0x01) {
3334 MSG_PUTS(_("syncing on C-style comments"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("syncing on C-style comments"
))));
3335 syn_lines_msg();
3336 syn_match_msg();
3337 return;
3338 } else if (!(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_MATCH0x02)) {
3339 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines == 0)
3340 MSG_PUTS(_("no syncing"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("no syncing"))));
3341 else {
3342 MSG_PUTS(_("syncing starts "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("syncing starts "))));
3343 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines);
3344 MSG_PUTS(_(" lines before top line"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" lines before top line"
))));
3345 syn_match_msg();
3346 }
3347 return;
3348 }
3349 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Syntax sync items ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Syntax sync items ---"
))));
3350 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0
3351 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0
3352 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks > 0) {
3353 MSG_PUTS(_("\nsyncing on items"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\nsyncing on items"))));
3354 syn_lines_msg();
3355 syn_match_msg();
3356 }
3357 } else
3358 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_("\n--- Syntax items ---"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n--- Syntax items ---"
))));
3359 if (ends_excmd(*arg)) {
3360 /*
3361 * No argument: List all group IDs and all syntax clusters.
3362 */
3363 for (int id = 1; id <= highlight_ga.ga_len && !got_int; ++id) {
3364 syn_list_one(id, syncing, FALSE0);
3365 }
3366 for (int id = 0; id < curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len && !got_int; ++id) {
3367 syn_list_cluster(id);
3368 }
3369 } else {
3370 /*
3371 * List the group IDs and syntax clusters that are in the argument.
3372 */
3373 while (!ends_excmd(*arg) && !got_int) {
3374 arg_end = skiptowhite(arg);
3375 if (*arg == '@') {
3376 int id = syn_scl_namen2id(arg + 1, (int)(arg_end - arg - 1));
3377 if (id == 0)
3378 EMSG2(_("E392: No such syntax cluster: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E392: No such syntax cluster: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
3379 else
3380 syn_list_cluster(id - SYNID_CLUSTER23000);
3381 } else {
3382 int id = syn_namen2id(arg, (int)(arg_end - arg));
3383 if (id == 0)
3384 EMSG2(_(e_nogroup), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_nogroup))), (char_u *)(arg
));
3385 else
3386 syn_list_one(id, syncing, TRUE1);
3387 }
3388 arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
3389 }
3390 }
3391 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
3392}
3393
3394static void syn_lines_msg(void)
3395{
3396 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0
3397 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0) {
3398 MSG_PUTS("; ")msg_puts((char_u *)("; "));
3399 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0) {
3400 MSG_PUTS(_("minimal "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("minimal "))));
3401 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines);
3402 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines)
3403 MSG_PUTS(", ")msg_puts((char_u *)(", "));
3404 }
3405 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0) {
3406 MSG_PUTS(_("maximal "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("maximal "))));
3407 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines);
3408 }
3409 MSG_PUTS(_(" lines before top line"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" lines before top line"
))));
3410 }
3411}
3412
3413static void syn_match_msg(void)
3414{
3415 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks > 0) {
3416 MSG_PUTS(_("; match "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("; match "))));
3417 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks);
3418 MSG_PUTS(_(" line breaks"))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" line breaks"))));
3419 }
3420}
3421
3422static int last_matchgroup;
3423
3424
3425/*
3426 * List one syntax item, for ":syntax" or "syntax list syntax_name".
3427 */
3428static void
3429syn_list_one (
3430 int id,
3431 int syncing, /* when TRUE: list syncing items */
3432 int link_only /* when TRUE; list link-only too */
3433)
3434{
3435 int attr;
3436 int did_header = FALSE0;
3437 synpat_T *spp;
3438 static struct name_list namelist1[] =
3439 {
3440 {HL_DISPLAY0x1000, "display"},
3441 {HL_CONTAINED0x01, "contained"},
3442 {HL_ONELINE0x04, "oneline"},
3443 {HL_KEEPEND0x400, "keepend"},
3444 {HL_EXTEND0x4000, "extend"},
3445 {HL_EXCLUDENL0x800, "excludenl"},
3446 {HL_TRANSP0x02, "transparent"},
3447 {HL_FOLD0x2000, "fold"},
3448 {HL_CONCEAL0x20000, "conceal"},
3449 {HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000, "concealends"},
3450 {0, NULL((void*)0)}
3451 };
3452 static struct name_list namelist2[] =
3453 {
3454 {HL_SKIPWHITE0x100, "skipwhite"},
3455 {HL_SKIPNL0x80, "skipnl"},
3456 {HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200, "skipempty"},
3457 {0, NULL((void*)0)}
3458 };
3459
3460 attr = hl_attr(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]; /* highlight like directories */
3461
3462 /* list the keywords for "id" */
3463 if (!syncing) {
3464 did_header = syn_list_keywords(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab, FALSE0, attr);
3465 did_header = syn_list_keywords(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic,
3466 did_header, attr);
3467 }
3468
3469 /* list the patterns for "id" */
3470 for (int idx = 0; idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len && !got_int; ++idx) {
3471 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
3472 if (spp->sp_syn.id != id || spp->sp_syncing != syncing)
3473 continue;
3474
3475 (void)syn_list_header(did_header, 999, id);
3476 did_header = TRUE1;
3477 last_matchgroup = 0;
3478 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_MATCH1) {
3479 put_pattern("match", ' ', spp, attr);
3480 msg_putchar(' ');
3481 } else if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2) {
3482 while (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_START2)
3483 put_pattern("start", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
3484 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_SKIP4)
3485 put_pattern("skip", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
3486 while (idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len
3487 && SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_END3)
3488 put_pattern("end", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
3489 --idx;
3490 msg_putchar(' ');
3491 }
3492 syn_list_flags(namelist1, spp->sp_flags, attr);
3493
3494 if (spp->sp_cont_list != NULL((void*)0))
3495 put_id_list((char_u *)"contains", spp->sp_cont_list, attr);
3496
3497 if (spp->sp_syn.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
3498 put_id_list((char_u *)"containedin",
3499 spp->sp_syn.cont_in_list, attr);
3500
3501 if (spp->sp_next_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
3502 put_id_list((char_u *)"nextgroup", spp->sp_next_list, attr);
3503 syn_list_flags(namelist2, spp->sp_flags, attr);
3504 }
3505 if (spp->sp_flags & (HL_SYNC_HERE0x10|HL_SYNC_THERE0x20)) {
3506 if (spp->sp_flags & HL_SYNC_HERE0x10)
3507 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"grouphere", attr);
3508 else
3509 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"groupthere", attr);
3510 msg_putchar(' ');
3511 if (spp->sp_sync_idx >= 0)
3512 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))
3513 [spp->sp_sync_idx].sp_syn.id - 1].sg_name);
3514 else
3515 MSG_PUTS("NONE")msg_puts((char_u *)("NONE"));
3516 msg_putchar(' ');
3517 }
3518 }
3519
3520 /* list the link, if there is one */
3521 if (HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_link && (did_header || link_only) && !got_int) {
3522 (void)syn_list_header(did_header, 999, id);
3523 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"links to", attr);
3524 msg_putchar(' ');
3525 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_link - 1].sg_name);
3526 }
3527}
3528
3529static void syn_list_flags(struct name_list *nlist, int flags, int attr)
3530{
3531 int i;
3532
3533 for (i = 0; nlist[i].flag != 0; ++i)
3534 if (flags & nlist[i].flag) {
3535 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)nlist[i].name, attr);
3536 msg_putchar(' ');
3537 }
3538}
3539
3540/*
3541 * List one syntax cluster, for ":syntax" or "syntax list syntax_name".
3542 */
3543static void syn_list_cluster(int id)
3544{
3545 int endcol = 15;
3546
3547 /* slight hack: roughly duplicate the guts of syn_list_header() */
3548 msg_putchar('\n');
3549 msg_outtrans(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_name);
3550
3551 if (msg_col >= endcol) /* output at least one space */
3552 endcol = msg_col + 1;
3553 if (Columns <= endcol) /* avoid hang for tiny window */
3554 endcol = Columns - 1;
3555
3556 msg_advance(endcol);
3557 if (SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
3558 put_id_list((char_u *)"cluster", SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_list,
3559 hl_attr(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
3560 } else {
3561 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"cluster", hl_attr(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
3562 msg_puts((char_u *)"=NONE");
3563 }
3564}
3565
3566static void put_id_list(char_u *name, short *list, int attr)
3567{
3568 short *p;
3569
3570 msg_puts_attr(name, attr);
3571 msg_putchar('=');
3572 for (p = list; *p; ++p) {
3573 if (*p >= SYNID_ALLBUT20000 && *p < SYNID_TOP21000) {
3574 if (p[1])
3575 MSG_PUTS("ALLBUT")msg_puts((char_u *)("ALLBUT"));
3576 else
3577 MSG_PUTS("ALL")msg_puts((char_u *)("ALL"));
3578 } else if (*p >= SYNID_TOP21000 && *p < SYNID_CONTAINED22000) {
3579 MSG_PUTS("TOP")msg_puts((char_u *)("TOP"));
3580 } else if (*p >= SYNID_CONTAINED22000 && *p < SYNID_CLUSTER23000) {
3581 MSG_PUTS("CONTAINED")msg_puts((char_u *)("CONTAINED"));
3582 } else if (*p >= SYNID_CLUSTER23000) {
3583 short scl_id = *p - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
3584
3585 msg_putchar('@');
3586 msg_outtrans(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_name);
3587 } else
3588 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[*p - 1].sg_name);
3589 if (p[1])
3590 msg_putchar(',');
3591 }
3592 msg_putchar(' ');
3593}
3594
3595static void put_pattern(char *s, int c, synpat_T *spp, int attr)
3596{
3597 long n;
3598 int mask;
3599 int first;
3600 static char *sepchars = "/+=-#@\"|'^&";
3601 int i;
3602
3603 /* May have to write "matchgroup=group" */
3604 if (last_matchgroup != spp->sp_syn_match_id) {
3605 last_matchgroup = spp->sp_syn_match_id;
3606 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"matchgroup", attr);
3607 msg_putchar('=');
3608 if (last_matchgroup == 0)
3609 msg_outtrans((char_u *)"NONE");
3610 else
3611 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[last_matchgroup - 1].sg_name);
3612 msg_putchar(' ');
3613 }
3614
3615 /* output the name of the pattern and an '=' or ' ' */
3616 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)s, attr);
3617 msg_putchar(c);
3618
3619 /* output the pattern, in between a char that is not in the pattern */
3620 for (i = 0; vim_strchr(spp->sp_pattern, sepchars[i]) != NULL((void*)0); )
3621 if (sepchars[++i] == NUL'\000') {
3622 i = 0; /* no good char found, just use the first one */
3623 break;
3624 }
3625 msg_putchar(sepchars[i]);
3626 msg_outtrans(spp->sp_pattern);
3627 msg_putchar(sepchars[i]);
3628
3629 /* output any pattern options */
3630 first = TRUE1;
3631 for (i = 0; i < SPO_COUNT7; ++i) {
3632 mask = (1 << i);
3633 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (mask + (mask << SPO_COUNT7))) {
3634 if (!first)
3635 msg_putchar(','); /* separate with commas */
3636 msg_puts((char_u *)spo_name_tab[i]);
3637 n = spp->sp_offsets[i];
3638 if (i != SPO_LC_OFF6) {
3639 if (spp->sp_off_flags & mask)
3640 msg_putchar('s');
3641 else
3642 msg_putchar('e');
3643 if (n > 0)
3644 msg_putchar('+');
3645 }
3646 if (n || i == SPO_LC_OFF6)
3647 msg_outnum(n);
3648 first = FALSE0;
3649 }
3650 }
3651 msg_putchar(' ');
3652}
3653
3654/*
3655 * List or clear the keywords for one syntax group.
3656 * Return TRUE if the header has been printed.
3657 */
3658static int
3659syn_list_keywords (
3660 int id,
3661 hashtab_T *ht,
3662 int did_header, /* header has already been printed */
3663 int attr
3664)
3665{
3666 int outlen;
3667 hashitem_T *hi;
3668 keyentry_T *kp;
3669 int todo;
3670 int prev_contained = 0;
3671 short *prev_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
3672 short *prev_cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
3673 int prev_skipnl = 0;
3674 int prev_skipwhite = 0;
3675 int prev_skipempty = 0;
3676
3677 /*
3678 * Unfortunately, this list of keywords is not sorted on alphabet but on
3679 * hash value...
3680 */
3681 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
3682 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
3683 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3684 --todo;
3685 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; kp = kp->ke_next) {
3686 if (kp->k_syn.id == id) {
3687 if (prev_contained != (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)
3688 || prev_skipnl != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80)
3689 || prev_skipwhite != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100)
3690 || prev_skipempty != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200)
3691 || prev_cont_in_list != kp->k_syn.cont_in_list
3692 || prev_next_list != kp->next_list)
3693 outlen = 9999;
3694 else
3695 outlen = (int)STRLEN(kp->keyword)strlen((char *)(kp->keyword));
3696 /* output "contained" and "nextgroup" on each line */
3697 if (syn_list_header(did_header, outlen, id)) {
3698 prev_contained = 0;
3699 prev_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
3700 prev_cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
3701 prev_skipnl = 0;
3702 prev_skipwhite = 0;
3703 prev_skipempty = 0;
3704 }
3705 did_header = TRUE1;
3706 if (prev_contained != (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)) {
3707 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"contained", attr);
3708 msg_putchar(' ');
3709 prev_contained = (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01);
3710 }
3711 if (kp->k_syn.cont_in_list != prev_cont_in_list) {
3712 put_id_list((char_u *)"containedin",
3713 kp->k_syn.cont_in_list, attr);
3714 msg_putchar(' ');
3715 prev_cont_in_list = kp->k_syn.cont_in_list;
3716 }
3717 if (kp->next_list != prev_next_list) {
3718 put_id_list((char_u *)"nextgroup", kp->next_list, attr);
3719 msg_putchar(' ');
3720 prev_next_list = kp->next_list;
3721 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80) {
3722 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"skipnl", attr);
3723 msg_putchar(' ');
3724 prev_skipnl = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80);
3725 }
3726 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100) {
3727 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"skipwhite", attr);
3728 msg_putchar(' ');
3729 prev_skipwhite = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100);
3730 }
3731 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200) {
3732 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"skipempty", attr);
3733 msg_putchar(' ');
3734 prev_skipempty = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200);
3735 }
3736 }
3737 msg_outtrans(kp->keyword);
3738 }
3739 }
3740 }
3741 }
3742
3743 return did_header;
3744}
3745
3746static void syn_clear_keyword(int id, hashtab_T *ht)
3747{
3748 hashitem_T *hi;
3749 keyentry_T *kp;
3750 keyentry_T *kp_prev;
3751 keyentry_T *kp_next;
3752 int todo;
3753
3754 hash_lock(ht);
3755 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
3756 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
3757 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3758 --todo;
3759 kp_prev = NULL((void*)0);
3760 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); ) {
3761 if (kp->k_syn.id == id) {
3762 kp_next = kp->ke_next;
3763 if (kp_prev == NULL((void*)0)) {
3764 if (kp_next == NULL((void*)0))
3765 hash_remove(ht, hi);
3766 else
3767 hi->hi_key = KE2HIKEY(kp_next)((kp_next)->keyword);
3768 } else
3769 kp_prev->ke_next = kp_next;
3770 free(kp->next_list);
3771 free(kp->k_syn.cont_in_list);
3772 free(kp);
3773 kp = kp_next;
3774 } else {
3775 kp_prev = kp;
3776 kp = kp->ke_next;
3777 }
3778 }
3779 }
3780 }
3781 hash_unlock(ht);
3782}
3783
3784/*
3785 * Clear a whole keyword table.
3786 */
3787static void clear_keywtab(hashtab_T *ht)
3788{
3789 hashitem_T *hi;
3790 int todo;
3791 keyentry_T *kp;
3792 keyentry_T *kp_next;
3793
3794 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
3795 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
3796 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3797 --todo;
3798 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); kp = kp_next) {
3799 kp_next = kp->ke_next;
3800 free(kp->next_list);
3801 free(kp->k_syn.cont_in_list);
3802 free(kp);
3803 }
3804 }
3805 }
3806 hash_clear(ht);
3807 hash_init(ht);
3808}
3809
3810/// Add a keyword to the list of keywords.
3811///
3812/// @param name name of keyword
3813/// @param id group ID for this keyword
3814/// @param flags flags for this keyword
3815/// @param cont_in_list containedin for this keyword
3816/// @param next_list nextgroup for this keyword
3817static void add_keyword(char_u *name,
3818 int id,
3819 int flags,
3820 short *cont_in_list,
3821 short *next_list,
3822 int conceal_char)
3823{
3824 char_u name_folded[MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1];
3825 char_u *name_ic = (curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic)
3826 ? str_foldcase(name, (int)STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)), name_folded, sizeof(name_folded))
3827 : name;
3828
3829 keyentry_T *kp = xmalloc(sizeof(keyentry_T) + STRLEN(name_ic)strlen((char *)(name_ic)));
3830 STRCPY(kp->keyword, name_ic)strcpy((char *)(kp->keyword), (char *)(name_ic));
3831 kp->k_syn.id = id;
3832 kp->k_syn.inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
3833 kp->flags = flags;
3834 kp->k_char = conceal_char;
3835 kp->k_syn.cont_in_list = copy_id_list(cont_in_list);
3836 if (cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
3837 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
3838 }
3839 kp->next_list = copy_id_list(next_list);
3840
3841 long_u hash = hash_hash(kp->keyword);
3842 hashtab_T *ht = (curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic) ? &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic
3843 : &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab;
3844 hashitem_T *hi = hash_lookup(ht, kp->keyword, hash);
3845
3846 // even though it looks like only the kp->keyword member is
3847 // being used here, vim uses some pointer trickery to get the orignal
3848 // struct again later by using knowledge of the offset of the keyword
3849 // field in the struct. See the definition of the HI2KE macro.
3850 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
3851 // new keyword, add to hashtable
3852 kp->ke_next = NULL((void*)0);
3853 hash_add_item(ht, hi, kp->keyword, hash);
3854 } else {
3855 // keyword already exists, prepend to list
3856 kp->ke_next = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey)));
3857 hi->hi_key = KE2HIKEY(kp)((kp)->keyword);
3858 }
3859}
3860
3861/*
3862 * Get the start and end of the group name argument.
3863 * Return a pointer to the first argument.
3864 * Return NULL if the end of the command was found instead of further args.
3865 */
3866static char_u *
3867get_group_name (
3868 char_u *arg, /* start of the argument */
3869 char_u **name_end /* pointer to end of the name */
3870)
3871{
3872 char_u *rest;
3873
3874 *name_end = skiptowhite(arg);
3875 rest = skipwhite(*name_end);
3876
3877 /*
3878 * Check if there are enough arguments. The first argument may be a
3879 * pattern, where '|' is allowed, so only check for NUL.
3880 */
3881 if (ends_excmd(*arg) || *rest == NUL'\000')
3882 return NULL((void*)0);
3883 return rest;
3884}
3885
3886/*
3887 * Check for syntax command option arguments.
3888 * This can be called at any place in the list of arguments, and just picks
3889 * out the arguments that are known. Can be called several times in a row to
3890 * collect all options in between other arguments.
3891 * Return a pointer to the next argument (which isn't an option).
3892 * Return NULL for any error;
3893 */
3894static char_u *
3895get_syn_options (
3896 char_u *arg, /* next argument to be checked */
3897 syn_opt_arg_T *opt, /* various things */
3898 int *conceal_char
3899)
3900{
3901 char_u *gname_start, *gname;
3902 int syn_id;
3903 int len;
3904 char *p;
3905 int fidx;
3906 static struct flag {
3907 char *name;
3908 int argtype;
3909 int flags;
3910 } flagtab[] = { {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNeEdD", 0, HL_CONTAINED0x01},
3911 {"oOnNeElLiInNeE", 0, HL_ONELINE0x04},
3912 {"kKeEeEpPeEnNdD", 0, HL_KEEPEND0x400},
3913 {"eExXtTeEnNdD", 0, HL_EXTEND0x4000},
3914 {"eExXcClLuUdDeEnNlL", 0, HL_EXCLUDENL0x800},
3915 {"tTrRaAnNsSpPaArReEnNtT", 0, HL_TRANSP0x02},
3916 {"sSkKiIpPnNlL", 0, HL_SKIPNL0x80},
3917 {"sSkKiIpPwWhHiItTeE", 0, HL_SKIPWHITE0x100},
3918 {"sSkKiIpPeEmMpPtTyY", 0, HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200},
3919 {"gGrRoOuUpPhHeErReE", 0, HL_SYNC_HERE0x10},
3920 {"gGrRoOuUpPtThHeErReE", 0, HL_SYNC_THERE0x20},
3921 {"dDiIsSpPlLaAyY", 0, HL_DISPLAY0x1000},
3922 {"fFoOlLdD", 0, HL_FOLD0x2000},
3923 {"cCoOnNcCeEaAlL", 0, HL_CONCEAL0x20000},
3924 {"cCoOnNcCeEaAlLeEnNdDsS", 0, HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000},
3925 {"cCcChHaArR", 11, 0},
3926 {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNsS", 1, 0},
3927 {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNeEdDiInN", 2, 0},
3928 {"nNeExXtTgGrRoOuUpP", 3, 0},};
3929 static char *first_letters = "cCoOkKeEtTsSgGdDfFnN";
3930
3931 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) /* already detected error */
3932 return NULL((void*)0);
3933
3934 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_conceal)
3935 opt->flags |= HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
3936
3937 for (;; ) {
3938 /*
3939 * This is used very often when a large number of keywords is defined.
3940 * Need to skip quickly when no option name is found.
3941 * Also avoid tolower(), it's slow.
3942 */
3943 if (strchr(first_letters, *arg) == NULL((void*)0))
3944 break;
3945
3946 for (fidx = sizeof(flagtab) / sizeof(struct flag); --fidx >= 0; ) {
3947 p = flagtab[fidx].name;
3948 int i;
3949 for (i = 0, len = 0; p[i] != NUL'\000'; i += 2, ++len)
3950 if (arg[len] != p[i] && arg[len] != p[i + 1])
3951 break;
3952 if (p[i] == NUL'\000' && (vim_iswhite(arg[len])((arg[len]) == ' ' || (arg[len]) == '\t')
3953 || (flagtab[fidx].argtype > 0
3954 ? arg[len] == '='
3955 : ends_excmd(arg[len])))) {
3956 if (opt->keyword
3957 && (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_DISPLAY0x1000
3958 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_FOLD0x2000
3959 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_EXTEND0x4000))
3960 /* treat "display", "fold" and "extend" as a keyword */
3961 fidx = -1;
3962 break;
3963 }
3964 }
3965 if (fidx < 0) /* no match found */
3966 break;
3967
3968 if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 1) {
3969 if (!opt->has_cont_list) {
3970 EMSG(_("E395: contains argument not accepted here"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E395: contains argument not accepted here"
))));
3971 return NULL((void*)0);
3972 }
3973 if (get_id_list(&arg, 8, &opt->cont_list) == FAIL0)
3974 return NULL((void*)0);
3975 } else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 2) {
3976 if (get_id_list(&arg, 11, &opt->cont_in_list) == FAIL0)
3977 return NULL((void*)0);
3978 } else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 3) {
3979 if (get_id_list(&arg, 9, &opt->next_list) == FAIL0)
3980 return NULL((void*)0);
3981 } else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 11 && arg[5] == '=') {
3982 /* cchar=? */
3983 if (has_mbyte) {
3984 *conceal_char = mb_ptr2char(arg + 6);
3985 arg += mb_ptr2len(arg + 6) - 1;
3986 } else {
3987 *conceal_char = arg[6];
3988 }
3989 if (!vim_isprintc_strict(*conceal_char)) {
3990 EMSG(_("E844: invalid cchar value"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E844: invalid cchar value")
)));
3991 return NULL((void*)0);
3992 }
3993 arg = skipwhite(arg + 7);
3994 } else {
3995 opt->flags |= flagtab[fidx].flags;
3996 arg = skipwhite(arg + len);
3997
3998 if (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_SYNC_HERE0x10
3999 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_SYNC_THERE0x20) {
4000 if (opt->sync_idx == NULL((void*)0)) {
4001 EMSG(_("E393: group[t]here not accepted here"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E393: group[t]here not accepted here"
))));
4002 return NULL((void*)0);
4003 }
4004 gname_start = arg;
4005 arg = skiptowhite(arg);
4006 if (gname_start == arg)
4007 return NULL((void*)0);
4008 gname = vim_strnsave(gname_start, (int)(arg - gname_start));
4009 if (STRCMP(gname, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(gname), (char *)("NONE")) == 0)
4010 *opt->sync_idx = NONE_IDX-2;
4011 else {
4012 syn_id = syn_name2id(gname);
4013 int i;
4014 for (i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
4015 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syn.id == syn_id
4016 && SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_type == SPTYPE_START2) {
4017 *opt->sync_idx = i;
4018 break;
4019 }
4020 if (i < 0) {
4021 EMSG2(_("E394: Didn't find region item for %s"), gname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E394: Didn't find region item for %s"
))), (char_u *)(gname));
4022 free(gname);
4023 return NULL((void*)0);
4024 }
4025 }
4026
4027 free(gname);
4028 arg = skipwhite(arg);
4029 } else if (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_FOLD0x2000
4030 && foldmethodIsSyntax(curwin))
4031 /* Need to update folds later. */
4032 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4033 }
4034 }
4035
4036 return arg;
4037}
4038
4039/*
4040 * Adjustments to syntax item when declared in a ":syn include"'d file.
4041 * Set the contained flag, and if the item is not already contained, add it
4042 * to the specified top-level group, if any.
4043 */
4044static void syn_incl_toplevel(int id, int *flagsp)
4045{
4046 if ((*flagsp & HL_CONTAINED0x01) || curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp == 0)
4047 return;
4048 *flagsp |= HL_CONTAINED0x01;
4049 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp >= SYNID_CLUSTER23000) {
4050 /* We have to alloc this, because syn_combine_list() will free it. */
4051 short *grp_list = xmalloc(2 * sizeof(short));
4052 int tlg_id = curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4053
4054 grp_list[0] = id;
4055 grp_list[1] = 0;
4056 syn_combine_list(&SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[tlg_id].scl_list, &grp_list,
4057 CLUSTER_ADD2);
4058 }
4059}
4060
4061/*
4062 * Handle ":syntax include [@{group-name}] filename" command.
4063 */
4064static void syn_cmd_include(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
4065{
4066 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4067 int sgl_id = 1;
4068 char_u *group_name_end;
4069 char_u *rest;
4070 char_u *errormsg = NULL((void*)0);
4071 int prev_toplvl_grp;
4072 int prev_syn_inc_tag;
4073 int source = FALSE0;
4074
4075 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
4076 if (eap->skip)
4077 return;
4078
4079 if (arg[0] == '@') {
4080 ++arg;
4081 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4082 if (rest == NULL((void*)0)) {
4083 EMSG((char_u *)_("E397: Filename required"))emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)gettext((char *)("E397: Filename required"
))));
4084 return;
4085 }
4086 sgl_id = syn_check_cluster(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
4087 if (sgl_id == 0)
4088 return;
4089 /* separate_nextcmd() and expand_filename() depend on this */
4090 eap->arg = rest;
4091 }
4092
4093 /*
4094 * Everything that's left, up to the next command, should be the
4095 * filename to include.
4096 */
4097 eap->argt |= (XFILE0x008 | NOSPC0x010);
4098 separate_nextcmd(eap);
4099 if (*eap->arg == '<' || *eap->arg == '$' || path_is_absolute_path(eap->arg)) {
4100 /* For an absolute path, "$VIM/..." or "<sfile>.." we ":source" the
4101 * file. Need to expand the file name first. In other cases
4102 * ":runtime!" is used. */
4103 source = TRUE1;
4104 if (expand_filename(eap, syn_cmdlinep, &errormsg) == FAIL0) {
4105 if (errormsg != NULL((void*)0))
4106 EMSG(errormsg)emsg((char_u *)(errormsg));
4107 return;
4108 }
4109 }
4110
4111 /*
4112 * Save and restore the existing top-level grouplist id and ":syn
4113 * include" tag around the actual inclusion.
4114 */
4115 if (running_syn_inc_tag >= MAX_SYN_INC_TAG999) {
4116 EMSG((char_u *)_("E847: Too many syntax includes"))emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)gettext((char *)("E847: Too many syntax includes"
))));
4117 return;
4118 }
4119 prev_syn_inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
4120 current_syn_inc_tag = ++running_syn_inc_tag;
4121 prev_toplvl_grp = curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp;
4122 curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp = sgl_id;
4123 if (source ? do_source(eap->arg, FALSE0, DOSO_NONE0) == FAIL0
4124 : source_runtime(eap->arg, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
4125 EMSG2(_(e_notopen), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notopen))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
4126 curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp = prev_toplvl_grp;
4127 current_syn_inc_tag = prev_syn_inc_tag;
4128}
4129
4130/*
4131 * Handle ":syntax keyword {group-name} [{option}] keyword .." command.
4132 */
4133static void syn_cmd_keyword(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
4134{
4135 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4136 char_u *group_name_end;
4137 int syn_id;
4138 char_u *rest;
4139 char_u *keyword_copy = NULL((void*)0);
4140 char_u *p;
4141 char_u *kw;
4142 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
4143 int cnt;
4144 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
4145
4146 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4147
4148 if (rest != NULL((void*)0)) {
4149 syn_id = syn_check_group(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
4150 if (syn_id != 0)
4151 /* allocate a buffer, for removing backslashes in the keyword */
4152 keyword_copy = xmalloc(STRLEN(rest)strlen((char *)(rest)) + 1);
4153 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
4154 syn_opt_arg.keyword = TRUE1;
4155 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = NULL((void*)0);
4156 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = FALSE0;
4157 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4158 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4159
4160 /*
4161 * The options given apply to ALL keywords, so all options must be
4162 * found before keywords can be created.
4163 * 1: collect the options and copy the keywords to keyword_copy.
4164 */
4165 cnt = 0;
4166 p = keyword_copy;
4167 for (; rest != NULL((void*)0) && !ends_excmd(*rest); rest = skipwhite(rest)) {
4168 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char);
4169 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || ends_excmd(*rest))
4170 break;
4171 /* Copy the keyword, removing backslashes, and add a NUL. */
4172 while (*rest != NUL'\000' && !vim_iswhite(*rest)((*rest) == ' ' || (*rest) == '\t')) {
4173 if (*rest == '\\' && rest[1] != NUL'\000')
4174 ++rest;
4175 *p++ = *rest++;
4176 }
4177 *p++ = NUL'\000';
4178 ++cnt;
4179 }
4180
4181 if (!eap->skip) {
4182 /* Adjust flags for use of ":syn include". */
4183 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
4184
4185 /*
4186 * 2: Add an entry for each keyword.
4187 */
4188 for (kw = keyword_copy; --cnt >= 0; kw += STRLEN(kw)strlen((char *)(kw)) + 1) {
4189 for (p = vim_strchr(kw, '[');; ) {
4190 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
4191 *p = NUL'\000';
4192 add_keyword(kw, syn_id, syn_opt_arg.flags,
4193 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list,
4194 syn_opt_arg.next_list, conceal_char);
4195 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
4196 break;
4197 if (p[1] == NUL'\000') {
4198 EMSG2(_("E789: Missing ']': %s"), kw)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E789: Missing ']': %s"))),
(char_u *)(kw));
4199 kw = p + 2; /* skip over the NUL */
4200 break;
4201 }
4202 if (p[1] == ']') {
4203 kw = p + 1; /* skip over the "]" */
4204 break;
4205 }
4206 if (has_mbyte) {
4207 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p + 1);
4208
4209 memmove(p, p + 1, l);
4210 p += l;
4211 } else {
4212 p[0] = p[1];
4213 ++p;
4214 }
4215 }
4216 }
4217 }
4218
4219 free(keyword_copy);
4220 free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
4221 free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
4222 }
4223
4224 if (rest != NULL((void*)0))
4225 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
4226 else
4227 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
4228
4229 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
4230 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
4231}
4232
4233/*
4234 * Handle ":syntax match {name} [{options}] {pattern} [{options}]".
4235 *
4236 * Also ":syntax sync match {name} [[grouphere | groupthere] {group-name}] .."
4237 */
4238static void
4239syn_cmd_match (
4240 exarg_T *eap,
4241 int syncing /* TRUE for ":syntax sync match .. " */
4242)
4243{
4244 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4245 char_u *group_name_end;
4246 char_u *rest;
4247 synpat_T item; /* the item found in the line */
4248 int syn_id;
4249 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
4250 int sync_idx = 0;
4251 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
4252
4253 /* Isolate the group name, check for validity */
4254 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4255
4256 /* Get options before the pattern */
4257 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
4258 syn_opt_arg.keyword = FALSE0;
4259 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = syncing ? &sync_idx : NULL((void*)0);
4260 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = TRUE1;
4261 syn_opt_arg.cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
4262 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4263 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4264 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char);
4265
4266 /* get the pattern. */
4267 init_syn_patterns();
4268 memset(&item, 0, sizeof(item));
4269 rest = get_syn_pattern(rest, &item);
4270 if (vim_regcomp_had_eol() && !(syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_EXCLUDENL0x800))
4271 syn_opt_arg.flags |= HL_HAS_EOL0x08;
4272
4273 /* Get options after the pattern */
4274 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char);
4275
4276 if (rest != NULL((void*)0)) { /* all arguments are valid */
4277 /*
4278 * Check for trailing command and illegal trailing arguments.
4279 */
4280 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
4281 if (!ends_excmd(*rest) || eap->skip)
4282 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4283 else {
4284 if ((syn_id = syn_check_group(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg))) != 0) {
4285 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
4286 /*
4287 * Store the pattern in the syn_items list
4288 */
4289 synpat_T *spp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(synpat_T,ga_append_via_ptr(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns, sizeof
(synpat_T))
4290 &curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns)ga_append_via_ptr(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns, sizeof
(synpat_T));
4291 *spp = item;
4292 spp->sp_syncing = syncing;
4293 spp->sp_type = SPTYPE_MATCH1;
4294 spp->sp_syn.id = syn_id;
4295 spp->sp_syn.inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
4296 spp->sp_flags = syn_opt_arg.flags;
4297 spp->sp_sync_idx = sync_idx;
4298 spp->sp_cont_list = syn_opt_arg.cont_list;
4299 spp->sp_syn.cont_in_list = syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list;
4300 spp->sp_cchar = conceal_char;
4301 if (syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
4302 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
4303 spp->sp_next_list = syn_opt_arg.next_list;
4304
4305 /* remember that we found a match for syncing on */
4306 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & (HL_SYNC_HERE0x10|HL_SYNC_THERE0x20))
4307 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags |= SF_MATCH0x02;
4308 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
4309 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_folditems;
4310
4311 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
4312 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
4313 return; /* don't free the progs and patterns now */
4314 }
4315 }
4316 }
4317
4318 /*
4319 * Something failed, free the allocated memory.
4320 */
4321 vim_regfree(item.sp_prog);
4322 free(item.sp_pattern);
4323 free(syn_opt_arg.cont_list);
4324 free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
4325 free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
4326
4327 if (rest == NULL((void*)0))
4328 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
4329}
4330
4331/*
4332 * Handle ":syntax region {group-name} [matchgroup={group-name}]
4333 * start {start} .. [skip {skip}] end {end} .. [{options}]".
4334 */
4335static void
4336syn_cmd_region (
4337 exarg_T *eap,
4338 int syncing /* TRUE for ":syntax sync region .." */
4339)
4340{
4341 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4342 char_u *group_name_end;
4343 char_u *rest; /* next arg, NULL on error */
4344 char_u *key_end;
4345 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
4346 char_u *p;
4347 int item;
4348#define ITEM_START0 0
4349#define ITEM_SKIP1 1
4350#define ITEM_END2 2
4351#define ITEM_MATCHGROUP3 3
4352 struct pat_ptr {
4353 synpat_T *pp_synp; /* pointer to syn_pattern */
4354 int pp_matchgroup_id; /* matchgroup ID */
4355 struct pat_ptr *pp_next; /* pointer to next pat_ptr */
4356 } *(pat_ptrs[3]);
4357 /* patterns found in the line */
4358 struct pat_ptr *ppp;
4359 struct pat_ptr *ppp_next;
4360 int pat_count = 0; /* nr of syn_patterns found */
4361 int syn_id;
4362 int matchgroup_id = 0;
4363 int not_enough = FALSE0; /* not enough arguments */
4364 int illegal = FALSE0; /* illegal arguments */
4365 int success = FALSE0;
4366 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
4367 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
4368
4369 /* Isolate the group name, check for validity */
4370 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4371
4372 pat_ptrs[0] = NULL((void*)0);
4373 pat_ptrs[1] = NULL((void*)0);
4374 pat_ptrs[2] = NULL((void*)0);
4375
4376 init_syn_patterns();
4377
4378 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
4379 syn_opt_arg.keyword = FALSE0;
4380 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = NULL((void*)0);
4381 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = TRUE1;
4382 syn_opt_arg.cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
4383 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4384 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4385
4386 /*
4387 * get the options, patterns and matchgroup.
4388 */
4389 while (rest != NULL((void*)0) && !ends_excmd(*rest)) {
4390 /* Check for option arguments */
4391 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char);
4392 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || ends_excmd(*rest))
4393 break;
4394
4395 /* must be a pattern or matchgroup then */
4396 key_end = rest;
4397 while (*key_end && !vim_iswhite(*key_end)((*key_end) == ' ' || (*key_end) == '\t') && *key_end != '=')
4398 ++key_end;
4399 free(key);
4400 key = vim_strnsave_up(rest, (int)(key_end - rest));
4401 if (STRCMP(key, "MATCHGROUP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("MATCHGROUP")) == 0)
4402 item = ITEM_MATCHGROUP3;
4403 else if (STRCMP(key, "START")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("START")) == 0)
4404 item = ITEM_START0;
4405 else if (STRCMP(key, "END")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("END")) == 0)
4406 item = ITEM_END2;
4407 else if (STRCMP(key, "SKIP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("SKIP")) == 0) {
4408 if (pat_ptrs[ITEM_SKIP1] != NULL((void*)0)) { /* one skip pattern allowed */
4409 illegal = TRUE1;
4410 break;
4411 }
4412 item = ITEM_SKIP1;
4413 } else
4414 break;
4415 rest = skipwhite(key_end);
4416 if (*rest != '=') {
4417 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4418 EMSG2(_("E398: Missing '=': %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E398: Missing '=': %s"))),
(char_u *)(arg));
4419 break;
4420 }
4421 rest = skipwhite(rest + 1);
4422 if (*rest == NUL'\000') {
4423 not_enough = TRUE1;
4424 break;
4425 }
4426
4427 if (item == ITEM_MATCHGROUP3) {
4428 p = skiptowhite(rest);
4429 if ((p - rest == 4 && STRNCMP(rest, "NONE", 4)strncmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("NONE"), (size_t)(4)) == 0) || eap->skip)
4430 matchgroup_id = 0;
4431 else {
4432 matchgroup_id = syn_check_group(rest, (int)(p - rest));
4433 if (matchgroup_id == 0) {
4434 illegal = TRUE1;
4435 break;
4436 }
4437 }
4438 rest = skipwhite(p);
4439 } else {
4440 /*
4441 * Allocate room for a syn_pattern, and link it in the list of
4442 * syn_patterns for this item, at the start (because the list is
4443 * used from end to start).
4444 */
4445 ppp = xmalloc(sizeof(struct pat_ptr));
4446 ppp->pp_next = pat_ptrs[item];
4447 pat_ptrs[item] = ppp;
4448 ppp->pp_synp = xcalloc(1, sizeof(synpat_T));
4449
4450 /*
4451 * Get the syntax pattern and the following offset(s).
4452 */
4453 /* Enable the appropriate \z specials. */
4454 if (item == ITEM_START0)
4455 reg_do_extmatch = REX_SET1;
4456 else if (item == ITEM_SKIP1 || item == ITEM_END2)
4457 reg_do_extmatch = REX_USE2;
4458 rest = get_syn_pattern(rest, ppp->pp_synp);
4459 reg_do_extmatch = 0;
4460 if (item == ITEM_END2 && vim_regcomp_had_eol()
4461 && !(syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_EXCLUDENL0x800))
4462 ppp->pp_synp->sp_flags |= HL_HAS_EOL0x08;
4463 ppp->pp_matchgroup_id = matchgroup_id;
4464 ++pat_count;
4465 }
4466 }
4467 free(key);
4468 if (illegal || not_enough)
4469 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4470
4471 /*
4472 * Must have a "start" and "end" pattern.
4473 */
4474 if (rest != NULL((void*)0) && (pat_ptrs[ITEM_START0] == NULL((void*)0) ||
4475 pat_ptrs[ITEM_END2] == NULL((void*)0))) {
4476 not_enough = TRUE1;
4477 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4478 }
4479
4480 if (rest != NULL((void*)0)) {
4481 /*
4482 * Check for trailing garbage or command.
4483 * If OK, add the item.
4484 */
4485 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
4486 if (!ends_excmd(*rest) || eap->skip)
4487 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4488 else {
4489 ga_grow(&(curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns), pat_count);
4490 if ((syn_id = syn_check_group(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg))) != 0) {
4491 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
4492 /*
4493 * Store the start/skip/end in the syn_items list
4494 */
4495 int idx = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
4496 for (item = ITEM_START0; item <= ITEM_END2; ++item) {
4497 for (ppp = pat_ptrs[item]; ppp != NULL((void*)0); ppp = ppp->pp_next) {
4498 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx] = *(ppp->pp_synp);
4499 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syncing = syncing;
4500 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type =
4501 (item == ITEM_START0) ? SPTYPE_START2 :
4502 (item == ITEM_SKIP1) ? SPTYPE_SKIP4 : SPTYPE_END3;
4503 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_flags |= syn_opt_arg.flags;
4504 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.id = syn_id;
4505 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.inc_tag =
4506 current_syn_inc_tag;
4507 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn_match_id =
4508 ppp->pp_matchgroup_id;
4509 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cchar = conceal_char;
4510 if (item == ITEM_START0) {
4511 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cont_list =
4512 syn_opt_arg.cont_list;
4513 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.cont_in_list =
4514 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list;
4515 if (syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
4516 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
4517 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_next_list =
4518 syn_opt_arg.next_list;
4519 }
4520 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
4521 ++idx;
4522 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
4523 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_folditems;
4524 }
4525 }
4526
4527 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
4528 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
4529 success = TRUE1; /* don't free the progs and patterns now */
4530 }
4531 }
4532 }
4533
4534 /*
4535 * Free the allocated memory.
4536 */
4537 for (item = ITEM_START0; item <= ITEM_END2; ++item)
4538 for (ppp = pat_ptrs[item]; ppp != NULL((void*)0); ppp = ppp_next) {
4539 if (!success) {
4540 vim_regfree(ppp->pp_synp->sp_prog);
4541 free(ppp->pp_synp->sp_pattern);
4542 }
4543 free(ppp->pp_synp);
4544 ppp_next = ppp->pp_next;
4545 free(ppp);
4546 }
4547
4548 if (!success) {
4549 free(syn_opt_arg.cont_list);
4550 free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
4551 free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
4552 if (not_enough)
4553 EMSG2(_("E399: Not enough arguments: syntax region %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E399: Not enough arguments: syntax region %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
4554 else if (illegal || rest == NULL((void*)0))
4555 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
4556 }
4557}
4558
4559/*
4560 * A simple syntax group ID comparison function suitable for use in qsort()
4561 */
4562static int syn_compare_stub(const void *v1, const void *v2)
4563{
4564 const short *s1 = v1;
4565 const short *s2 = v2;
4566
4567 return *s1 > *s2 ? 1 : *s1 < *s2 ? -1 : 0;
4568}
4569
4570/*
4571 * Combines lists of syntax clusters.
4572 * *clstr1 and *clstr2 must both be allocated memory; they will be consumed.
4573 */
4574static void syn_combine_list(short **clstr1, short **clstr2, int list_op)
4575{
4576 int count1 = 0;
4577 int count2 = 0;
4578 short *g1;
4579 short *g2;
4580 short *clstr = NULL((void*)0);
4581 int count;
4582 int round;
4583
4584 /*
4585 * Handle degenerate cases.
4586 */
4587 if (*clstr2 == NULL((void*)0))
4588 return;
4589 if (*clstr1 == NULL((void*)0) || list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1) {
4590 if (list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1)
4591 free(*clstr1);
4592 if (list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1 || list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2)
4593 *clstr1 = *clstr2;
4594 else
4595 free(*clstr2);
4596 return;
4597 }
4598
4599 for (g1 = *clstr1; *g1; g1++)
4600 ++count1;
4601 for (g2 = *clstr2; *g2; g2++)
4602 ++count2;
4603
4604 /*
4605 * For speed purposes, sort both lists.
4606 */
4607 qsort(*clstr1, (size_t)count1, sizeof(short), syn_compare_stub);
4608 qsort(*clstr2, (size_t)count2, sizeof(short), syn_compare_stub);
4609
4610 /*
4611 * We proceed in two passes; in round 1, we count the elements to place
4612 * in the new list, and in round 2, we allocate and populate the new
4613 * list. For speed, we use a mergesort-like method, adding the smaller
4614 * of the current elements in each list to the new list.
4615 */
4616 for (round = 1; round <= 2; round++) {
4617 g1 = *clstr1;
4618 g2 = *clstr2;
4619 count = 0;
4620
4621 /*
4622 * First, loop through the lists until one of them is empty.
4623 */
4624 while (*g1 && *g2) {
4625 /*
4626 * We always want to add from the first list.
4627 */
4628 if (*g1 < *g2) {
4629 if (round == 2)
4630 clstr[count] = *g1;
4631 count++;
4632 g1++;
4633 continue;
4634 }
4635 /*
4636 * We only want to add from the second list if we're adding the
4637 * lists.
4638 */
4639 if (list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2) {
4640 if (round == 2)
4641 clstr[count] = *g2;
4642 count++;
4643 }
4644 if (*g1 == *g2)
4645 g1++;
4646 g2++;
4647 }
4648
4649 /*
4650 * Now add the leftovers from whichever list didn't get finished
4651 * first. As before, we only want to add from the second list if
4652 * we're adding the lists.
4653 */
4654 for (; *g1; g1++, count++)
4655 if (round == 2)
4656 clstr[count] = *g1;
4657 if (list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2)
4658 for (; *g2; g2++, count++)
4659 if (round == 2)
4660 clstr[count] = *g2;
4661
4662 if (round == 1) {
4663 /*
4664 * If the group ended up empty, we don't need to allocate any
4665 * space for it.
4666 */
4667 if (count == 0) {
4668 clstr = NULL((void*)0);
4669 break;
4670 }
4671 clstr = xmalloc((count + 1) * sizeof(short));
4672 clstr[count] = 0;
4673 }
4674 }
4675
4676 /*
4677 * Finally, put the new list in place.
4678 */
4679 free(*clstr1);
4680 free(*clstr2);
4681 *clstr1 = clstr;
4682}
4683
4684/*
4685 * Lookup a syntax cluster name and return it's ID.
4686 * If it is not found, 0 is returned.
4687 */
4688static int syn_scl_name2id(char_u *name)
4689{
4690 // Avoid using stricmp() too much, it's slow on some systems
4691 char_u *name_u = vim_strsave_up(name);
4692 int i;
