4693 for (i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len; --i >= 0; ) {
4694 if (SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[i].scl_name_u != NULL((void*)0)
4695 && STRCMP(name_u, SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)[i].scl_name_u)strcmp((char *)(name_u), (char *)(((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->
w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name_u)) == 0) {
4696 break;
4697 }
4698 }
4699 free(name_u);
4700 return i < 0 ? 0 : i + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4701}
4702
4703/*
4704 * Like syn_scl_name2id(), but take a pointer + length argument.
4705 */
4706static int syn_scl_namen2id(char_u *linep, int len)
4707{
4708 char_u *name = vim_strnsave(linep, len);
4709 int id = syn_scl_name2id(name);
4710 free(name);
4711
4712 return id;
4713}
4714
4715/*
4716 * Find syntax cluster name in the table and return it's ID.
4717 * The argument is a pointer to the name and the length of the name.
4718 * If it doesn't exist yet, a new entry is created.
4719 * Return 0 for failure.
4720 */
4721static int syn_check_cluster(char_u *pp, int len)
4722{
4723 int id;
4724 char_u *name;
4725
4726 name = vim_strnsave(pp, len);
4727
4728 id = syn_scl_name2id(name);
4729 if (id == 0) /* doesn't exist yet */
4730 id = syn_add_cluster(name);
4731 else
4732 free(name);
4733 return id;
4734}
4735
4736/*
4737 * Add new syntax cluster and return it's ID.
4738 * "name" must be an allocated string, it will be consumed.
4739 * Return 0 for failure.
4740 */
4741static int syn_add_cluster(char_u *name)
4742{
4743 /*
4744 * First call for this growarray: init growing array.
4745 */
4746 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_data == NULL((void*)0)) {
4747 curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_itemsize = sizeof(syn_cluster_T);
4748 ga_set_growsize(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters, 10);
4749 }
4750
4751 int len = curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len;
4752 if (len >= MAX_CLUSTER_ID(32767 - 23000)) {
4753 EMSG((char_u *)_("E848: Too many syntax clusters"))emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)gettext((char *)("E848: Too many syntax clusters"
))));
4754 free(name);
4755 return 0;
4756 }
4757
4758 syn_cluster_T *scp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(syn_cluster_T,ga_append_via_ptr(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters, sizeof
(syn_cluster_T))
4759 &curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters)ga_append_via_ptr(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters, sizeof
(syn_cluster_T));
4760 memset(scp, 0, sizeof(*scp));
4761 scp->scl_name = name;
4762 scp->scl_name_u = vim_strsave_up(name);
4763 scp->scl_list = NULL((void*)0);
4764
4765 if (STRICMP(name, "Spell")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("Spell")) == 0)
4766 curwin->w_s->b_spell_cluster_id = len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4767 if (STRICMP(name, "NoSpell")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("NoSpell")) == 0)
4768 curwin->w_s->b_nospell_cluster_id = len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4769
4770 return len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4771}
4772
4773/*
4774 * Handle ":syntax cluster {cluster-name} [contains={groupname},..]
4775 * [add={groupname},..] [remove={groupname},..]".
4776 */
4777static void syn_cmd_cluster(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
4778{
4779 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4780 char_u *group_name_end;
4781 char_u *rest;
4782 int scl_id;
4783 short *clstr_list;
4784 int got_clstr = FALSE0;
4785 int opt_len;
4786 int list_op;
4787
4788 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
4789 if (eap->skip)
4790 return;
4791
4792 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4793
4794 if (rest != NULL((void*)0)) {
4795 scl_id = syn_check_cluster(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
4796 if (scl_id == 0)
4797 return;
4798 scl_id -= SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4799
4800 for (;; ) {
4801 if (STRNICMP(rest, "add", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("add"), (size_t)(3)) == 0
4802 && (vim_iswhite(rest[3])((rest[3]) == ' ' || (rest[3]) == '\t') || rest[3] == '=')) {
4803 opt_len = 3;
4804 list_op = CLUSTER_ADD2;
4805 } else if (STRNICMP(rest, "remove", 6)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("remove"), (size_t)(6)) == 0
4806 && (vim_iswhite(rest[6])((rest[6]) == ' ' || (rest[6]) == '\t') || rest[6] == '=')) {
4807 opt_len = 6;
4808 list_op = CLUSTER_SUBTRACT3;
4809 } else if (STRNICMP(rest, "contains", 8)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("contains"), (size_t)(8)
) == 0
4810 && (vim_iswhite(rest[8])((rest[8]) == ' ' || (rest[8]) == '\t') || rest[8] == '=')) {
4811 opt_len = 8;
4812 list_op = CLUSTER_REPLACE1;
4813 } else
4814 break;
4815
4816 clstr_list = NULL((void*)0);
4817 if (get_id_list(&rest, opt_len, &clstr_list) == FAIL0) {
4818 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), rest)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(rest
));
4819 break;
4820 }
4821 syn_combine_list(&SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_list,
4822 &clstr_list, list_op);
4823 got_clstr = TRUE1;
4824 }
4825
4826 if (got_clstr) {
4827 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
4828 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all. */
4829 }
4830 }
4831
4832 if (!got_clstr)
4833 EMSG(_("E400: No cluster specified"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E400: No cluster specified"
))));
4834 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || !ends_excmd(*rest))
4835 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
4836}
4837
4838/*
4839 * On first call for current buffer: Init growing array.
4840 */
4841static void init_syn_patterns(void)
4842{
4843 curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_itemsize = sizeof(synpat_T);
4844 ga_set_growsize(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns, 10);
4845}
4846
4847/*
4848 * Get one pattern for a ":syntax match" or ":syntax region" command.
4849 * Stores the pattern and program in a synpat_T.
4850 * Returns a pointer to the next argument, or NULL in case of an error.
4851 */
4852static char_u *get_syn_pattern(char_u *arg, synpat_T *ci)
4853{
4854 char_u *end;
4855 int *p;
4856 int idx;
4857 char_u *cpo_save;
4858
4859 /* need at least three chars */
4860 if (arg == NULL((void*)0) || arg[1] == NUL'\000' || arg[2] == NUL'\000')
4861 return NULL((void*)0);
4862
4863 end = skip_regexp(arg + 1, *arg, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
4864 if (*end != *arg) { /* end delimiter not found */
4865 EMSG2(_("E401: Pattern delimiter not found: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E401: Pattern delimiter not found: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
4866 return NULL((void*)0);
4867 }
4868 /* store the pattern and compiled regexp program */
4869 ci->sp_pattern = vim_strnsave(arg + 1, (int)(end - arg - 1));
4870
4871 /* Make 'cpoptions' empty, to avoid the 'l' flag */
4872 cpo_save = p_cpo;
4873 p_cpo = (char_u *)"";
4874 ci->sp_prog = vim_regcomp(ci->sp_pattern, RE_MAGIC1);
4875 p_cpo = cpo_save;
4876
4877 if (ci->sp_prog == NULL((void*)0))
4878 return NULL((void*)0);
4879 ci->sp_ic = curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic;
4880 syn_clear_time(&ci->sp_time);
4881
4882 /*
4883 * Check for a match, highlight or region offset.
4884 */
4885 ++end;
4886 do {
4887 for (idx = SPO_COUNT7; --idx >= 0; )
4888 if (STRNCMP(end, spo_name_tab[idx], 3)strncmp((char *)(end), (char *)(spo_name_tab[idx]), (size_t)(
3)) == 0)
4889 break;
4890 if (idx >= 0) {
4891 p = &(ci->sp_offsets[idx]);
4892 if (idx != SPO_LC_OFF6)
4893 switch (end[3]) {
4894 case 's': break;
4895 case 'b': break;
4896 case 'e': idx += SPO_COUNT7; break;
4897 default: idx = -1; break;
4898 }
4899 if (idx >= 0) {
4900 ci->sp_off_flags |= (1 << idx);
4901 if (idx == SPO_LC_OFF6) { /* lc=99 */
4902 end += 3;
4903 *p = getdigits(&end);
4904
4905 /* "lc=" offset automatically sets "ms=" offset */
4906 if (!(ci->sp_off_flags & (1 << SPO_MS_OFF0))) {
4907 ci->sp_off_flags |= (1 << SPO_MS_OFF0);
4908 ci->sp_offsets[SPO_MS_OFF0] = *p;
4909 }
4910 } else { /* yy=x+99 */
4911 end += 4;
4912 if (*end == '+') {
4913 ++end;
4914 *p = getdigits(&end); /* positive offset */
4915 } else if (*end == '-') {
4916 ++end;
4917 *p = -getdigits(&end); /* negative offset */
4918 }
4919 }
4920 if (*end != ',')
4921 break;
4922 ++end;
4923 }
4924 }
4925 } while (idx >= 0);
4926
4927 if (!ends_excmd(*end) && !vim_iswhite(*end)((*end) == ' ' || (*end) == '\t')) {
4928 EMSG2(_("E402: Garbage after pattern: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E402: Garbage after pattern: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
4929 return NULL((void*)0);
4930 }
4931 return skipwhite(end);
4932}
4933
4934/*
4935 * Handle ":syntax sync .." command.
4936 */
4937static void syn_cmd_sync(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
4938{
4939 char_u *arg_start = eap->arg;
4940 char_u *arg_end;
4941 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
4942 char_u *next_arg;
4943 int illegal = FALSE0;
4944 int finished = FALSE0;
4945 long n;
4946 char_u *cpo_save;
4947
4948 if (ends_excmd(*arg_start)) {
4949 syn_cmd_list(eap, TRUE1);
4950 return;
4951 }
4952
4953 while (!ends_excmd(*arg_start)) {
4954 arg_end = skiptowhite(arg_start);
4955 next_arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
4956 free(key);
4957 key = vim_strnsave_up(arg_start, (int)(arg_end - arg_start));
4958 if (STRCMP(key, "CCOMMENT")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CCOMMENT")) == 0) {
4959 if (!eap->skip)
4960 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags |= SF_CCOMMENT0x01;
4961 if (!ends_excmd(*next_arg)) {
4962 arg_end = skiptowhite(next_arg);
4963 if (!eap->skip)
4964 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_id = syn_check_group(next_arg,
4965 (int)(arg_end - next_arg));
4966 next_arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
4967 } else if (!eap->skip)
4968 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_id = syn_name2id((char_u *)"Comment");
4969 } else if ( STRNCMP(key, "LINES", 5)strncmp((char *)(key), (char *)("LINES"), (size_t)(5)) == 0
4970 || STRNCMP(key, "MINLINES", 8)strncmp((char *)(key), (char *)("MINLINES"), (size_t)(8)) == 0
4971 || STRNCMP(key, "MAXLINES", 8)strncmp((char *)(key), (char *)("MAXLINES"), (size_t)(8)) == 0
4972 || STRNCMP(key, "LINEBREAKS", 10)strncmp((char *)(key), (char *)("LINEBREAKS"), (size_t)(10)) == 0) {
4973 if (key[4] == 'S')
4974 arg_end = key + 6;
4975 else if (key[0] == 'L')
4976 arg_end = key + 11;
4977 else
4978 arg_end = key + 9;
4979 if (arg_end[-1] != '=' || !VIM_ISDIGIT(*arg_end)((unsigned)(*arg_end) - '0' < 10)) {
4980 illegal = TRUE1;
4981 break;
4982 }
4983 n = getdigits(&arg_end);
4984 if (!eap->skip) {
4985 if (key[4] == 'B')
4986 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks = n;
4987 else if (key[1] == 'A')
4988 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines = n;
4989 else
4990 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines = n;
4991 }
4992 } else if (STRCMP(key, "FROMSTART")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("FROMSTART")) == 0) {
4993 if (!eap->skip) {
4994 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
4995 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines = 0;
4996 }
4997 } else if (STRCMP(key, "LINECONT")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("LINECONT")) == 0) {
4998 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat != NULL((void*)0)) {
4999 EMSG(_("E403: syntax sync: line continuations pattern specified twice"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E403: syntax sync: line continuations pattern specified twice"
))));
5000 finished = TRUE1;
5001 break;
5002 }
5003 arg_end = skip_regexp(next_arg + 1, *next_arg, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
5004 if (*arg_end != *next_arg) { /* end delimiter not found */
5005 illegal = TRUE1;
5006 break;
5007 }
5008
5009 if (!eap->skip) {
5010 /* store the pattern and compiled regexp program */
5011 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat =
5012 vim_strnsave(next_arg + 1, (int)(arg_end - next_arg - 1));
5013 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_ic = curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic;
5014
5015 /* Make 'cpoptions' empty, to avoid the 'l' flag */
5016 cpo_save = p_cpo;
5017 p_cpo = (char_u *)"";
5018 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog =
5019 vim_regcomp(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat, RE_MAGIC1);
5020 p_cpo = cpo_save;
5021 syn_clear_time(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_time);
5022
5023 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog == NULL((void*)0)) {
5024 free(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat);
5025 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat = NULL((void*)0);
5026 finished = TRUE1;
5027 break;
5028 }
5029 }
5030 next_arg = skipwhite(arg_end + 1);
5031 } else {
5032 eap->arg = next_arg;
5033 if (STRCMP(key, "MATCH")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("MATCH")) == 0)
5034 syn_cmd_match(eap, TRUE1);
5035 else if (STRCMP(key, "REGION")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("REGION")) == 0)
5036 syn_cmd_region(eap, TRUE1);
5037 else if (STRCMP(key, "CLEAR")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CLEAR")) == 0)
5038 syn_cmd_clear(eap, TRUE1);
5039 else
5040 illegal = TRUE1;
5041 finished = TRUE1;
5042 break;
5043 }
5044 arg_start = next_arg;
5045 }
5046 free(key);
5047 if (illegal)
5048 EMSG2(_("E404: Illegal arguments: %s"), arg_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E404: Illegal arguments: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg_start));
5049 else if (!finished) {
5050 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg_start);
5051 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
5052 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); /* Need to recompute all syntax. */
5053 }
5054}
5055
5056/*
5057 * Convert a line of highlight group names into a list of group ID numbers.
5058 * "arg" should point to the "contains" or "nextgroup" keyword.
5059 * "arg" is advanced to after the last group name.
5060 * Careful: the argument is modified (NULs added).
5061 * returns FAIL for some error, OK for success.
5062 */
5063static int
5064get_id_list (
5065 char_u **arg,
5066 int keylen, /* length of keyword */
5067 short **list /* where to store the resulting list, if not
5068 NULL, the list is silently skipped! */
5069)
5070{
5071 char_u *p = NULL((void*)0);
5072 char_u *end;
5073 int round;
5074 int count;
5075 int total_count = 0;
5076 short *retval = NULL((void*)0);
5077 char_u *name;
5078 regmatch_T regmatch;
5079 int id;
5080 int failed = FALSE0;
5081
5082 /*
5083 * We parse the list twice:
5084 * round == 1: count the number of items, allocate the array.
5085 * round == 2: fill the array with the items.
5086 * In round 1 new groups may be added, causing the number of items to
5087 * grow when a regexp is used. In that case round 1 is done once again.
5088 */
5089 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round) {
1
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
7
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
5090 /*
5091 * skip "contains"
5092 */
5093 p = skipwhite(*arg + keylen);
5094 if (*p != '=') {
2
←
Taking false branch
→
8
←
Taking false branch
→
5095 EMSG2(_("E405: Missing equal sign: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E405: Missing equal sign: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
5096 break;
5097 }
5098 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
5099 if (ends_excmd(*p)) {
3
←
Taking false branch
→
9
←
Taking false branch
→
5100 EMSG2(_("E406: Empty argument: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E406: Empty argument: %s")
)), (char_u *)(*arg));
5101 break;
5102 }
5103
5104 /*
5105 * parse the arguments after "contains"
5106 */
5107 count = 0;
5108 while (!ends_excmd(*p)) {
4
←
Loop condition is false. Execution continues on line 5202
→

←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→

←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body

5110 ;
5111 name = xmalloc((int)(end - p + 3)); /* leave room for "^$" */
5112 STRLCPY(name + 1, p, end - p + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(name + 1), (char *)(p), (size_t)(end - p + 1
));

5115 || STRCMP(name + 1, "TOP")strcmp((char *)(name + 1), (char *)("TOP")) == 0
5116 || STRCMP(name + 1, "CONTAINED")strcmp((char *)(name + 1), (char *)("CONTAINED")) == 0) {
5117 if (TOUPPER_ASC(**arg)(((**arg) < 'a' || (**arg) > 'z') ? (**arg) : (**arg) -
('a' - 'A')) != 'C') {
5118 EMSG2(_("E407: %s not allowed here"), name + 1)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E407: %s not allowed here"
))), (char_u *)(name + 1));
5119 failed = TRUE1;
5120 free(name);
5121 break;
5122 }
5123 if (count != 0) {
5124 EMSG2(_("E408: %s must be first in contains list"), name + 1)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E408: %s must be first in contains list"
))), (char_u *)(name + 1));
5125 failed = TRUE1;
5126 free(name);
5127 break;
5128 }
5129 if (name[1] == 'A')
5130 id = SYNID_ALLBUT20000;
5131 else if (name[1] == 'T')
5132 id = SYNID_TOP21000;
5133 else
5134 id = SYNID_CONTAINED22000;
5135 id += current_syn_inc_tag;

5190 free(retval);
5191 round = 1;
5192 } else
5193 retval[count] = id;

→

5206 retval[count] = 0; /* zero means end of the list */

5208 }

5212 if (failed || retval == NULL((void*)0)) {

5218 *list = retval;
5219 else
5220 free(retval); /* list already found, don't overwrite it */
5221
5222 return OK1;
5223}
5224
5225/*
5226 * Make a copy of an ID list.
5227 */
5228static short *copy_id_list(short *list)
5229{
5230 int len;
5231 int count;
5232 short *retval;
5233
5234 if (list == NULL((void*)0))
5235 return NULL((void*)0);
5236
5237 for (count = 0; list[count]; ++count)
5238 ;
5239 len = (count + 1) * sizeof(short);
5240 retval = xmalloc(len);
5241 memmove(retval, list, (size_t)len);
5242
5243 return retval;
5244}
5245
5246/*
5247 * Check if syntax group "ssp" is in the ID list "list" of "cur_si".
5248 * "cur_si" can be NULL if not checking the "containedin" list.
5249 * Used to check if a syntax item is in the "contains" or "nextgroup" list of
5250 * the current item.
5251 * This function is called very often, keep it fast!!
5252 */
5253static int
5254in_id_list (
5255 stateitem_T *cur_si, /* current item or NULL */
5256 short *list, /* id list */
5257 struct sp_syn *ssp, /* group id and ":syn include" tag of group */
5258 int contained /* group id is contained */
5259)
5260{
5261 int retval;
5262 short *scl_list;
5263 short item;
5264 short id = ssp->id;
5265 static int depth = 0;
5266 int r;
5267
5268 /* If ssp has a "containedin" list and "cur_si" is in it, return TRUE. */
5269 if (cur_si != NULL((void*)0) && ssp->cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0)
5270 && !(cur_si->si_flags & HL_MATCH0x40)) {
5271 /* Ignore transparent items without a contains argument. Double check
5272 * that we don't go back past the first one. */
5273 while ((cur_si->si_flags & HL_TRANS_CONT0x10000)
5274 && cur_si > (stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))
5275 --cur_si;
5276 /* cur_si->si_idx is -1 for keywords, these never contain anything. */
5277 if (cur_si->si_idx >= 0 && in_id_list(NULL((void*)0), ssp->cont_in_list,
5278 &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx].sp_syn),
5279 SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[cur_si->si_idx].sp_flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01))
5280 return TRUE1;
5281 }
5282
5283 if (list == NULL((void*)0))
5284 return FALSE0;
5285
5286 /*
5287 * If list is ID_LIST_ALL, we are in a transparent item that isn't
5288 * inside anything. Only allow not-contained groups.
5289 */
5290 if (list == ID_LIST_ALL(short *)-1)
5291 return !contained;
5292
5293 /*
5294 * If the first item is "ALLBUT", return TRUE if "id" is NOT in the
5295 * contains list. We also require that "id" is at the same ":syn include"
5296 * level as the list.
5297 */
5298 item = *list;
5299 if (item >= SYNID_ALLBUT20000 && item < SYNID_CLUSTER23000) {
5300 if (item < SYNID_TOP21000) {
5301 /* ALL or ALLBUT: accept all groups in the same file */
5302 if (item - SYNID_ALLBUT20000 != ssp->inc_tag)
5303 return FALSE0;
5304 } else if (item < SYNID_CONTAINED22000) {
5305 /* TOP: accept all not-contained groups in the same file */
5306 if (item - SYNID_TOP21000 != ssp->inc_tag || contained)
5307 return FALSE0;
5308 } else {
5309 /* CONTAINED: accept all contained groups in the same file */
5310 if (item - SYNID_CONTAINED22000 != ssp->inc_tag || !contained)
5311 return FALSE0;
5312 }
5313 item = *++list;
5314 retval = FALSE0;
5315 } else
5316 retval = TRUE1;
5317
5318 /*
5319 * Return "retval" if id is in the contains list.
5320 */
5321 while (item != 0) {
5322 if (item == id)
5323 return retval;
5324 if (item >= SYNID_CLUSTER23000) {
5325 scl_list = SYN_CLSTR(syn_block)((syn_cluster_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[item - SYNID_CLUSTER23000].scl_list;
5326 /* restrict recursiveness to 30 to avoid an endless loop for a
5327 * cluster that includes itself (indirectly) */
5328 if (scl_list != NULL((void*)0) && depth < 30) {
5329 ++depth;
5330 r = in_id_list(NULL((void*)0), scl_list, ssp, contained);
5331 --depth;
5332 if (r)
5333 return retval;
5334 }
5335 }
5336 item = *++list;
5337 }
5338 return !retval;
5339}
5340
5341struct subcommand {
5342 char *name; /* subcommand name */
5343 void (*func)(exarg_T *, int); /* function to call */
5344};
5345
5346static struct subcommand subcommands[] =
5347{
5348 {"case", syn_cmd_case},
5349 {"clear", syn_cmd_clear},
5350 {"cluster", syn_cmd_cluster},
5351 {"conceal", syn_cmd_conceal},
5352 {"enable", syn_cmd_enable},
5353 {"include", syn_cmd_include},
5354 {"keyword", syn_cmd_keyword},
5355 {"list", syn_cmd_list},
5356 {"manual", syn_cmd_manual},
5357 {"match", syn_cmd_match},
5358 {"on", syn_cmd_on},
5359 {"off", syn_cmd_off},
5360 {"region", syn_cmd_region},
5361 {"reset", syn_cmd_reset},
5362 {"spell", syn_cmd_spell},
5363 {"sync", syn_cmd_sync},
5364 {"", syn_cmd_list},
5365 {NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0)}
5366};
5367
5368/*
5369 * ":syntax".
5370 * This searches the subcommands[] table for the subcommand name, and calls a
5371 * syntax_subcommand() function to do the rest.
5372 */
5373void ex_syntax(exarg_T *eap)
5374{
5375 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
5376 char_u *subcmd_end;
5377 char_u *subcmd_name;
5378 int i;
5379
5380 syn_cmdlinep = eap->cmdlinep;
5381
5382 /* isolate subcommand name */
5383 for (subcmd_end = arg; ASCII_ISALPHA(*subcmd_end)(((unsigned)(*subcmd_end) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*subcmd_end
) - 'a' < 26)); ++subcmd_end)
5384 ;
5385 subcmd_name = vim_strnsave(arg, (int)(subcmd_end - arg));
5386 if (eap->skip) /* skip error messages for all subcommands */
5387 ++emsg_skip;
5388 for (i = 0;; ++i) {
5389 if (subcommands[i].name == NULL((void*)0)) {
5390 EMSG2(_("E410: Invalid :syntax subcommand: %s"), subcmd_name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E410: Invalid :syntax subcommand: %s"
))), (char_u *)(subcmd_name));
5391 break;
5392 }
5393 if (STRCMP(subcmd_name, (char_u *)subcommands[i].name)strcmp((char *)(subcmd_name), (char *)((char_u *)subcommands[
i].name)) == 0) {
5394 eap->arg = skipwhite(subcmd_end);
5395 (subcommands[i].func)(eap, FALSE0);
5396 break;
5397 }
5398 }
5399 free(subcmd_name);
5400 if (eap->skip)
5401 --emsg_skip;
5402}
5403
5404void ex_ownsyntax(exarg_T *eap)
5405{
5406 char_u *old_value;
5407 char_u *new_value;
5408
5409 if (curwin->w_s == &curwin->w_buffer->b_s) {
5410 curwin->w_s = xmalloc(sizeof(synblock_T));
5411 memset(curwin->w_s, 0, sizeof(synblock_T));
5412 curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell = FALSE0; /* No spell checking */
5413 clear_string_option(&curwin->w_s->b_p_spc);
5414 clear_string_option(&curwin->w_s->b_p_spf);
5415 vim_regfree(curwin->w_s->b_cap_prog);
5416 curwin->w_s->b_cap_prog = NULL((void*)0);
5417 clear_string_option(&curwin->w_s->b_p_spl);
5418 }
5419
5420 /* save value of b:current_syntax */
5421 old_value = get_var_value((char_u *)"b:current_syntax");
5422 if (old_value != NULL((void*)0))
5423 old_value = vim_strsave(old_value);
5424
5425 /* Apply the "syntax" autocommand event, this finds and loads the syntax
5426 * file. */
5427 apply_autocmds(EVENT_SYNTAX, eap->arg, curbuf->b_fname, TRUE1, curbuf);
5428
5429 /* move value of b:current_syntax to w:current_syntax */
5430 new_value = get_var_value((char_u *)"b:current_syntax");
5431 if (new_value != NULL((void*)0))
5432 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"w:current_syntax", new_value);
5433
5434 /* restore value of b:current_syntax */
5435 if (old_value == NULL((void*)0))
5436 do_unlet((char_u *)"b:current_syntax", TRUE1);
5437 else {
5438 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"b:current_syntax", old_value);
5439 free(old_value);
5440 }
5441}
5442
5443int syntax_present(win_T *win)
5444{
5445 return win->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len != 0
5446 || win->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len != 0
5447 || win->w_s->b_keywtab.ht_used > 0
5448 || win->w_s->b_keywtab_ic.ht_used > 0;
5449}
5450
5451
5452static enum {
5453 EXP_SUBCMD, /* expand ":syn" sub-commands */
5454 EXP_CASE /* expand ":syn case" arguments */
5455} expand_what;
5456
5457/*
5458 * Reset include_link, include_default, include_none to 0.
5459 * Called when we are done expanding.
5460 */
5461void reset_expand_highlight(void)
5462{
5463 include_link = include_default = include_none = 0;
5464}
5465
5466/*
5467 * Handle command line completion for :match and :echohl command: Add "None"
5468 * as highlight group.
5469 */
5470void set_context_in_echohl_cmd(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg)
5471{
5472 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_HIGHLIGHT;
5473 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
5474 include_none = 1;
5475}
5476
5477/*
5478 * Handle command line completion for :syntax command.
5479 */
5480void set_context_in_syntax_cmd(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg)
5481{
5482 char_u *p;
5483
5484 /* Default: expand subcommands */
5485 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SYNTAX;
5486 expand_what = EXP_SUBCMD;
5487 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
5488 include_link = 0;
5489 include_default = 0;
5490
5491 /* (part of) subcommand already typed */
5492 if (*arg != NUL'\000') {
5493 p = skiptowhite(arg);
5494 if (*p != NUL'\000') { /* past first word */
5495 xp->xp_pattern = skipwhite(p);
5496 if (*skiptowhite(xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000')
5497 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5498 else if (STRNICMP(arg, "case", p - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("case"), (size_t)(p - arg
)) == 0)
5499 expand_what = EXP_CASE;
5500 else if ( STRNICMP(arg, "keyword", p - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("keyword"), (size_t)(p - arg
)) == 0
5501 || STRNICMP(arg, "region", p - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("region"), (size_t)(p - arg
)) == 0
5502 || STRNICMP(arg, "match", p - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("match"), (size_t)(p - arg
)) == 0
5503 || STRNICMP(arg, "list", p - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("list"), (size_t)(p - arg
)) == 0)
5504 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_HIGHLIGHT;
5505 else
5506 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5507 }
5508 }
5509}
5510
5511static char *(case_args[]) = {"match", "ignore", NULL((void*)0)};
5512
5513/*
5514 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list syntax names for
5515 * expansion.
5516 */
5517char_u *get_syntax_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
5518{
5519 if (expand_what == EXP_SUBCMD)
5520 return (char_u *)subcommands[idx].name;
5521 return (char_u *)case_args[idx];
5522}
5523
5524
5525/*
5526 * Function called for expression evaluation: get syntax ID at file position.
5527 */
5528int
5529syn_get_id (
5530 win_T *wp,
5531 long lnum,
5532 colnr_T col,
5533 int trans, /* remove transparency */
5534 bool_Bool *spellp, /* return: can do spell checking */
5535 int keep_state /* keep state of char at "col" */
5536)
5537{
5538 /* When the position is not after the current position and in the same
5539 * line of the same buffer, need to restart parsing. */
5540 if (wp->w_buffer != syn_buf
5541 || lnum != current_lnum
5542 || col < current_col)
5543 syntax_start(wp, lnum);
5544
5545 (void)get_syntax_attr(col, spellp, keep_state);
5546
5547 return trans ? current_trans_id : current_id;
5548}
5549
5550/*
5551 * Get extra information about the syntax item. Must be called right after
5552 * get_syntax_attr().
5553 * Stores the current item sequence nr in "*seqnrp".
5554 * Returns the current flags.
5555 */
5556int get_syntax_info(int *seqnrp)
5557{
5558 *seqnrp = current_seqnr;
5559 return current_flags;
5560}
5561
5562/*
5563 * Return conceal substitution character
5564 */
5565int syn_get_sub_char(void)
5566{
5567 return current_sub_char;
5568}
5569
5570/*
5571 * Return the syntax ID at position "i" in the current stack.
5572 * The caller must have called syn_get_id() before to fill the stack.
5573 * Returns -1 when "i" is out of range.
5574 */
5575int syn_get_stack_item(int i)
5576{
5577 if (i >= current_state.ga_len) {
5578 /* Need to invalidate the state, because we didn't properly finish it
5579 * for the last character, "keep_state" was TRUE. */
5580 invalidate_current_state();
5581 current_col = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
5582 return -1;
5583 }
5584 return CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_id;
5585}
5586
5587/*
5588 * Function called to get folding level for line "lnum" in window "wp".
5589 */
5590int syn_get_foldlevel(win_T *wp, long lnum)
5591{
5592 int level = 0;
5593
5594 /* Return quickly when there are no fold items at all. */
5595 if (wp->w_s->b_syn_folditems != 0) {
5596 syntax_start(wp, lnum);
5597
5598 for (int i = 0; i < current_state.ga_len; ++i) {
5599 if (CUR_STATE(i)((stateitem_T *)(current_state.ga_data))[i].si_flags & HL_FOLD0x2000) {
5600 ++level;
5601 }
5602 }
5603 }
5604 if (level > wp->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn) {
5605 level = wp->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn;
5606 if (level < 0)
5607 level = 0;
5608 }
5609 return level;
5610}
5611
5612/*
5613 * ":syntime".
5614 */
5615void ex_syntime(exarg_T *eap)
5616{
5617 if (STRCMP(eap->arg, "on")strcmp((char *)(eap->arg), (char *)("on")) == 0)
5618 syn_time_on = TRUE1;
5619 else if (STRCMP(eap->arg, "off")strcmp((char *)(eap->arg), (char *)("off")) == 0)
5620 syn_time_on = FALSE0;
5621 else if (STRCMP(eap->arg, "clear")strcmp((char *)(eap->arg), (char *)("clear")) == 0)
5622 syntime_clear();
5623 else if (STRCMP(eap->arg, "report")strcmp((char *)(eap->arg), (char *)("report")) == 0)
5624 syntime_report();
5625 else
5626 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
5627}
5628
5629static void syn_clear_time(syn_time_T *st)
5630{
5631 st->total = profile_zero();
5632 st->slowest = profile_zero();
5633 st->count = 0;
5634 st->match = 0;
5635}
5636
5637/*
5638 * Clear the syntax timing for the current buffer.
5639 */
5640static void syntime_clear(void)
5641{
5642 synpat_T *spp;
5643
5644 if (!syntax_present(curwin)) {
5645 MSG(_(msg_no_items))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(msg_no_items))));
5646 return;
5647 }
5648 for (int idx = 0; idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; ++idx) {
5649 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
5650 syn_clear_time(&spp->sp_time);
5651 }
5652}
5653
5654/*
5655 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the possible arguments of the
5656 * ":syntime {on,off,clear,report}" command.
5657 */
5658char_u *get_syntime_arg(expand_T *xp, int idx)
5659{
5660 switch (idx) {
5661 case 0: return (char_u *)"on";
5662 case 1: return (char_u *)"off";
5663 case 2: return (char_u *)"clear";
5664 case 3: return (char_u *)"report";
5665 }
5666 return NULL((void*)0);
5667}
5668
5669static int syn_compare_syntime(const void *v1, const void *v2)
5670{
5671 const time_entry_T *s1 = v1;
5672 const time_entry_T *s2 = v2;
5673
5674 return profile_cmp(s1->total, s2->total);
5675}
5676
5677/*
5678 * Clear the syntax timing for the current buffer.
5679 */
5680static void syntime_report(void)
5681{
5682 if (!syntax_present(curwin)) {
5683 MSG(_(msg_no_items))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(msg_no_items))));
5684 return;
5685 }
5686
5687 garray_T ga;
5688 ga_init(&ga, sizeof(time_entry_T), 50);
5689
5690 proftime_T total_total = profile_zero();
5691 int total_count = 0;
5692 time_entry_T *p;
5693 for (int idx = 0; idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; ++idx) {
5694 synpat_T *spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
5695 if (spp->sp_time.count > 0) {
5696 p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(time_entry_T, &ga)ga_append_via_ptr(&ga, sizeof(time_entry_T));
5697 p->total = spp->sp_time.total;
5698 total_total = profile_add(total_total, spp->sp_time.total);
5699 p->count = spp->sp_time.count;
5700 p->match = spp->sp_time.match;
5701 total_count += spp->sp_time.count;
5702 p->slowest = spp->sp_time.slowest;
5703 proftime_T tm = profile_divide(spp->sp_time.total, spp->sp_time.count);
5704 p->average = tm;
5705 p->id = spp->sp_syn.id;
5706 p->pattern = spp->sp_pattern;
5707 }
5708 }
5709
5710 /* sort on total time */
5711 qsort(ga.ga_data, (size_t)ga.ga_len, sizeof(time_entry_T),
5712 syn_compare_syntime);
5713
5714 MSG_PUTS_TITLE(_(msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" TOTAL COUNT MATCH SLOWEST AVERAGE NAME PATTERN"
))))
5715 " TOTAL COUNT MATCH SLOWEST AVERAGE NAME PATTERN"))msg_puts_title((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" TOTAL COUNT MATCH SLOWEST AVERAGE NAME PATTERN"
))));
5716 MSG_PUTS("\n")msg_puts((char_u *)("\n"));
5717 for (int idx = 0; idx < ga.ga_len && !got_int; ++idx) {
5718 p = ((time_entry_T *)ga.ga_data) + idx;
5719
5720 MSG_PUTS(profile_msg(p->total))msg_puts((char_u *)(profile_msg(p->total)));
5721 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" ")); /* make sure there is always a separating space */
5722 msg_advance(13);
5723 msg_outnum(p->count);
5724 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
5725 msg_advance(20);
5726 msg_outnum(p->match);
5727 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
5728 msg_advance(26);
5729 MSG_PUTS(profile_msg(p->slowest))msg_puts((char_u *)(profile_msg(p->slowest)));
5730 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
5731 msg_advance(38);
5732 MSG_PUTS(profile_msg(p->average))msg_puts((char_u *)(profile_msg(p->average)));
5733 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
5734 msg_advance(50);
5735 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[p->id - 1].sg_name);
5736 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
5737
5738 msg_advance(69);
5739 int len;
5740 if (Columns < 80)
5741 len = 20; /* will wrap anyway */
5742 else
5743 len = Columns - 70;
5744 if (len > (int)STRLEN(p->pattern)strlen((char *)(p->pattern)))
5745 len = (int)STRLEN(p->pattern)strlen((char *)(p->pattern));
5746 msg_outtrans_len(p->pattern, len);
5747 MSG_PUTS("\n")msg_puts((char_u *)("\n"));
5748 }
5749 ga_clear(&ga);
5750 if (!got_int) {
5751 MSG_PUTS("\n")msg_puts((char_u *)("\n"));
5752 MSG_PUTS(profile_msg(total_total))msg_puts((char_u *)(profile_msg(total_total)));
5753 msg_advance(13);
5754 msg_outnum(total_count);
5755 MSG_PUTS("\n")msg_puts((char_u *)("\n"));
5756 }
5757}
5758
5759/**************************************
5760* Highlighting stuff *
5761**************************************/
5762
5763/*
5764 * The default highlight groups. These are compiled-in for fast startup and
5765 * they still work when the runtime files can't be found.
5766 * When making changes here, also change runtime/colors/default.vim!
5767 * The #ifdefs are needed to reduce the amount of static data. Helps to make
5768 * the 16 bit DOS (museum) version compile.
5769 */
5770# define CENT(a, b)b b
