5888 "SpellBad term=reverse ctermbg=Red guisp=Red gui=undercurl")"SpellBad term=reverse ctermbg=Red guisp=Red gui=undercurl",
5889 CENT("SpellCap term=reverse ctermbg=Blue","SpellCap term=reverse ctermbg=Blue guisp=Blue gui=undercurl"
5890 "SpellCap term=reverse ctermbg=Blue guisp=Blue gui=undercurl")"SpellCap term=reverse ctermbg=Blue guisp=Blue gui=undercurl",
5891 CENT("SpellRare term=reverse ctermbg=Magenta","SpellRare term=reverse ctermbg=Magenta guisp=Magenta gui=undercurl"
5892 "SpellRare term=reverse ctermbg=Magenta guisp=Magenta gui=undercurl")"SpellRare term=reverse ctermbg=Magenta guisp=Magenta gui=undercurl",
5893 CENT("SpellLocal term=underline ctermbg=Cyan","SpellLocal term=underline ctermbg=Cyan guisp=Cyan gui=undercurl"
5894 "SpellLocal term=underline ctermbg=Cyan guisp=Cyan gui=undercurl")"SpellLocal term=underline ctermbg=Cyan guisp=Cyan gui=undercurl",
5895 CENT("PmenuThumb ctermbg=White","PmenuThumb ctermbg=White guibg=White"
5896 "PmenuThumb ctermbg=White guibg=White")"PmenuThumb ctermbg=White guibg=White",
5897 CENT("Pmenu ctermbg=Magenta ctermfg=Black","Pmenu ctermbg=Magenta ctermfg=Black guibg=Magenta"
5898 "Pmenu ctermbg=Magenta ctermfg=Black guibg=Magenta")"Pmenu ctermbg=Magenta ctermfg=Black guibg=Magenta",
5899 CENT("PmenuSel ctermbg=Black ctermfg=DarkGrey","PmenuSel ctermbg=Black ctermfg=DarkGrey guibg=DarkGrey"
5900 "PmenuSel ctermbg=Black ctermfg=DarkGrey guibg=DarkGrey")"PmenuSel ctermbg=Black ctermfg=DarkGrey guibg=DarkGrey",
5901 CENT("Title term=bold ctermfg=LightMagenta","Title term=bold ctermfg=LightMagenta gui=bold guifg=Magenta"
5902 "Title term=bold ctermfg=LightMagenta gui=bold guifg=Magenta")"Title term=bold ctermfg=LightMagenta gui=bold guifg=Magenta",
5903 CENT("WarningMsg term=standout ctermfg=LightRed","WarningMsg term=standout ctermfg=LightRed guifg=Red"
5904 "WarningMsg term=standout ctermfg=LightRed guifg=Red")"WarningMsg term=standout ctermfg=LightRed guifg=Red",
5905 CENT("WildMenu term=standout ctermbg=Yellow ctermfg=Black guibg=Yellow guifg=Black"
5906 "WildMenu term=standout ctermbg=Yellow ctermfg=Black","WildMenu term=standout ctermbg=Yellow ctermfg=Black guibg=Yellow guifg=Black"
5907 "WildMenu term=standout ctermbg=Yellow ctermfg=Black guibg=Yellow guifg=Black")"WildMenu term=standout ctermbg=Yellow ctermfg=Black guibg=Yellow guifg=Black",
5908 CENT("Folded term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=DarkGrey guifg=Cyan"
5909 "Folded term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan","Folded term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=DarkGrey guifg=Cyan"
5910 "Folded term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=DarkGrey guifg=Cyan")"Folded term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=DarkGrey guifg=Cyan",
5911 CENT("FoldColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan"
5912 "FoldColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan","FoldColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan"
5913 "FoldColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan")"FoldColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan",
5914 CENT("SignColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan","SignColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan"
5915 "SignColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan")"SignColumn term=standout ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=Cyan guibg=Grey guifg=Cyan",
5916 CENT("Visual term=reverse","Visual term=reverse guibg=DarkGrey"
5917 "Visual term=reverse guibg=DarkGrey")"Visual term=reverse guibg=DarkGrey",
5918 CENT("DiffAdd term=bold ctermbg=DarkBlue","DiffAdd term=bold ctermbg=DarkBlue guibg=DarkBlue"
5919 "DiffAdd term=bold ctermbg=DarkBlue guibg=DarkBlue")"DiffAdd term=bold ctermbg=DarkBlue guibg=DarkBlue",
5920 CENT("DiffChange term=bold ctermbg=DarkMagenta","DiffChange term=bold ctermbg=DarkMagenta guibg=DarkMagenta"
5921 "DiffChange term=bold ctermbg=DarkMagenta guibg=DarkMagenta")"DiffChange term=bold ctermbg=DarkMagenta guibg=DarkMagenta",
5922 CENT("DiffDelete term=bold ctermfg=Blue ctermbg=DarkCyan gui=bold guifg=Blue guibg=DarkCyan"
5923 "DiffDelete term=bold ctermfg=Blue ctermbg=DarkCyan","DiffDelete term=bold ctermfg=Blue ctermbg=DarkCyan gui=bold guifg=Blue guibg=DarkCyan"
5924 "DiffDelete term=bold ctermfg=Blue ctermbg=DarkCyan gui=bold guifg=Blue guibg=DarkCyan")"DiffDelete term=bold ctermfg=Blue ctermbg=DarkCyan gui=bold guifg=Blue guibg=DarkCyan",
5925 CENT("TabLine term=underline cterm=underline ctermfg=white ctermbg=DarkGrey gui=underline guibg=DarkGrey"
5926 "TabLine term=underline cterm=underline ctermfg=white ctermbg=DarkGrey","TabLine term=underline cterm=underline ctermfg=white ctermbg=DarkGrey gui=underline guibg=DarkGrey"
5927 "TabLine term=underline cterm=underline ctermfg=white ctermbg=DarkGrey gui=underline guibg=DarkGrey")"TabLine term=underline cterm=underline ctermfg=white ctermbg=DarkGrey gui=underline guibg=DarkGrey",
5928 CENT("CursorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkGrey","CursorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkGrey guibg=Grey40"
5929 "CursorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkGrey guibg=Grey40")"CursorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkGrey guibg=Grey40",
5930 CENT("CursorLine term=underline cterm=underline","CursorLine term=underline cterm=underline guibg=Grey40"
5931 "CursorLine term=underline cterm=underline guibg=Grey40")"CursorLine term=underline cterm=underline guibg=Grey40",
5932 CENT("ColorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkRed","ColorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkRed guibg=DarkRed"
5933 "ColorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkRed guibg=DarkRed")"ColorColumn term=reverse ctermbg=DarkRed guibg=DarkRed",
5934 CENT("MatchParen term=reverse ctermbg=DarkCyan","MatchParen term=reverse ctermbg=DarkCyan guibg=DarkCyan"
5935 "MatchParen term=reverse ctermbg=DarkCyan guibg=DarkCyan")"MatchParen term=reverse ctermbg=DarkCyan guibg=DarkCyan",
5936 CENT("Conceal ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=LightGrey guibg=DarkGrey guifg=LightGrey"
5937 "Conceal ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=LightGrey","Conceal ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=LightGrey guibg=DarkGrey guifg=LightGrey"
5938 "Conceal ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=LightGrey guibg=DarkGrey guifg=LightGrey")"Conceal ctermbg=DarkGrey ctermfg=LightGrey guibg=DarkGrey guifg=LightGrey",
5939 NULL((void*)0)
5940};
5941
5942void
5943init_highlight (
5944 int both, /* include groups where 'bg' doesn't matter */
5945 int reset /* clear group first */
5946)
5947{
5948 int i;
5949 char **pp;
5950 static int had_both = FALSE0;
5951 char_u *p;
5952
5953 /*
5954 * Try finding the color scheme file. Used when a color file was loaded
5955 * and 'background' or 't_Co' is changed.
5956 */
5957 p = get_var_value((char_u *)"g:colors_name");
5958 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && load_colors(p) == OK1)
5959 return;
5960
5961 /*
5962 * Didn't use a color file, use the compiled-in colors.
5963 */
5964 if (both) {
5965 had_both = TRUE1;
5966 pp = highlight_init_both;
5967 for (i = 0; pp[i] != NULL((void*)0); ++i)
5968 do_highlight((char_u *)pp[i], reset, TRUE1);
5969 } else if (!had_both)
5970 /* Don't do anything before the call with both == TRUE from main().
5971 * Not everything has been setup then, and that call will overrule
5972 * everything anyway. */
5973 return;
5974
5975 if (*p_bg == 'l')
5976 pp = highlight_init_light;
5977 else
5978 pp = highlight_init_dark;
5979 for (i = 0; pp[i] != NULL((void*)0); ++i)
5980 do_highlight((char_u *)pp[i], reset, TRUE1);
5981
5982 /* Reverse looks ugly, but grey may not work for 8 colors. Thus let it
5983 * depend on the number of colors available.
5984 * With 8 colors brown is equal to yellow, need to use black for Search fg
5985 * to avoid Statement highlighted text disappears.
5986 * Clear the attributes, needed when changing the t_Co value. */
5987 if (t_colors > 8)
5988 do_highlight(
5989 (char_u *)(*p_bg == 'l'
5990 ? "Visual cterm=NONE ctermbg=LightGrey"
5991 : "Visual cterm=NONE ctermbg=DarkGrey"), FALSE0,
5992 TRUE1);
5993 else {
5994 do_highlight((char_u *)"Visual cterm=reverse ctermbg=NONE",
5995 FALSE0, TRUE1);
5996 if (*p_bg == 'l')
5997 do_highlight((char_u *)"Search ctermfg=black", FALSE0, TRUE1);
5998 }
5999
6000 /*
6001 * If syntax highlighting is enabled load the highlighting for it.
6002 */
6003 if (get_var_value((char_u *)"g:syntax_on") != NULL((void*)0)) {
6004 static int recursive = 0;
6005
6006 if (recursive >= 5)
6007 EMSG(_("E679: recursive loop loading syncolor.vim"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E679: recursive loop loading syncolor.vim"
))));
6008 else {
6009 ++recursive;
6010 (void)source_runtime((char_u *)"syntax/syncolor.vim", TRUE1);
6011 --recursive;
6012 }
6013 }
6014}
6015
6016/*
6017 * Load color file "name".
6018 * Return OK for success, FAIL for failure.
6019 */
6020int load_colors(char_u *name)
6021{
6022 char_u *buf;
6023 int retval = FAIL0;
6024 static int recursive = FALSE0;
6025
6026 /* When being called recursively, this is probably because setting
6027 * 'background' caused the highlighting to be reloaded. This means it is
6028 * working, thus we should return OK. */
6029 if (recursive)
6030 return OK1;
6031
6032 recursive = TRUE1;
6033 buf = xmalloc(STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 12);
6034 sprintf((char *)buf, "colors/%s.vim", name);
6035 retval = source_runtime(buf, FALSE0);
6036 free(buf);
6037 apply_autocmds(EVENT_COLORSCHEME, name, curbuf->b_fname, FALSE0, curbuf);
6038
6039 recursive = FALSE0;
6040
6041 return retval;
6042}
6043
6044/*
6045 * Handle the ":highlight .." command.
6046 * When using ":hi clear" this is called recursively for each group with
6047 * "forceit" and "init" both TRUE.
6048 */
6049void
6050do_highlight (
6051 char_u *line,
6052 int forceit,
6053 int init /* TRUE when called for initializing */
6054)
6055{
6056 char_u *name_end;
6057 char_u *p;
6058 char_u *linep;
6059 char_u *key_start;
6060 char_u *arg_start;
6061 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0), *arg = NULL((void*)0);
6062 long i;
6063 int off;
6064 int len;
6065 int attr;
6066 int id;
6067 int idx;
6068 int dodefault = FALSE0;
6069 int doclear = FALSE0;
6070 int dolink = FALSE0;
6071 int error = FALSE0;
6072 int color;
6073 int is_normal_group = FALSE0; /* "Normal" group */
6074# define is_menu_group0 0
6075# define is_tooltip_group0 0
6076
6077 /*
6078 * If no argument, list current highlighting.
6079 */
6080 if (ends_excmd(*line)) {
6081 for (int i = 1; i <= highlight_ga.ga_len && !got_int; ++i)
6082 /* TODO: only call when the group has attributes set */
6083 highlight_list_one((int)i);
6084 return;
6085 }
6086
6087 /*
6088 * Isolate the name.
6089 */
6090 name_end = skiptowhite(line);
6091 linep = skipwhite(name_end);
6092
6093 /*
6094 * Check for "default" argument.
6095 */
6096 if (STRNCMP(line, "default", name_end - line)strncmp((char *)(line), (char *)("default"), (size_t)(name_end
- line)) == 0) {
6097 dodefault = TRUE1;
6098 line = linep;
6099 name_end = skiptowhite(line);
6100 linep = skipwhite(name_end);
6101 }
6102
6103 /*
6104 * Check for "clear" or "link" argument.
6105 */
6106 if (STRNCMP(line, "clear", name_end - line)strncmp((char *)(line), (char *)("clear"), (size_t)(name_end -
line)) == 0)
6107 doclear = TRUE1;
6108 if (STRNCMP(line, "link", name_end - line)strncmp((char *)(line), (char *)("link"), (size_t)(name_end -
line)) == 0)
6109 dolink = TRUE1;
6110
6111 /*
6112 * ":highlight {group-name}": list highlighting for one group.
6113 */
6114 if (!doclear && !dolink && ends_excmd(*linep)) {
6115 id = syn_namen2id(line, (int)(name_end - line));
6116 if (id == 0)
6117 EMSG2(_("E411: highlight group not found: %s"), line)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E411: highlight group not found: %s"
))), (char_u *)(line));
6118 else
6119 highlight_list_one(id);
6120 return;
6121 }
6122
6123 /*
6124 * Handle ":highlight link {from} {to}" command.
6125 */
6126 if (dolink) {
6127 char_u *from_start = linep;
6128 char_u *from_end;
6129 char_u *to_start;
6130 char_u *to_end;
6131 int from_id;
6132 int to_id;
6133
6134 from_end = skiptowhite(from_start);
6135 to_start = skipwhite(from_end);
6136 to_end = skiptowhite(to_start);
6137
6138 if (ends_excmd(*from_start) || ends_excmd(*to_start)) {
6139 EMSG2(_("E412: Not enough arguments: \":highlight link %s\""),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E412: Not enough arguments: \":highlight link %s\""
))), (char_u *)(from_start))
6140 from_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E412: Not enough arguments: \":highlight link %s\""
))), (char_u *)(from_start));
6141 return;
6142 }
6143
6144 if (!ends_excmd(*skipwhite(to_end))) {
6145 EMSG2(_("E413: Too many arguments: \":highlight link %s\""), from_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E413: Too many arguments: \":highlight link %s\""
))), (char_u *)(from_start));
6146 return;
6147 }
6148
6149 from_id = syn_check_group(from_start, (int)(from_end - from_start));
6150 if (STRNCMP(to_start, "NONE", 4)strncmp((char *)(to_start), (char *)("NONE"), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
6151 to_id = 0;
6152 else
6153 to_id = syn_check_group(to_start, (int)(to_end - to_start));
6154
6155 if (from_id > 0 && (!init || HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[from_id - 1].sg_set == 0)) {
6156 /*
6157 * Don't allow a link when there already is some highlighting
6158 * for the group, unless '!' is used
6159 */
6160 if (to_id > 0 && !forceit && !init
6161 && hl_has_settings(from_id - 1, dodefault)) {
6162 if (sourcing_name == NULL((void*)0) && !dodefault)
6163 EMSG(_("E414: group has settings, highlight link ignored"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E414: group has settings, highlight link ignored"
))));
6164 } else {
6165 if (!init)
6166 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[from_id - 1].sg_set |= SG_LINK8;
6167 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[from_id - 1].sg_link = to_id;
6168 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[from_id - 1].sg_scriptID = current_SID;
6169 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
6170 }
6171 }
6172
6173 /* Only call highlight_changed() once, after sourcing a syntax file */
6174 need_highlight_changed = TRUE1;
6175
6176 return;
6177 }
6178
6179 if (doclear) {
6180 /*
6181 * ":highlight clear [group]" command.
6182 */
6183 line = linep;
6184 if (ends_excmd(*line)) {
6185 do_unlet((char_u *)"colors_name", TRUE1);
6186 restore_cterm_colors();
6187
6188 /*
6189 * Clear all default highlight groups and load the defaults.
6190 */
6191 for (int idx = 0; idx < highlight_ga.ga_len; ++idx) {
6192 highlight_clear(idx);
6193 }
6194 init_highlight(TRUE1, TRUE1);
6195 highlight_changed();
6196 redraw_later_clear();
6197 return;
6198 }
6199 name_end = skiptowhite(line);
6200 linep = skipwhite(name_end);
6201 }
6202
6203 /*
6204 * Find the group name in the table. If it does not exist yet, add it.
6205 */
6206 id = syn_check_group(line, (int)(name_end - line));
6207 if (id == 0) /* failed (out of memory) */
6208 return;
6209 idx = id - 1; /* index is ID minus one */
6210
6211 /* Return if "default" was used and the group already has settings. */
6212 if (dodefault && hl_has_settings(idx, TRUE1))
6213 return;
6214
6215 if (STRCMP(HL_TABLE()[idx].sg_name_u, "NORMAL")strcmp((char *)(((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))
[idx].sg_name_u), (char *)("NORMAL")) == 0)
6216 is_normal_group = TRUE1;
6217
6218 /* Clear the highlighting for ":hi clear {group}" and ":hi clear". */
6219 if (doclear || (forceit && init)) {
6220 highlight_clear(idx);
6221 if (!doclear)
6222 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set = 0;
6223 }
6224
6225 if (!doclear)
6226 while (!ends_excmd(*linep)) {
6227 key_start = linep;
6228 if (*linep == '=') {
6229 EMSG2(_("E415: unexpected equal sign: %s"), key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E415: unexpected equal sign: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start));
6230 error = TRUE1;
6231 break;
6232 }
6233
6234 /*
6235 * Isolate the key ("term", "ctermfg", "ctermbg", "font", "guifg" or
6236 * "guibg").
6237 */
6238 while (*linep && !vim_iswhite(*linep)((*linep) == ' ' || (*linep) == '\t') && *linep != '=')
6239 ++linep;
6240 free(key);
6241 key = vim_strnsave_up(key_start, (int)(linep - key_start));
6242 linep = skipwhite(linep);
6243
6244 if (STRCMP(key, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("NONE")) == 0) {
6245 if (!init || HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set == 0) {
6246 if (!init)
6247 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_TERM1+SG_CTERM2+SG_GUI4;
6248 highlight_clear(idx);
6249 }
6250 continue;
6251 }
6252
6253 /*
6254 * Check for the equal sign.
6255 */
6256 if (*linep != '=') {
6257 EMSG2(_("E416: missing equal sign: %s"), key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E416: missing equal sign: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start));
6258 error = TRUE1;
6259 break;
6260 }
6261 ++linep;
6262
6263 /*
6264 * Isolate the argument.
6265 */
6266 linep = skipwhite(linep);
6267 if (*linep == '\'') { /* guifg='color name' */
6268 arg_start = ++linep;
6269 linep = vim_strchr(linep, '\'');
6270 if (linep == NULL((void*)0)) {
6271 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(key_start
));
6272 error = TRUE1;
6273 break;
6274 }
6275 } else {
6276 arg_start = linep;
6277 linep = skiptowhite(linep);
6278 }
6279 if (linep == arg_start) {
6280 EMSG2(_("E417: missing argument: %s"), key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E417: missing argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start));
6281 error = TRUE1;
6282 break;
6283 }
6284 free(arg);
6285 arg = vim_strnsave(arg_start, (int)(linep - arg_start));
6286
6287 if (*linep == '\'')
6288 ++linep;
6289
6290 /*
6291 * Store the argument.
6292 */
6293 if ( STRCMP(key, "TERM")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("TERM")) == 0
6294 || STRCMP(key, "CTERM")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CTERM")) == 0
6295 || STRCMP(key, "GUI")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("GUI")) == 0) {
6296 attr = 0;
6297 off = 0;
6298 while (arg[off] != NUL'\000') {
6299 for (i = sizeof(hl_attr_table) / sizeof(int); --i >= 0; ) {
6300 len = (int)STRLEN(hl_name_table[i])strlen((char *)(hl_name_table[i]));
6301 if (STRNICMP(arg + off, hl_name_table[i], len)strncasecmp((char *)(arg + off), (char *)(hl_name_table[i]), (
size_t)(len)) == 0) {
6302 attr |= hl_attr_table[i];
6303 off += len;
6304 break;
6305 }
6306 }
6307 if (i < 0) {
6308 EMSG2(_("E418: Illegal value: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E418: Illegal value: %s"))
), (char_u *)(arg));
6309 error = TRUE1;
6310 break;
6311 }
6312 if (arg[off] == ',') /* another one follows */
6313 ++off;
6314 }
6315 if (error)
6316 break;
6317 if (*key == 'T') {
6318 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_TERM1)) {
6319 if (!init)
6320 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_TERM1;
6321 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_term = attr;
6322 }
6323 } else if (*key == 'C') {
6324 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_CTERM2)) {
6325 if (!init)
6326 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_CTERM2;
6327 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm = attr;
6328 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bold = FALSE0;
6329 }
6330 } else {
6331 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_GUI4)) {
6332 if (!init)
6333 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_GUI4;
6334 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui = attr;
6335 }
6336 }
6337 } else if (STRCMP(key, "FONT")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("FONT")) == 0) {
6338 /* in non-GUI fonts are simply ignored */
6339 } else if (STRCMP(key,strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CTERMFG"))
6340 "CTERMFG")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CTERMFG")) == 0 || STRCMP(key, "CTERMBG")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("CTERMBG")) == 0) {
6341 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_CTERM2)) {
6342 if (!init)
6343 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_CTERM2;
6344
6345 /* When setting the foreground color, and previously the "bold"
6346 * flag was set for a light color, reset it now */
6347 if (key[5] == 'F' && HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bold) {
6348 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm &= ~HL_BOLD0x02;
6349 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bold = FALSE0;
6350 }
6351
6352 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*arg)((unsigned)(*arg) - '0' < 10))
6353 color = atoi((char *)arg);
6354 else if (STRICMP(arg, "fg")strcasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("fg")) == 0) {
6355 if (cterm_normal_fg_color)
6356 color = cterm_normal_fg_color - 1;
6357 else {
6358 EMSG(_("E419: FG color unknown"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E419: FG color unknown"))));
6359 error = TRUE1;
6360 break;
6361 }
6362 } else if (STRICMP(arg, "bg")strcasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("bg")) == 0) {
6363 if (cterm_normal_bg_color > 0)
6364 color = cterm_normal_bg_color - 1;
6365 else {
6366 EMSG(_("E420: BG color unknown"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E420: BG color unknown"))));
6367 error = TRUE1;
6368 break;
6369 }
6370 } else {
6371 static char *(color_names[28]) = {
6372 "Black", "DarkBlue", "DarkGreen", "DarkCyan",
6373 "DarkRed", "DarkMagenta", "Brown", "DarkYellow",
6374 "Gray", "Grey",
6375 "LightGray", "LightGrey", "DarkGray", "DarkGrey",
6376 "Blue", "LightBlue", "Green", "LightGreen",
6377 "Cyan", "LightCyan", "Red", "LightRed", "Magenta",
6378 "LightMagenta", "Yellow", "LightYellow", "White", "NONE"
6379 };
6380 static int color_numbers_16[28] = {0, 1, 2, 3,
6381 4, 5, 6, 6,
6382 7, 7,
6383 7, 7, 8, 8,
6384 9, 9, 10, 10,
6385 11, 11, 12, 12, 13,
6386 13, 14, 14, 15, -1};
6387 /* for xterm with 88 colors... */
6388 static int color_numbers_88[28] = {0, 4, 2, 6,
6389 1, 5, 32, 72,
6390 84, 84,
6391 7, 7, 82, 82,
6392 12, 43, 10, 61,
6393 14, 63, 9, 74, 13,
6394 75, 11, 78, 15, -1};
6395 /* for xterm with 256 colors... */
6396 static int color_numbers_256[28] = {0, 4, 2, 6,
6397 1, 5, 130, 130,
6398 248, 248,
6399 7, 7, 242, 242,
6400 12, 81, 10, 121,
6401 14, 159, 9, 224, 13,
6402 225, 11, 229, 15, -1};
6403 /* for terminals with less than 16 colors... */
6404 static int color_numbers_8[28] = {0, 4, 2, 6,
6405 1, 5, 3, 3,
6406 7, 7,
6407 7, 7, 0+8, 0+8,
6408 4+8, 4+8, 2+8, 2+8,
6409 6+8, 6+8, 1+8, 1+8, 5+8,
6410 5+8, 3+8, 3+8, 7+8, -1};
6411#if defined(__QNXNTO__)
6412 static int *color_numbers_8_qansi = color_numbers_8;
6413 /* On qnx, the 8 & 16 color arrays are the same */
6414 if (STRNCMP(T_NAME, "qansi", 5)strncmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_NAME)])), (char *)("qansi"
), (size_t)(5)) == 0)
6415 color_numbers_8_qansi = color_numbers_16;
6416#endif
6417
6418 /* reduce calls to STRICMP a bit, it can be slow */
6419 off = TOUPPER_ASC(*arg)(((*arg) < 'a' || (*arg) > 'z') ? (*arg) : (*arg) - ('a'
- 'A'));
6420 for (i = (sizeof(color_names) / sizeof(char *)); --i >= 0; )
6421 if (off == color_names[i][0]
6422 && STRICMP(arg + 1, color_names[i] + 1)strcasecmp((char *)(arg + 1), (char *)(color_names[i] + 1)) == 0)
6423 break;
6424 if (i < 0) {
6425 EMSG2(_(emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E421: Color name or number not recognized: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start))
6426 "E421: Color name or number not recognized: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E421: Color name or number not recognized: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start))
6427 key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E421: Color name or number not recognized: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start));
6428 error = TRUE1;
6429 break;
6430 }
6431
6432 /* Use the _16 table to check if its a valid color name. */
6433 color = color_numbers_16[i];
6434 if (color >= 0) {
6435 if (t_colors == 8) {
6436 /* t_Co is 8: use the 8 colors table */
6437#if defined(__QNXNTO__)
6438 color = color_numbers_8_qansi[i];
6439#else
6440 color = color_numbers_8[i];
6441#endif
6442 if (key[5] == 'F') {
6443 /* set/reset bold attribute to get light foreground
6444 * colors (on some terminals, e.g. "linux") */
6445 if (color & 8) {
6446 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm |= HL_BOLD0x02;
6447 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bold = TRUE1;
6448 } else
6449 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm &= ~HL_BOLD0x02;
6450 }
6451 color &= 7; /* truncate to 8 colors */
6452 } else if (t_colors == 16 || t_colors == 88
6453 || t_colors == 256) {
6454 /*
6455 * Guess: if the termcap entry ends in 'm', it is
6456 * probably an xterm-like terminal. Use the changed
6457 * order for colors.
6458 */
6459 if (*T_CAF(term_strings[(int)(KS_CAF)]) != NUL'\000')
6460 p = T_CAF(term_strings[(int)(KS_CAF)]);
6461 else
6462 p = T_CSF(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSF)]);
6463 if (*p != NUL'\000' && *(p + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) - 1) == 'm')
6464 switch (t_colors) {
6465 case 16:
6466 color = color_numbers_8[i];
6467 break;
6468 case 88:
6469 color = color_numbers_88[i];
6470 break;
6471 case 256:
6472 color = color_numbers_256[i];
6473 break;
6474 }
6475 }
6476 }
6477 }
6478 /* Add one to the argument, to avoid zero. Zero is used for
6479 * "NONE", then "color" is -1. */
6480 if (key[5] == 'F') {
6481 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_fg = color + 1;
6482 if (is_normal_group) {
6483 cterm_normal_fg_color = color + 1;
6484 cterm_normal_fg_bold = (HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm & HL_BOLD0x02);
6485 {
6486 must_redraw = CLEAR50;
6487 if (termcap_active && color >= 0)
6488 term_fg_color(color);
6489 }
6490 }
6491 } else {
6492 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bg = color + 1;
6493 if (is_normal_group) {
6494 cterm_normal_bg_color = color + 1;
6495 {
6496 must_redraw = CLEAR50;
6497 if (color >= 0) {
6498 if (termcap_active)
6499 term_bg_color(color);
6500 if (t_colors < 16)
6501 i = (color == 0 || color == 4);
6502 else
6503 i = (color < 7 || color == 8);
6504 /* Set the 'background' option if the value is
6505 * wrong. */
6506 if (i != (*p_bg == 'd'))
6507 set_option_value((char_u *)"bg", 0L,
6508 i ? (char_u *)"dark"
6509 : (char_u *)"light", 0);
6510 }
6511 }
6512 }
6513 }
6514 }
6515 } else if (STRCMP(key, "GUIFG")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("GUIFG")) == 0) {
6516 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_GUI4)) {
6517 if (!init)
6518 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_GUI4;
6519
6520 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_fg_name);
6521 if (STRCMP(arg, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("NONE")))
6522 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_fg_name = vim_strsave(arg);
6523 else
6524 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_fg_name = NULL((void*)0);
6525 }
6526 } else if (STRCMP(key, "GUIBG")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("GUIBG")) == 0) {
6527 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_GUI4)) {
6528 if (!init)
6529 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_GUI4;
6530
6531 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_bg_name);
6532 if (STRCMP(arg, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("NONE")) != 0)
6533 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_bg_name = vim_strsave(arg);
6534 else
6535 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_bg_name = NULL((void*)0);
6536 }
6537 } else if (STRCMP(key, "GUISP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("GUISP")) == 0) {
6538 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_GUI4)) {
6539 if (!init)
6540 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_GUI4;
6541
6542 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_sp_name);
6543 if (STRCMP(arg, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("NONE")) != 0)
6544 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_sp_name = vim_strsave(arg);
6545 else
6546 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_sp_name = NULL((void*)0);
6547 }
6548 } else if (STRCMP(key, "START")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("START")) == 0 || STRCMP(key, "STOP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("STOP")) == 0) {
6549 char_u buf[100];
6550 char_u *tname;
6551
6552 if (!init)
6553 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set |= SG_TERM1;
6554
6555 /*
6556 * The "start" and "stop" arguments can be a literal escape
6557 * sequence, or a comma separated list of terminal codes.
6558 */
6559 if (STRNCMP(arg, "t_", 2)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("t_"), (size_t)(2)) == 0) {
6560 off = 0;
6561 buf[0] = 0;
6562 while (arg[off] != NUL'\000') {
6563 /* Isolate one termcap name */
6564 for (len = 0; arg[off + len] &&
6565 arg[off + len] != ','; ++len)
6566 ;
6567 tname = vim_strnsave(arg + off, len);
6568 /* lookup the escape sequence for the item */
6569 p = get_term_code(tname);
6570 free(tname);
6571 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) /* ignore non-existing things */
6572 p = (char_u *)"";
6573
6574 /* Append it to the already found stuff */
6575 if ((int)(STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf)) + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p))) >= 99) {
6576 EMSG2(_("E422: terminal code too long: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E422: terminal code too long: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
6577 error = TRUE1;
6578 break;
6579 }
6580 STRCAT(buf, p)strcat((char *)(buf), (char *)(p));
6581
6582 /* Advance to the next item */
6583 off += len;
6584 if (arg[off] == ',') /* another one follows */
6585 ++off;
6586 }
6587 } else {
6588 /*
6589 * Copy characters from arg[] to buf[], translating <> codes.
6590 */
6591 for (p = arg, off = 0; off < 100 - 6 && *p; ) {
6592 len = trans_special(&p, buf + off, FALSE0);
6593 if (len > 0) /* recognized special char */
6594 off += len;
6595 else /* copy as normal char */
6596 buf[off++] = *p++;
6597 }
6598 buf[off] = NUL'\000';
6599 }
6600 if (error)
6601 break;
6602
6603 if (STRCMP(buf, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("NONE")) == 0) /* resetting the value */
6604 p = NULL((void*)0);
6605 else
6606 p = vim_strsave(buf);
6607 if (key[2] == 'A') {
6608 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_start);
6609 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_start = p;
6610 } else {
6611 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_stop);
6612 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_stop = p;
6613 }
6614 } else {
6615 EMSG2(_("E423: Illegal argument: %s"), key_start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E423: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(key_start));
6616 error = TRUE1;
6617 break;
6618 }
6619
6620 /*
6621 * When highlighting has been given for a group, don't link it.
6622 */
6623 if (!init || !(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_LINK8))
6624 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_link = 0;
6625
6626 /*
6627 * Continue with next argument.
6628 */
6629 linep = skipwhite(linep);
6630 }
6631
6632 /*
6633 * If there is an error, and it's a new entry, remove it from the table.
6634 */
6635 if (error && idx == highlight_ga.ga_len)
6636 syn_unadd_group();
6637 else {
6638 if (is_normal_group) {
6639 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_term_attr = 0;
6640 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_attr = 0;
6641 } else
6642 set_hl_attr(idx);
6643 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_scriptID = current_SID;
6644 redraw_all_later(NOT_VALID40);
6645 }
6646 free(key);
6647 free(arg);
6648
6649 /* Only call highlight_changed() once, after sourcing a syntax file */
6650 need_highlight_changed = TRUE1;
6651}
6652
6653#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
6654void free_highlight(void)
6655{
6656 for (int i = 0; i < highlight_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
6657 highlight_clear(i);
6658 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[i].sg_name);
6659 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[i].sg_name_u);
6660 }
6661 ga_clear(&highlight_ga);
6662}
6663
6664#endif
6665
6666/*
6667 * Reset the cterm colors to what they were before Vim was started, if
6668 * possible. Otherwise reset them to zero.
6669 */
6670void restore_cterm_colors(void)
6671{
6672 cterm_normal_fg_color = 0;
6673 cterm_normal_fg_bold = 0;
6674 cterm_normal_bg_color = 0;
6675}
6676
6677/*
6678 * Return TRUE if highlight group "idx" has any settings.
6679 * When "check_link" is TRUE also check for an existing link.
6680 */
6681static int hl_has_settings(int idx, int check_link)
6682{
6683 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_term_attr != 0
6684 || HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_attr != 0
6685 || HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_fg != 0
6686 || HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bg != 0
6687 || (check_link && (HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_set & SG_LINK8));
6688}
6689
6690/*
6691 * Clear highlighting for one group.
6692 */
6693static void highlight_clear(int idx)
6694{
6695 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_term = 0;
6696 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_start);
6697 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_start = NULL((void*)0);
6698 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_stop);
6699 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_stop = NULL((void*)0);
6700 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_term_attr = 0;
6701 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm = 0;
6702 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bold = FALSE0;
6703 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_fg = 0;
6704 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_bg = 0;
6705 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_cterm_attr = 0;
6706 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui = 0;
6707 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_fg_name);
6708 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_fg_name = NULL((void*)0);
6709 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_bg_name);
6710 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_bg_name = NULL((void*)0);
6711 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_sp_name);
6712 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_gui_sp_name = NULL((void*)0);
6713 /* Clear the script ID only when there is no link, since that is not
6714 * cleared. */
6715 if (HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_link == 0)
6716 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_scriptID = 0;
6717}
6718
6719
6720/*
6721 * Table with the specifications for an attribute number.
6722 * Note that this table is used by ALL buffers. This is required because the
6723 * GUI can redraw at any time for any buffer.
6724 */
6725static garray_T term_attr_table = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE{ 0, 0, 0, 1, ((void*)0) };
6726
6727#define TERM_ATTR_ENTRY(idx)((attrentry_T *)term_attr_table.ga_data)[idx] ((attrentry_T *)term_attr_table.ga_data)[idx]
6728
6729static garray_T cterm_attr_table = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE{ 0, 0, 0, 1, ((void*)0) };
6730
6731#define CTERM_ATTR_ENTRY(idx)((attrentry_T *)cterm_attr_table.ga_data)[idx] ((attrentry_T *)cterm_attr_table.ga_data)[idx]
6732
6733
6734/*
6735 * Return the attr number for a set of colors and font.
6736 * Add a new entry to the term_attr_table, cterm_attr_table or gui_attr_table
6737 * if the combination is new.
6738 * Return 0 for error.
6739 */
6740static int get_attr_entry(garray_T *table, attrentry_T *aep)
6741{
6742 attrentry_T *taep;
6743 static int recursive = FALSE0;
6744
6745 /*
6746 * Init the table, in case it wasn't done yet.
6747 */
6748 table->ga_itemsize = sizeof(attrentry_T);
6749 ga_set_growsize(table, 7);
6750
6751 /*
6752 * Try to find an entry with the same specifications.
6753 */
6754 for (int i = 0; i < table->ga_len; ++i) {
6755 taep = &(((attrentry_T *)table->ga_data)[i]);
6756 if ( aep->ae_attr == taep->ae_attr
6757 && (
6758 (table == &term_attr_table
6759 && (aep->ae_u.term.start == NULL((void*)0))
6760 == (taep->ae_u.term.start == NULL((void*)0))
6761 && (aep->ae_u.term.start == NULL((void*)0)
6762 || STRCMP(aep->ae_u.term.start,strcmp((char *)(aep->ae_u.term.start), (char *)(taep->ae_u
.term.start))
6763 taep->ae_u.term.start)strcmp((char *)(aep->ae_u.term.start), (char *)(taep->ae_u
.term.start)) == 0)
6764 && (aep->ae_u.term.stop == NULL((void*)0))
6765 == (taep->ae_u.term.stop == NULL((void*)0))
6766 && (aep->ae_u.term.stop == NULL((void*)0)
6767 || STRCMP(aep->ae_u.term.stop,strcmp((char *)(aep->ae_u.term.stop), (char *)(taep->ae_u
.term.stop))
6768 taep->ae_u.term.stop)strcmp((char *)(aep->ae_u.term.stop), (char *)(taep->ae_u
.term.stop)) == 0))
6769 || (table == &cterm_attr_table
6770 && aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color
6771 == taep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color
6772 && aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color
6773 == taep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color)
6774 ))
6775
6776 return i + ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1);
6777 }
6778
6779 if (table->ga_len + ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1) > MAX_TYPENR65535) {
6780 /*
6781 * Running out of attribute entries! remove all attributes, and
6782 * compute new ones for all groups.
6783 * When called recursively, we are really out of numbers.
6784 */
6785 if (recursive) {
6786 EMSG(_("E424: Too many different highlighting attributes in use"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E424: Too many different highlighting attributes in use"
))));
6787 return 0;
6788 }
6789 recursive = TRUE1;
6790
6791 clear_hl_tables();
6792
6793 must_redraw = CLEAR50;
6794
6795 for (int i = 0; i < highlight_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
6796 set_hl_attr(i);
6797 }
6798
6799 recursive = FALSE0;
6800 }
6801
6802 /*
6803 * This is a new combination of colors and font, add an entry.
6804 */
6805 taep = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(attrentry_T, table)ga_append_via_ptr(table, sizeof(attrentry_T));
6806 memset(taep, 0, sizeof(*taep));
6807 taep->ae_attr = aep->ae_attr;
6808 if (table == &term_attr_table) {
6809 if (aep->ae_u.term.start == NULL((void*)0))
6810 taep->ae_u.term.start = NULL((void*)0);
6811 else
6812 taep->ae_u.term.start = vim_strsave(aep->ae_u.term.start);
6813 if (aep->ae_u.term.stop == NULL((void*)0))
6814 taep->ae_u.term.stop = NULL((void*)0);
6815 else
6816 taep->ae_u.term.stop = vim_strsave(aep->ae_u.term.stop);
6817 } else if (table == &cterm_attr_table) {
6818 taep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color = aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color;
6819 taep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color = aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color;
6820 }
6821
6822 return table->ga_len - 1 + ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1);
6823}
6824
6825/*
6826 * Clear all highlight tables.
6827 */
6828void clear_hl_tables(void)
6829{
6830 attrentry_T *taep;
6831
6832 for (int i = 0; i < term_attr_table.ga_len; ++i) {
6833 taep = &(((attrentry_T *)term_attr_table.ga_data)[i]);
6834 free(taep->ae_u.term.start);
6835 free(taep->ae_u.term.stop);
6836 }
6837 ga_clear(&term_attr_table);
6838 ga_clear(&cterm_attr_table);
6839}
6840
6841/*
6842 * Combine special attributes (e.g., for spelling) with other attributes
6843 * (e.g., for syntax highlighting).
6844 * "prim_attr" overrules "char_attr".
6845 * This creates a new group when required.
6846 * Since we expect there to be few spelling mistakes we don't cache the
6847 * result.
6848 * Return the resulting attributes.
6849 */
6850int hl_combine_attr(int char_attr, int prim_attr)
6851{
6852 attrentry_T *char_aep = NULL((void*)0);
6853 attrentry_T *spell_aep;
6854 attrentry_T new_en;
6855
6856 if (char_attr == 0)
6857 return prim_attr;
6858 if (char_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f && prim_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f)
6859 return char_attr | prim_attr;
6860
6861 if (t_colors > 1) {
6862 if (char_attr > HL_ALL0x3f)
6863 char_aep = syn_cterm_attr2entry(char_attr);
6864 if (char_aep != NULL((void*)0))
6865 new_en = *char_aep;
6866 else {
6867 memset(&new_en, 0, sizeof(new_en));
6868 if (char_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f)
6869 new_en.ae_attr = char_attr;
6870 }
6871
6872 if (prim_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f)
6873 new_en.ae_attr |= prim_attr;
6874 else {
6875 spell_aep = syn_cterm_attr2entry(prim_attr);
6876 if (spell_aep != NULL((void*)0)) {
6877 new_en.ae_attr |= spell_aep->ae_attr;
6878 if (spell_aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color > 0)
6879 new_en.ae_u.cterm.fg_color = spell_aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color;
6880 if (spell_aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color > 0)
6881 new_en.ae_u.cterm.bg_color = spell_aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color;
6882 }
6883 }
6884 return get_attr_entry(&cterm_attr_table, &new_en);
6885 }
6886
6887 if (char_attr > HL_ALL0x3f)
6888 char_aep = syn_term_attr2entry(char_attr);
6889 if (char_aep != NULL((void*)0))
6890 new_en = *char_aep;
6891 else {
6892 memset(&new_en, 0, sizeof(new_en));
6893 if (char_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f)
6894 new_en.ae_attr = char_attr;
6895 }
6896
6897 if (prim_attr <= HL_ALL0x3f)
6898 new_en.ae_attr |= prim_attr;
6899 else {
6900 spell_aep = syn_term_attr2entry(prim_attr);
6901 if (spell_aep != NULL((void*)0)) {
6902 new_en.ae_attr |= spell_aep->ae_attr;
6903 if (spell_aep->ae_u.term.start != NULL((void*)0)) {
6904 new_en.ae_u.term.start = spell_aep->ae_u.term.start;
6905 new_en.ae_u.term.stop = spell_aep->ae_u.term.stop;
6906 }
6907 }
6908 }
6909 return get_attr_entry(&term_attr_table, &new_en);
6910}
6911
6912
6913/*
6914 * Get the highlight attributes (HL_BOLD etc.) from an attribute nr.
6915 * Only to be used when "attr" > HL_ALL.
6916 */
6917int syn_attr2attr(int attr)
6918{
6919 attrentry_T *aep;
6920
6921 if (t_colors > 1)
6922 aep = syn_cterm_attr2entry(attr);
6923 else
6924 aep = syn_term_attr2entry(attr);
6925
6926 if (aep == NULL((void*)0)) /* highlighting not set */
6927 return 0;
6928 return aep->ae_attr;
6929}
6930
6931
6932attrentry_T *syn_term_attr2entry(int attr)
6933{
6934 attr -= ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1);
6935 if (attr >= term_attr_table.ga_len) /* did ":syntax clear" */
6936 return NULL((void*)0);
6937 return &(TERM_ATTR_ENTRY(attr)((attrentry_T *)term_attr_table.ga_data)[attr]);
6938}
6939
6940attrentry_T *syn_cterm_attr2entry(int attr)
6941{
6942 attr -= ATTR_OFF(0x3f + 1);
6943 if (attr >= cterm_attr_table.ga_len) /* did ":syntax clear" */
6944 return NULL((void*)0);
6945 return &(CTERM_ATTR_ENTRY(attr)((attrentry_T *)cterm_attr_table.ga_data)[attr]);
6946}
6947
6948#define LIST_ATTR1 1
6949#define LIST_STRING2 2
6950#define LIST_INT3 3
6951
6952static void highlight_list_one(int id)
6953{
6954 struct hl_group *sgp;
6955 int didh = FALSE0;
6956
6957 sgp = &HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1]; /* index is ID minus one */
6958
6959 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_ATTR1,
6960 sgp->sg_term, NULL((void*)0), "term");
6961 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2,
6962 0, sgp->sg_start, "start");
6963 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2,
6964 0, sgp->sg_stop, "stop");
6965
6966 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_ATTR1,
6967 sgp->sg_cterm, NULL((void*)0), "cterm");
6968 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_INT3,
6969 sgp->sg_cterm_fg, NULL((void*)0), "ctermfg");
6970 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_INT3,
6971 sgp->sg_cterm_bg, NULL((void*)0), "ctermbg");
6972
6973 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_ATTR1,
6974 sgp->sg_gui, NULL((void*)0), "gui");
6975 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2,
6976 0, sgp->sg_gui_fg_name, "guifg");
6977 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2,
6978 0, sgp->sg_gui_bg_name, "guibg");
6979 didh = highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2,
6980 0, sgp->sg_gui_sp_name, "guisp");
6981
6982 if (sgp->sg_link && !got_int) {
6983 (void)syn_list_header(didh, 9999, id);
6984 didh = TRUE1;
6985 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"links to", hl_attr(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
6986 msg_putchar(' ');
6987 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_link - 1].sg_name);
6988 }
6989
6990 if (!didh)
6991 highlight_list_arg(id, didh, LIST_STRING2, 0, (char_u *)"cleared", "");
6992 if (p_verbose > 0)
6993 last_set_msg(sgp->sg_scriptID);
6994}
6995
6996static int highlight_list_arg(int id, int didh, int type, int iarg, char_u *sarg, char *name)
6997{
6998 char_u buf[100];
6999 char_u *ts;
7000 int i;
7001
7002 if (got_int)
7003 return FALSE0;
7004 if (type == LIST_STRING2 ? (sarg != NULL((void*)0)) : (iarg != 0)) {
7005 ts = buf;
7006 if (type == LIST_INT3)
7007 sprintf((char *)buf, "%d", iarg - 1);
7008 else if (type == LIST_STRING2)
7009 ts = sarg;
7010 else { /* type == LIST_ATTR */
7011 buf[0] = NUL'\000';
7012 for (i = 0; hl_attr_table[i] != 0; ++i) {
7013 if (iarg & hl_attr_table[i]) {
7014 if (buf[0] != NUL'\000')
7015 vim_strcat(buf, (char_u *)",", 100);
7016 vim_strcat(buf, (char_u *)hl_name_table[i], 100);
7017 iarg &= ~hl_attr_table[i]; /* don't want "inverse" */
7018 }
7019 }
7020 }
7021
7022 (void)syn_list_header(didh,
7023 (int)(vim_strsize(ts) + STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 1), id);
7024 didh = TRUE1;
7025 if (!got_int) {
7026 if (*name != NUL'\000') {
7027 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(name, hl_attr(HLF_D))msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(name), (highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]
));
7028 MSG_PUTS_ATTR("=", hl_attr(HLF_D))msg_puts_attr((char_u *)("="), (highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)])
);
7029 }
7030 msg_outtrans(ts);
7031 }
7032 }
7033 return didh;
7034}
7035
7036/*
7037 * Return "1" if highlight group "id" has attribute "flag".
7038 * Return NULL otherwise.
7039 */
7040char_u *
7041highlight_has_attr (
7042 int id,
7043 int flag,
7044 int modec /* 'g' for GUI, 'c' for cterm, 't' for term */
7045)
7046{
7047 int attr;
7048
7049 if (id <= 0 || id > highlight_ga.ga_len)
7050 return NULL((void*)0);
7051
7052 if (modec == 'g')
7053 attr = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_gui;
7054 else if (modec == 'c')
7055 attr = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_cterm;
7056 else
7057 attr = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_term;
7058
7059 if (attr & flag)
7060 return (char_u *)"1";
7061 return NULL((void*)0);
7062}
7063
7064/*
7065 * Return color name of highlight group "id".
7066 */
7067char_u *
7068highlight_color (
7069 int id,
7070 char_u *what, /* "font", "fg", "bg", "sp", "fg#", "bg#" or "sp#" */
7071 int modec /* 'g' for GUI, 'c' for cterm, 't' for term */
7072)
7073{
7074 static char_u name[20];
7075 int n;
7076 int fg = FALSE0;
7077 int sp = FALSE0;
7078 int font = FALSE0;
7079
7080 if (id <= 0 || id > highlight_ga.ga_len)
7081 return NULL((void*)0);
7082
7083 if (TOLOWER_ASC(what[0])(((what[0]) < 'A' || (what[0]) > 'Z') ? (what[0]) : (what
[0]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'f' && TOLOWER_ASC(what[1])(((what[1]) < 'A' || (what[1]) > 'Z') ? (what[1]) : (what
[1]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'g')
7084 fg = TRUE1;
7085 else if (TOLOWER_ASC(what[0])(((what[0]) < 'A' || (what[0]) > 'Z') ? (what[0]) : (what
[0]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'f' && TOLOWER_ASC(what[1])(((what[1]) < 'A' || (what[1]) > 'Z') ? (what[1]) : (what
[1]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'o'
7086 && TOLOWER_ASC(what[2])(((what[2]) < 'A' || (what[2]) > 'Z') ? (what[2]) : (what
[2]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'n' && TOLOWER_ASC(what[3])(((what[3]) < 'A' || (what[3]) > 'Z') ? (what[3]) : (what
[3]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 't')
7087 font = TRUE1;
7088 else if (TOLOWER_ASC(what[0])(((what[0]) < 'A' || (what[0]) > 'Z') ? (what[0]) : (what
[0]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 's' && TOLOWER_ASC(what[1])(((what[1]) < 'A' || (what[1]) > 'Z') ? (what[1]) : (what
[1]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'p')
7089 sp = TRUE1;
7090 else if (!(TOLOWER_ASC(what[0])(((what[0]) < 'A' || (what[0]) > 'Z') ? (what[0]) : (what
[0]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'b' && TOLOWER_ASC(what[1])(((what[1]) < 'A' || (what[1]) > 'Z') ? (what[1]) : (what
[1]) + ('a' - 'A')) == 'g'))
7091 return NULL((void*)0);
7092 if (modec == 'g') {
7093 if (fg)
7094 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_gui_fg_name;
7095 if (sp)
7096 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_gui_sp_name;
7097 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_gui_bg_name;
7098 }
7099 if (font || sp)
7100 return NULL((void*)0);
7101 if (modec == 'c') {
7102 if (fg)
7103 n = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_cterm_fg - 1;
7104 else
7105 n = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_cterm_bg - 1;
7106 sprintf((char *)name, "%d", n);
7107 return name;
7108 }
7109 /* term doesn't have color */
7110 return NULL((void*)0);
7111}
7112
7113/*
7114 * Output the syntax list header.
7115 * Return TRUE when started a new line.
7116 */
7117static int
7118syn_list_header (
7119 int did_header, /* did header already */
7120 int outlen, /* length of string that comes */
7121 int id /* highlight group id */
7122)
7123{
7124 int endcol = 19;
7125 int newline = TRUE1;
7126
7127 if (!did_header) {
7128 msg_putchar('\n');
7129 if (got_int)
7130 return TRUE1;
7131 msg_outtrans(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_name);
7132 endcol = 15;
7133 } else if (msg_col + outlen + 1 >= Columns) {
7134 msg_putchar('\n');
7135 if (got_int)
7136 return TRUE1;
7137 } else {
7138 if (msg_col >= endcol) /* wrap around is like starting a new line */
7139 newline = FALSE0;
7140 }
7141
7142 if (msg_col >= endcol) /* output at least one space */
7143 endcol = msg_col + 1;
7144 if (Columns <= endcol) /* avoid hang for tiny window */
7145 endcol = Columns - 1;
7146
7147 msg_advance(endcol);
7148
7149 /* Show "xxx" with the attributes. */
7150 if (!did_header) {
7151 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)"xxx", syn_id2attr(id));
7152 msg_putchar(' ');
7153 }
7154
7155 return newline;
7156}
7157
7158/*
7159 * Set the attribute numbers for a highlight group.
7160 * Called after one of the attributes has changed.
7161 */
7162static void
7163set_hl_attr (
7164 int idx /* index in array */
7165)
7166{
7167 attrentry_T at_en;
7168 struct hl_group *sgp = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data))) + idx;
7169
7170 /* The "Normal" group doesn't need an attribute number */
7171 if (sgp->sg_name_u != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(sgp->sg_name_u, "NORMAL")strcmp((char *)(sgp->sg_name_u), (char *)("NORMAL")) == 0)
7172 return;
7173
7174 /*
7175 * For the term mode: If there are other than "normal" highlighting
7176 * attributes, need to allocate an attr number.
7177 */
7178 if (sgp->sg_start == NULL((void*)0) && sgp->sg_stop == NULL((void*)0))
7179 sgp->sg_term_attr = sgp->sg_term;
7180 else {
7181 at_en.ae_attr = sgp->sg_term;
7182 at_en.ae_u.term.start = sgp->sg_start;
7183 at_en.ae_u.term.stop = sgp->sg_stop;
7184 sgp->sg_term_attr = get_attr_entry(&term_attr_table, &at_en);
7185 }
7186
7187 /*
7188 * For the color term mode: If there are other than "normal"
7189 * highlighting attributes, need to allocate an attr number.
7190 */
7191 if (sgp->sg_cterm_fg == 0 && sgp->sg_cterm_bg == 0)
7192 sgp->sg_cterm_attr = sgp->sg_cterm;
7193 else {
7194 at_en.ae_attr = sgp->sg_cterm;
7195 at_en.ae_u.cterm.fg_color = sgp->sg_cterm_fg;
7196 at_en.ae_u.cterm.bg_color = sgp->sg_cterm_bg;
7197 sgp->sg_cterm_attr = get_attr_entry(&cterm_attr_table, &at_en);
7198 }
7199}
7200
7201/*
7202 * Lookup a highlight group name and return it's ID.
7203 * If it is not found, 0 is returned.
7204 */
7205int syn_name2id(char_u *name)
7206{
7207 int i;
7208 char_u name_u[200];
7209
7210 /* Avoid using stricmp() too much, it's slow on some systems */
7211 /* Avoid alloc()/free(), these are slow too. ID names over 200 chars
7212 * don't deserve to be found! */
7213 STRLCPY(name_u, name, 200)xstrlcpy((char *)(name_u), (char *)(name), (size_t)(200));
7214 vim_strup(name_u);
7215 for (i = highlight_ga.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
7216 if (HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[i].sg_name_u != NULL((void*)0)
7217 && STRCMP(name_u, HL_TABLE()[i].sg_name_u)strcmp((char *)(name_u), (char *)(((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga
.ga_data)))[i].sg_name_u)) == 0)
7218 break;
7219 return i + 1;
7220}
7221
7222/*
7223 * Return TRUE if highlight group "name" exists.
7224 */
7225int highlight_exists(char_u *name)
7226{
7227 return syn_name2id(name) > 0;
7228}
7229
7230/*
7231 * Return the name of highlight group "id".
7232 * When not a valid ID return an empty string.
7233 */
7234char_u *syn_id2name(int id)
7235{
7236 if (id <= 0 || id > highlight_ga.ga_len)
7237 return (char_u *)"";
7238 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[id - 1].sg_name;
7239}
7240
7241/*
7242 * Like syn_name2id(), but take a pointer + length argument.
7243 */
7244int syn_namen2id(char_u *linep, int len)
7245{
7246 char_u *name = vim_strnsave(linep, len);
7247 int id = syn_name2id(name);
7248 free(name);
7249
7250 return id;
7251}
7252
7253/*
7254 * Find highlight group name in the table and return it's ID.
7255 * The argument is a pointer to the name and the length of the name.
7256 * If it doesn't exist yet, a new entry is created.
7257 * Return 0 for failure.
7258 */
7259int syn_check_group(char_u *pp, int len)
7260{
7261 int id;
7262 char_u *name;
7263
7264 name = vim_strnsave(pp, len);
7265
7266 id = syn_name2id(name);
7267 if (id == 0) /* doesn't exist yet */
7268 id = syn_add_group(name);
7269 else
7270 free(name);
7271 return id;
7272}
7273
7274/*
7275 * Add new highlight group and return it's ID.
7276 * "name" must be an allocated string, it will be consumed.
7277 * Return 0 for failure.
7278 */
7279static int syn_add_group(char_u *name)
7280{
7281 char_u *p;
7282
7283 /* Check that the name is ASCII letters, digits and underscore. */
7284 for (p = name; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p) {
7285 if (!vim_isprintc(*p)) {
7286 EMSG(_("E669: Unprintable character in group name"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E669: Unprintable character in group name"
))));
7287 free(name);
7288 return 0;
7289 } else if (!ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)) || ((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10)) && *p != '_') {
7290 /* This is an error, but since there previously was no check only
7291 * give a warning. */
7292 msg_source(hl_attr(HLF_W)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_W)]);
7293 MSG(_("W18: Invalid character in group name"))msg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("W18: Invalid character in group name"
))));
7294 break;
7295 }
7296 }
7297
7298 /*
7299 * First call for this growarray: init growing array.
7300 */
7301 if (highlight_ga.ga_data == NULL((void*)0)) {
7302 highlight_ga.ga_itemsize = sizeof(struct hl_group);
7303 ga_set_growsize(&highlight_ga, 10);
7304 }
7305
7306 if (highlight_ga.ga_len >= MAX_HL_ID20000) {
7307 EMSG(_("E849: Too many highlight and syntax groups"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E849: Too many highlight and syntax groups"
))));
7308 free(name);
7309 return 0;
7310 }
7311
7312 // Append another syntax_highlight entry.
7313 struct hl_group* hlgp = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(struct hl_group, &highlight_ga)ga_append_via_ptr(&highlight_ga, sizeof(struct hl_group));
7314 memset(hlgp, 0, sizeof(*hlgp));
7315 hlgp->sg_name = name;
7316 hlgp->sg_name_u = vim_strsave_up(name);
7317
7318 return highlight_ga.ga_len; /* ID is index plus one */
7319}
7320
7321/*
7322 * When, just after calling syn_add_group(), an error is discovered, this
7323 * function deletes the new name.
7324 */
7325static void syn_unadd_group(void)
7326{
7327 --highlight_ga.ga_len;
7328 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[highlight_ga.ga_len].sg_name);
7329 free(HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[highlight_ga.ga_len].sg_name_u);
7330}
7331
7332/*
7333 * Translate a group ID to highlight attributes.
7334 */
7335int syn_id2attr(int hl_id)
7336{
7337 int attr;
7338 struct hl_group *sgp;
7339
7340 hl_id = syn_get_final_id(hl_id);
7341 sgp = &HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[hl_id - 1]; /* index is ID minus one */
7342
7343 if (t_colors > 1)
7344 attr = sgp->sg_cterm_attr;
7345 else
7346 attr = sgp->sg_term_attr;
7347
7348 return attr;
7349}
7350
7351
7352/*
7353 * Translate a group ID to the final group ID (following links).
7354 */
7355int syn_get_final_id(int hl_id)
7356{
7357 int count;
7358 struct hl_group *sgp;
7359
7360 if (hl_id > highlight_ga.ga_len || hl_id < 1)
7361 return 0; /* Can be called from eval!! */
7362
7363 /*
7364 * Follow links until there is no more.
7365 * Look out for loops! Break after 100 links.
7366 */
7367 for (count = 100; --count >= 0; ) {
7368 sgp = &HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[hl_id - 1]; /* index is ID minus one */
7369 if (sgp->sg_link == 0 || sgp->sg_link > highlight_ga.ga_len)
7370 break;
7371 hl_id = sgp->sg_link;
7372 }
7373
7374 return hl_id;
7375}
7376
7377
7378/*
7379 * Translate the 'highlight' option into attributes in highlight_attr[] and
7380 * set up the user highlights User1..9. A set of
7381 * corresponding highlights to use on top of HLF_SNC is computed.
7382 * Called only when the 'highlight' option has been changed and upon first
7383 * screen redraw after any :highlight command.
7384 * Return FAIL when an invalid flag is found in 'highlight'. OK otherwise.
7385 */
7386int highlight_changed(void)
7387{
7388 int hlf;
7389 int i;
7390 char_u *p;
7391 int attr;
7392 char_u *end;
7393 int id;
7394#ifdef USER_HIGHLIGHT
7395 char_u userhl[10];
7396 int id_SNC = -1;
7397 int id_S = -1;
7398 int hlcnt;
7399#endif
7400 static int hl_flags[HLF_COUNT] = HL_FLAGS{'8', '@', 'd', 'e', 'i', 'l', 'm', 'M', 'n', 'N', 'r', 's', 'S'
, 'c', 't', 'v', 'V', 'w', 'W', 'f', 'F', 'A', 'C', 'D', 'T',
'-', '>', 'B', 'P', 'R', 'L', '+', '=', 'x', 'X', '*', '#'
, '_', '!', '.', 'o'};
7401
7402 need_highlight_changed = FALSE0;
7403
7404 /*
7405 * Clear all attributes.
7406 */
7407 for (hlf = 0; hlf < (int)HLF_COUNT; ++hlf)
7408 highlight_attr[hlf] = 0;
7409
7410 /*
7411 * First set all attributes to their default value.
7412 * Then use the attributes from the 'highlight' option.
7413 */
7414 for (i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
7415 if (i)
7416 p = p_hl;
7417 else
7418 p = get_highlight_default();
7419 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) /* just in case */
7420 continue;
7421
7422 while (*p) {
7423 for (hlf = 0; hlf < (int)HLF_COUNT; ++hlf)
7424 if (hl_flags[hlf] == *p)
7425 break;
7426 ++p;
7427 if (hlf == (int)HLF_COUNT || *p == NUL'\000')
7428 return FAIL0;
7429
7430 /*
7431 * Allow several hl_flags to be combined, like "bu" for
7432 * bold-underlined.
7433 */
7434 attr = 0;
7435 for (; *p && *p != ','; ++p) { /* parse upto comma */
7436 if (vim_iswhite(*p)((*p) == ' ' || (*p) == '\t')) /* ignore white space */
7437 continue;
7438
7439 if (attr > HL_ALL0x3f) /* Combination with ':' is not allowed. */
7440 return FAIL0;
7441
7442 switch (*p) {
7443 case 'b': attr |= HL_BOLD0x02;
7444 break;
7445 case 'i': attr |= HL_ITALIC0x04;
7446 break;
7447 case '-':
7448 case 'n': /* no highlighting */
7449 break;
7450 case 'r': attr |= HL_INVERSE0x01;
7451 break;
7452 case 's': attr |= HL_STANDOUT0x20;
7453 break;
7454 case 'u': attr |= HL_UNDERLINE0x08;
7455 break;
7456 case 'c': attr |= HL_UNDERCURL0x10;
7457 break;
7458 case ':': ++p; /* highlight group name */
7459 if (attr || *p == NUL'\000') /* no combinations */
7460 return FAIL0;
7461 end = vim_strchr(p, ',');
7462 if (end == NULL((void*)0))
7463 end = p + STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
7464 id = syn_check_group(p, (int)(end - p));
7465 if (id == 0)
7466 return FAIL0;
7467 attr = syn_id2attr(id);
7468 p = end - 1;
7469#ifdef USER_HIGHLIGHT
7470 if (hlf == (int)HLF_SNC)
7471 id_SNC = syn_get_final_id(id);
7472 else if (hlf == (int)HLF_S)
7473 id_S = syn_get_final_id(id);
7474#endif
7475 break;
7476 default: return FAIL0;
7477 }
7478 }
7479 highlight_attr[hlf] = attr;
7480
7481 p = skip_to_option_part(p); /* skip comma and spaces */
7482 }
7483 }
7484
7485#ifdef USER_HIGHLIGHT
7486 /* Setup the user highlights
7487 *
7488 * Temporarily utilize 10 more hl entries. Have to be in there
7489 * simultaneously in case of table overflows in get_attr_entry()
7490 */
7491 ga_grow(&highlight_ga, 10);
7492 hlcnt = highlight_ga.ga_len;
7493 if (id_S == 0) { /* Make sure id_S is always valid to simplify code below */
7494 memset(&HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[hlcnt + 9], 0, sizeof(struct hl_group));
7495 HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[hlcnt + 9].sg_term = highlight_attr[HLF_S];
7496 id_S = hlcnt + 10;
7497 }
7498 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
7499 sprintf((char *)userhl, "User%d", i + 1);
7500 id = syn_name2id(userhl);
7501 if (id == 0) {
7502 highlight_user[i] = 0;
7503 highlight_stlnc[i] = 0;
7504 } else {
7505 struct hl_group *hlt = HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)));
7506
7507 highlight_user[i] = syn_id2attr(id);
7508 if (id_SNC == 0) {
7509 memset(&hlt[hlcnt + i], 0, sizeof(struct hl_group));
7510 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_term = highlight_attr[HLF_SNC];
7511 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_cterm = highlight_attr[HLF_SNC];
7512 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_gui = highlight_attr[HLF_SNC];
7513 } else
7514 memmove(&hlt[hlcnt + i],
7515 &hlt[id_SNC - 1],
7516 sizeof(struct hl_group));
7517 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_link = 0;
7518
7519 /* Apply difference between UserX and HLF_S to HLF_SNC */
7520 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_term ^=
7521 hlt[id - 1].sg_term ^ hlt[id_S - 1].sg_term;
7522 if (hlt[id - 1].sg_start != hlt[id_S - 1].sg_start)
7523 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_start = hlt[id - 1].sg_start;
7524 if (hlt[id - 1].sg_stop != hlt[id_S - 1].sg_stop)
7525 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_stop = hlt[id - 1].sg_stop;
7526 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_cterm ^=
7527 hlt[id - 1].sg_cterm ^ hlt[id_S - 1].sg_cterm;
7528 if (hlt[id - 1].sg_cterm_fg != hlt[id_S - 1].sg_cterm_fg)
7529 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_cterm_fg = hlt[id - 1].sg_cterm_fg;
7530 if (hlt[id - 1].sg_cterm_bg != hlt[id_S - 1].sg_cterm_bg)
7531 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_cterm_bg = hlt[id - 1].sg_cterm_bg;
7532 hlt[hlcnt + i].sg_gui ^=
7533 hlt[id - 1].sg_gui ^ hlt[id_S - 1].sg_gui;
7534 highlight_ga.ga_len = hlcnt + i + 1;
7535 set_hl_attr(hlcnt + i); /* At long last we can apply */
7536 highlight_stlnc[i] = syn_id2attr(hlcnt + i + 1);
7537 }
7538 }
7539 highlight_ga.ga_len = hlcnt;
7540
7541#endif /* USER_HIGHLIGHT */
7542
7543 return OK1;
7544}
7545
7546
7547/*
7548 * Handle command line completion for :highlight command.
7549 */
7550void set_context_in_highlight_cmd(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg)
7551{
7552 char_u *p;
7553
7554 /* Default: expand group names */
7555 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_HIGHLIGHT;
7556 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
7557 include_link = 2;
7558 include_default = 1;
7559
7560 /* (part of) subcommand already typed */
7561 if (*arg != NUL'\000') {
7562 p = skiptowhite(arg);
7563 if (*p != NUL'\000') { /* past "default" or group name */
7564 include_default = 0;
7565 if (STRNCMP("default", arg, p - arg)strncmp((char *)("default"), (char *)(arg), (size_t)(p - arg)
) == 0) {
7566 arg = skipwhite(p);
7567 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
7568 p = skiptowhite(arg);
7569 }
7570 if (*p != NUL'\000') { /* past group name */
7571 include_link = 0;
7572 if (arg[1] == 'i' && arg[0] == 'N')
7573 highlight_list();
7574 if (STRNCMP("link", arg, p - arg)strncmp((char *)("link"), (char *)(arg), (size_t)(p - arg)) == 0
7575 || STRNCMP("clear", arg, p - arg)strncmp((char *)("clear"), (char *)(arg), (size_t)(p - arg)) == 0) {
7576 xp->xp_pattern = skipwhite(p);
7577 p = skiptowhite(xp->xp_pattern);
7578 if (*p != NUL'\000') { /* past first group name */
7579 xp->xp_pattern = skipwhite(p);
7580 p = skiptowhite(xp->xp_pattern);
7581 }
7582 }
7583 if (*p != NUL'\000') /* past group name(s) */
7584 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
7585 }
7586 }
7587 }
7588}
7589
7590/*
7591 * List highlighting matches in a nice way.
7592 */
7593static void highlight_list(void)
7594{
7595 int i;
7596
7597 for (i = 10; --i >= 0; )
7598 highlight_list_two(i, hl_attr(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
7599 for (i = 40; --i >= 0; )
7600 highlight_list_two(99, 0);
7601}
7602
7603static void highlight_list_two(int cnt, int attr)
7604{
7605 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)&("N \bI \b! \b"[cnt / 11]), attr);
7606 msg_clr_eos();
7607 out_flush();
7608 ui_delay(cnt == 99 ? 40L : (long)cnt * 50L, false0);
7609}
7610
7611
7612/*
7613 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of group names.
7614 * Also used for synIDattr() function.
7615 */
7616char_u *get_highlight_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
7617{
7618 //TODO: 'xp' is unused
7619 if (idx == highlight_ga.ga_len && include_none != 0)
7620 return (char_u *)"none";
7621 if (idx == highlight_ga.ga_len + include_none && include_default != 0)
7622 return (char_u *)"default";
7623 if (idx == highlight_ga.ga_len + include_none + include_default
7624 && include_link != 0)
7625 return (char_u *)"link";
7626 if (idx == highlight_ga.ga_len + include_none + include_default + 1
7627 && include_link != 0)
7628 return (char_u *)"clear";
7629 if (idx < 0 || idx >= highlight_ga.ga_len)
7630 return NULL((void*)0);
7631 return HL_TABLE()((struct hl_group *)((highlight_ga.ga_data)))[idx].sg_name;
7632}
7633
7634
7635/**************************************
7636* End of Highlighting stuff *
7637**************************************/
